82da79c0-f1d7-4375-ba84-340fadc8f4a3.content: {It is mistaken to think that economic inequality directly affects freedom in the sense of negative liberty}, {Freedom as negative liberty is solely about the absence of interference by others}, {Economic inequality does not constitute interference by others, and thus does not affect negative liberty}

02f520fe-1cd6-4b28-937e-12055641bd83.summary: Supplementing with a focus on non-interference
02f520fe-1cd6-4b28-937e-12055641bd83.content: {Negative liberty can be supplemented with a focus on non-interference by others}, {Economic inequality does not involve direct interference by others}, {As long as there is no direct interference, a person is free in the sense of negative liberty, even if economic inequality limits their opportunities}

321a6d66-095f-4fa5-8c46-5eee82d7da8c.content: {Freedom is the ability to act in accordance with one's true self}, {A person is free if they can pursue their rational interests}, {Freedom involves self-mastery and self-realization}

025b1c9a-0aa5-4a6a-bee8-0c23431c70cb.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they act according to their desires and intentions}, {Determinism does not negate the possibility of freedom}

f3cfdb3d-279a-44ae-90dd-548517831c13.content: {Freedom is the capacity for autonomous decision-making}, {A person is free if they can make choices based on their own values and reasons}, {Autonomy requires the ability to reflect on and endorse one's desires}

8eb18857-a7fb-4e28-8ad8-0bb6461a411a.content: {Freedom is linked to moral responsibility}, {A person is free if they can be held accountable for their actions}, {Moral responsibility does not require the ability to have acted otherwise}

382c18d9-3eaa-41f7-9fa0-6474f69079d3.content: {Freedom is the exercise of rational agency}, {A person is free if they can act according to reason}, {Rational agency involves the capacity to evaluate and choose among reasons}

f47a7370-9e93-4fb5-873d-aae40b12f25c.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with higher-order desires}, {A person is free if their actions align with their reflective endorsements}, {Higher-order desires determine true freedom}

9406d0c3-d121-4fe1-8f5c-f733914ebee9.content: {Freedom is defined by social relationships}, {A person is free if they can engage in cooperative social interactions}, {Social structures can enhance or diminish freedom}

1f0592ec-1511-48bd-9ef9-1c5cd4d3aee9.content: {Freedom is the availability of opportunities}, {A person is free if they have a range of options to choose from}, {Opportunities are not negated by deterministic conditions}

ecd81e78-4682-4d2b-819e-3a620182f086.content: {Freedom is the expression of one's individuality}, {A person is free if they can express their unique identity}, {Individual expression is compatible with deterministic influences}

c94ab70d-4e4a-4de2-8324-4ac981fb39f3.content: {Freedom is the exercise of practical reason}, {A person is free if they can deliberate and choose based on practical reasoning}, {Practical reason involves evaluating means to achieve ends}

b78d2cd9-9ff1-4345-b7aa-091c131902a3.summary: Distinguishing between external constraints and internal determinism
b78d2cd9-9ff1-4345-b7aa-091c131902a3.content: {There is a distinction between external constraints and internal determinism}, {Negative liberty is concerned with the absence of external constraints, not with the metaphysical issue of determinism}, {The principle that freedom requires the ability to have acted otherwise is not relevant to negative liberty, which focuses on external interference}

33260290-33de-4a94-af46-158bf23f9993.summary: Rejecting the principle that freedom requires the ability to have acted otherwise
33260290-33de-4a94-af46-158bf23f9993.content: {It is false that freedom necessarily requires the ability to have acted otherwise}, {Freedom, in the context of negative liberty, is about the absence of external constraints, not about metaphysical possibilities}, {The intuition that freedom requires alternative possibilities is mistaken when considering negative liberty}

cb075aa5-1a8f-428e-abfd-53730ead7796.summary: Supplementing with a compatibilist understanding of freedom
cb075aa5-1a8f-428e-abfd-53730ead7796.content: {Compatibilism is the view that freedom is compatible with determinism}, {Negative liberty can be understood within a compatibilist framework where freedom is about the absence of external constraints, regardless of determinism}, {The appearance of incompatibility between freedom and determinism is resolved by adopting a compatibilist perspective}

8f454f6d-cc8a-4d53-b621-00b6c06fbfa0.content: {Freedom involves self-mastery and self-realization}, {A person is free if they can pursue their true interests and goals}, {Freedom requires the absence of internal constraints such as manipulated desires}

46076628-cb3f-4eae-97be-79778c681d16.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference}, {Freedom requires protection against both external and internal forms of control}

989d7e45-887b-4051-a45f-b4daa1f1cc8b.content: {Freedom is the capacity to make autonomous choices}, {A person is free if they can reflect on and endorse their desires}, {Freedom requires the ability to critically assess one's own motivations}

20be7c8f-f1ec-47ea-872a-5eb3f5000758.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Freedom requires both the absence of constraints and the presence of enabling conditions}

7df782c2-2bdb-4ed9-81c8-1e4ebd10a425.content: {Freedom is constituted by social relationships and structures}, {A person is free if they are embedded in supportive and non-oppressive social contexts}, {Freedom requires the presence of empowering social conditions}

392cd9f3-b9b5-4d98-b8ed-cd0703edb158.summary: Distinguishing between external and internal constraints
392cd9f3-b9b5-4d98-b8ed-cd0703edb158.content: {There is a distinction between external constraints and internal constraints}, {Negative liberty is a theory about freedom from external constraints only}, {Psychological manipulation is an internal constraint and does not affect negative liberty}, {The intuition that manipulation affects freedom can be explained by confusing internal constraints with external ones}

9aa0ec5c-26ab-4245-8d89-d48c6fd0aa19.summary: Rejecting the intuition that manipulation affects freedom
9aa0ec5c-26ab-4245-8d89-d48c6fd0aa19.content: {It is false that psychological manipulation affects a person's freedom in terms of negative liberty}, {Freedom in the sense of negative liberty is solely about the absence of external constraints}, {The intuition that manipulation affects freedom is mistaken when considering negative liberty}

afeaf601-090e-4889-85d6-7ac72d875e45.summary: Supplementing with a distinction between autonomy and freedom
afeaf601-090e-4889-85d6-7ac72d875e45.content: {Autonomy and freedom are distinct concepts}, {Negative liberty concerns freedom, not autonomy}, {Psychological manipulation affects autonomy but not freedom in the sense of negative liberty}, {The objection confuses issues of autonomy with issues of freedom}

58aa4d2e-a29a-48c6-8480-b6fb9a06c1b2.content: {Freedom involves self-mastery or control over one's own desires and impulses}, {A person is free if they have control over their internal desires and impulses}, {Freedom requires more than just the absence of external constraints}

0a94c5c2-8dd9-45fd-a5cd-1bb760977f0c.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to one's own rational will}, {A person is free if they can make decisions based on rational deliberation}, {Freedom involves the capacity for self-governance}

1f44ac95-bbca-416f-a3fd-98d1de26ac70.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Freedom requires both internal and external conditions to be met}

6c2a0952-9218-465c-b07c-69377e6af619.content: {Freedom is the absence of both internal and external constraints}, {A person is free if they are not prevented by others from doing what they want}, {A person is free if they are not hindered by internal factors such as desires and impulses}

cdd72bb0-3f1f-4f69-b433-1642595dc37a.content: {Freedom involves both external non-interference and internal self-control}, {A person is free if they are not externally constrained by others}, {A person is free if they have mastery over their internal desires and impulses}

342ac3a6-9cd1-487a-b8ef-7b6b3bd2fb88.summary: Distinguishing between external and internal constraints
342ac3a6-9cd1-487a-b8ef-7b6b3bd2fb88.content: {There is a distinction between external constraints and internal constraints}, {Negative liberty is a theory about freedom from external constraints, not internal ones}, {Self-mastery pertains to internal constraints and is not relevant to the concept of negative liberty}, {The intuition that freedom requires self-mastery can be explained as a confusion between external and internal constraints}

2f62a94e-56e0-4a8c-994e-34ce469d8526.summary: Rejecting the necessity of self-mastery for freedom
2f62a94e-56e0-4a8c-994e-34ce469d8526.content: {It is false that freedom necessarily involves self-mastery}, {Freedom as negative liberty is solely concerned with the absence of external constraints}, {The presence of internal desires or impulses does not negate the absence of external constraints}, {The principle that freedom requires self-mastery is mistaken when applied to negative liberty}

27f3df7f-9968-4c5c-9385-ded5595e7341.summary: Supplementing with a focus on external conditions
27f3df7f-9968-4c5c-9385-ded5595e7341.content: {Negative liberty focuses on the external conditions that allow for freedom}, {Self-mastery is an internal condition and not part of the external conditions addressed by negative liberty}, {The absence of external constraints is sufficient for negative liberty, regardless of internal self-mastery}, {The objection loses its force when considering that negative liberty does not address internal conditions}

c33c2485-eb64-4673-ac77-e0533b4301a8.summary: Revised Positive Liberty with Internal Constraints
c33c2485-eb64-4673-ac77-e0533b4301a8.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Freedom requires the absence of internal constraints that prevent rational decision-making}

58b3a127-36a7-4bbd-a4c9-a3e074467d9f.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {A person is free if they can determine their own desires and actions without internal compulsion}

78554fcc-6ca8-4e16-b4e6-8ec9b2e34849.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Freedom requires the capacity to control one's desires and impulses}

75ea180e-429a-48b3-8b6a-838efa20b3a7.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Freedom requires an integrated self where rational and emotional aspects are aligned}

f0059ce9-114a-4649-9ccf-69a4bf8084b7.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Freedom requires that one's will is authentic and not distorted by internal constraints}

0e828ca3-b965-4703-942f-01fe3f96cb89.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Freedom involves realizing one's true self without internal hindrances}

363aaebf-ef9b-4516-9f7e-16f9c2b9eae6.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Freedom requires that one's actions are reflectively endorsed by their rational self}

fc198cb2-7623-47b4-9d9f-82695cff58d2.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Freedom requires holistic autonomy, integrating rational and emotional capacities}

9c2643f0-a36b-49a0-8c30-e39def4d4c6b.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Freedom requires self-governance, free from internal compulsions}

549eae43-211e-43a4-aa53-81610cb96d9f.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Freedom requires maintaining rational integrity against internal disruptions}

53e29246-5a31-4adb-bfde-78a805356af5.summary: Distinguishing between rational and irrational will
53e29246-5a31-4adb-bfde-78a805356af5.content: {There is a distinction between acting according to one's rational will and acting according to one's irrational desires}, {Positive liberty is concerned with the ability to pursue one's rational will, not irrational desires}, {Addiction represents an irrational desire that does not align with one's rational will}, {A person addicted to a substance is not acting according to their rational will, and thus their freedom is not compromised by internal constraints in the relevant sense}

d6e65fe6-ad3f-4171-b74e-31ad5d3921a9.summary: Rejecting the intuition that addiction negates freedom
d6e65fe6-ad3f-4171-b74e-31ad5d3921a9.content: {It is mistaken to claim that addiction inherently negates freedom}, {A person can still be free if they have the capacity to recognize and pursue their rational will despite addiction}, {The presence of addiction does not necessarily prevent rational decision-making if the person can still act in accordance with their rational will}

3fcde5ac-2efa-4cfb-b771-9e29c900a186.summary: Supplementing with the concept of higher-order desires
3fcde5ac-2efa-4cfb-b771-9e29c900a186.content: {Higher-order desires are desires about one's own desires, such as wanting to want something}, {Freedom involves the alignment of one's first-order desires with their higher-order desires}, {In the case of addiction, the lack of freedom arises from the misalignment between first-order desires and higher-order desires}, {By incorporating higher-order desires, the objection loses its force as freedom is defined by the ability to align these desires}

5dcf5011-8a15-48ed-b11d-175dacdcd18c.summary: Revised Positive Liberty with Objective Rationality
5dcf5011-8a15-48ed-b11d-175dacdcd18c.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Rational will is determined by objective standards of rationality}, {Objective standards of rationality exclude self-destructive desires}

555a14b4-7a5c-4cb5-be09-c3582f489053.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Rational will is determined by higher-order desires}, {Higher-order desires can override self-destructive first-order desires}

9be613d0-5885-4879-b3e5-8536930fab62.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Rational will is defined by authentic desires}, {Authentic desires are those that align with a person's true self}

2aaead1c-40c7-49bb-8eb2-56f8878e0ddf.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Rational will requires reflective endorsement of desires}, {Reflective endorsement involves critical evaluation of desires}

fbe367d2-00ac-416b-970a-dcc927af9ec4.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Rational will is constrained by moral principles}, {Moral principles exclude self-destructive desires}

b953ceec-2c9c-46fc-a7e6-eb3d5bfad483.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Rational will is defined by autonomous decision-making}, {Autonomous decision-making excludes coerced or manipulated desires}

27b3479a-f43b-47ac-9d9d-0344d4068446.summary: Positive Liberty with Ideal Observer Theory
27b3479a-f43b-47ac-9d9d-0344d4068446.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Rational will is determined by what an ideal observer would endorse}, {An ideal observer would not endorse self-destructive desires}

0cc07ac6-3ce1-40cc-9db7-bf2114666419.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Rational will is determined by coherence among desires}, {Coherence among desires excludes self-destructive tendencies}

f6f7d871-46a4-4ad3-b50e-1483dcdae27d.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Rational will is aligned with virtuous character traits}, {Virtuous character traits exclude self-destructive desires}

4c97d903-805c-4824-9f85-b87a0238376e.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Rational will is guided by prudential reasoning}, {Prudential reasoning excludes desires that harm long-term well-being}

367ee524-4e18-462b-be64-1230b689e650.summary: Distinguishing between rational and irrational desires
367ee524-4e18-462b-be64-1230b689e650.content: {There is a distinction between rational desires and irrational desires.}, {Positive liberty concerns the pursuit of rational desires, not irrational ones.}, {A self-destructive desire is an irrational desire and thus not part of one's rational will.}, {The intuition that pursuing self-destruction is not freedom is consistent with positive liberty when irrational desires are excluded.}

d3b95a3c-0bb4-410d-9cd5-26c1cd89de95.summary: Rejecting the intuition that self-destructive behavior is rational
d3b95a3c-0bb4-410d-9cd5-26c1cd89de95.content: {It is false that self-destructive behavior can be rationalized as part of one's rational will.}, {Rational will inherently excludes desires that lead to self-destruction.}, {The appearance of rationality in self-destructive behavior is a misinterpretation of rational will.}

d60aa89a-6fc2-4e1a-b741-981d7778f53e.summary: Supplementing with a criterion for rationality
d60aa89a-6fc2-4e1a-b741-981d7778f53e.content: {A supplementary criterion for rationality can be introduced to clarify rational will.}, {This criterion involves coherence with long-term well-being and self-mastery.}, {Desires that undermine long-term well-being are excluded from rational will.}, {With this criterion, the objection loses its force as self-destructive desires are not rational.}

7b8adc37-3a9c-4e5c-9b17-3cc8e87dbf9d.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {A person's rational will must be authentically their own for them to be free}, {Authenticity requires that a person's rational will is not the result of manipulation or coercion}

d8986510-dfba-4b86-9361-6cf5087cb700.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {A person's rational will must be subject to critical reflection for them to be free}, {Critical reflection involves questioning and evaluating one's own desires and beliefs}

77f613cd-dd9d-4d4e-be44-07f584a7977a.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {A person is autonomous if they can form their own desires and beliefs independently}, {Autonomy requires that a person's rational will is not shaped by external manipulation}

438a06ae-60fd-4d8d-a0f2-f358557c57da.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {A person's rational will must be informed by accurate and comprehensive information for them to be free}, {Informed will requires access to diverse perspectives and facts}

6a7cd52c-9508-43f1-8d4d-f7b6a30bbfb9.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {A person is free from domination if they are not subject to arbitrary interference}, {Non-domination requires that a person's rational will is not controlled by others}

8fb88a93-96e3-467f-ac2e-9f26ed734ec1.summary: Distinguishing between authentic and manipulated rational will
8fb88a93-96e3-467f-ac2e-9f26ed734ec1.content: {There is a distinction between an authentic rational will and a manipulated rational will}, {Positive liberty is concerned with the pursuit of an authentic rational will}, {A rational will shaped by intense propaganda is not considered authentic}, {The intuition that a person under propaganda is not free can be explained by the lack of authenticity in their rational will}

f7dd7808-33b4-4fd9-b993-9952ba2d8a03.summary: Rejecting the intuition that external influence negates freedom
f7dd7808-33b4-4fd9-b993-9952ba2d8a03.content: {It is false that external influences necessarily negate freedom}, {A person can still be free if they critically reflect on and endorse their influenced rational will}, {The presence of external influence does not automatically undermine the ability to be one's own master}

6b5c13ea-1829-41ae-a06c-773d79db30a6.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of critical reflection
6b5c13ea-1829-41ae-a06c-773d79db30a6.content: {Freedom requires the capacity for critical reflection on one's rational will}, {A person influenced by propaganda can still be free if they have the ability to critically assess and endorse their influenced desires}, {The intuition that freedom is undermined by external influence is addressed by the capacity for critical reflection}

95acd012-ab63-4406-a5af-cc204471fbdd.content: {Freedom is the ability to act in accordance with one's rational will}, {A person is free if they pursue actions that align with their rational deliberations}, {Freedom involves the capacity to reflect on and endorse one's desires through reason}

b08ff2ad-04a0-4a60-987b-0f060e35f1bf.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to higher-order desires}, {A person is free if their actions align with desires they have reflectively endorsed}, {Freedom requires the capacity to evaluate and prioritize one's desires}

975d3cd0-ca47-464e-b270-065c93102026.content: {Freedom is the ability to act in accordance with one's authentic self}, {A person is free if they act in ways that express their true self}, {Freedom involves aligning actions with one's core values and beliefs}

72c64106-0d64-4a6e-9e15-ad5ac9aaaddb.content: {Freedom is the ability to act in accordance with reason}, {A person is free if they act based on rational deliberation}, {Freedom requires the capacity to distinguish between rational and irrational desires}

e9fa4b8e-7b69-4d13-8e35-fed981e751a5.content: {Freedom is the ability to act on desires that one reflectively endorses}, {A person is free if they act on desires that have been critically evaluated}, {Freedom involves the capacity for self-reflection and rational endorsement of desires}

3d993bdd-03a5-4409-8c08-139bdf66cf52.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to one's rational will}, {A person is free if their actions are guided by rational principles}, {Freedom requires the capacity to act in accordance with reason rather than impulse}

781595c0-38d0-445f-89e1-42a5c6b5c383.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself through reason}, {A person is free if they exercise self-control in accordance with rational deliberation}, {Freedom involves the capacity to regulate one's actions through rational self-governance}

8586fa9a-c998-44c9-bb52-e78d8baec662.content: {Freedom is the ability to act in a rationally coherent manner}, {A person is free if their actions are consistent with their rational beliefs and goals}, {Freedom requires the capacity to maintain coherence between one's actions and rational commitments}

04ce67f2-136b-4f0e-be11-483a0e37bebc.content: {Freedom is the ability to fulfill rational desires}, {A person is free if they pursue desires that are rationally justified}, {Freedom involves the capacity to distinguish and act upon rationally justified desires}

14e68dff-b0d5-431d-8b07-59dee1378883.content: {Freedom is the ability to act following rational deliberation}, {A person is free if their actions result from careful rational consideration}, {Freedom requires the capacity to deliberate rationally about one's actions}

3db240cb-7064-40bc-aca2-d768c5bcde01.summary: Distinguishing between rational and irrational desires
3db240cb-7064-40bc-aca2-d768c5bcde01.content: {There is a distinction between rational desires and irrational desires.}, {Positive liberty is concerned with the ability to act on rational desires rather than any desire.}, {A person acting on irrational desires is not exercising positive liberty, as they are not pursuing their rational will.}, {The intuition that acting on a whim is not true freedom aligns with the focus on rational desires in positive liberty.}

f2a8bf44-2360-4d67-b976-a9cd8ee7aeae.summary: Rejecting the principle that freedom requires rational action
f2a8bf44-2360-4d67-b976-a9cd8ee7aeae.content: {It is false that freedom necessarily involves acting in accordance with reason.}, {Freedom can involve acting on any desire, rational or irrational, as long as it is the individual's own choice.}, {The intuition that acting on a whim is not true freedom can be explained by societal norms rather than a lack of freedom.}

6bd15d7e-9642-4aa7-8eb5-c0fcfe364b1a.summary: Supplementing with the concept of higher-order desires
6bd15d7e-9642-4aa7-8eb5-c0fcfe364b1a.content: {A higher-order desire is a desire about one's own desires, such as wanting to want something.}, {Positive liberty can be understood as the ability to act on higher-order desires rather than first-order desires.}, {A person is free if they can align their actions with their higher-order desires, even if their first-order desires are irrational.}, {The intuition that acting on a whim is not true freedom is explained by the lack of alignment with higher-order desires.}

860c37b2-bfd2-4e37-8010-34363f791d60.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Paternalistic interventions are not justified if they conflict with individual autonomy}

6cb87ac1-6f66-47a8-8edf-62e556b15328.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Paternalistic interventions are justified only if individuals consent to them}

33990f36-1142-49af-bae4-cf23d24b6382.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Paternalistic interventions must be non-coercive to be justified}

862ae301-7b65-43e9-9358-a8873852e9a0.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Paternalistic interventions are justified only if they result from democratic deliberation}

dbbc16d6-5011-44b8-aad7-9b77498b7349.summary: Positive Liberty with Minimal State Intervention
dbbc16d6-5011-44b8-aad7-9b77498b7349.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {State interventions should be minimal and only to prevent harm to others}

c2192edc-a353-49d0-bc40-284b9624a54a.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Paternalistic interventions should focus on empowering individuals to make their own choices}

ba876ab2-4da4-40c2-871c-486f5da1727d.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Rational autonomy is prioritized over paternalistic interventions}

97dd4184-e424-4622-89ef-bd4ca62a3a4d.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Guidance is justified only if it is voluntarily accepted by individuals}

904eabfd-02f9-4204-9c02-64ae8ee33efa.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Paternalistic interventions are justified only in specific contexts where rational will is clearly enhanced}

e038b915-790c-4fd0-965c-ea6a89ccca54.summary: Positive Liberty with Emphasis on Self-Development
e038b915-790c-4fd0-965c-ea6a89ccca54.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Interventions should aim at fostering self-development rather than imposing external rationality}

912d31b8-c07b-4426-95e9-a324be558309.summary: Distinguishing between internal and external constraints
912d31b8-c07b-4426-95e9-a324be558309.content: {There is a distinction between internal constraints, which are self-imposed, and external constraints, which are imposed by others}, {Positive liberty is concerned with overcoming internal constraints to achieve self-mastery}, {Paternalistic laws are external constraints and do not align with the concept of positive liberty as self-mastery}, {The intuition that paternalistic laws enhance freedom is a misunderstanding of positive liberty, which focuses on internal self-governance}

bc208de1-7f53-4180-910d-af59eadc3db8.summary: Rejecting the intuition that paternalism enhances freedom
bc208de1-7f53-4180-910d-af59eadc3db8.content: {It is false that paternalistic interventions inherently enhance freedom}, {Freedom as positive liberty requires that individuals pursue their rational will without external imposition}, {Paternalistic laws restrict freedom by imposing an external will, even if intended to promote rationality}, {The appearance of enhanced freedom through paternalism is mistaken, as true freedom involves self-directed rational pursuit}

22ce3aef-86c4-4786-a976-4afce082ec9c.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of informed consent
22ce3aef-86c4-4786-a976-4afce082ec9c.content: {Positive liberty can be supplemented with the assumption that individuals must give informed consent to interventions}, {Paternalistic laws can only be justified if individuals consent to them as a means to achieve their rational will}, {The concept of positive liberty remains intact if paternalism is only applied with informed consent}, {This assumption resolves the conflict between positive liberty and individual autonomy by ensuring voluntary acceptance}

63342133-0950-4f1e-a54d-255f9981db55.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {For a person to be free, it is necessary that they have self-awareness of their motivations and desires}

877f78f7-d112-4e52-9ac7-6daa4a2d975c.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {For a person to be free, it is necessary that they autonomously choose their actions based on self-reflection}

cda0cd4c-f0a0-464e-b470-5a0c90cd90fc.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {For a person to be free, it is necessary that they consciously direct their actions}

9db1e246-471e-49ee-b693-b770de7b7b65.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {For a person to be free, it is necessary that they have conscious awareness of their rational will}

77af53a6-ce9b-4ac8-85c1-98ce93e66094.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {For a person to be free, it is necessary that they reflect on their desires and motivations}

74a0ecf7-221f-47bd-ad31-93bb8b9be54a.summary: Distinguishing between rational will and self-awareness
74a0ecf7-221f-47bd-ad31-93bb8b9be54a.content: {There is a distinction between acting according to one's rational will and being self-aware of one's motivations.}, {Positive liberty is a theory about acting according to one's rational will, not necessarily about self-awareness.}, {A person can be free in the sense of positive liberty even if they lack self-awareness, as long as they act according to their rational will.}, {The intuition that self-awareness is necessary for freedom can be explained as a confusion between different senses of freedom.}

a93a2e46-b563-4c8c-8747-f51f5ab00e88.summary: Rejecting the necessity of self-awareness for freedom
a93a2e46-b563-4c8c-8747-f51f5ab00e88.content: {It is false that self-awareness is necessary for freedom.}, {Freedom as positive liberty is about the alignment of actions with rational will, not about conscious reflection.}, {A person can be free if their actions align with their rational will, regardless of their level of self-awareness.}

fe298a2f-a6cb-4e73-9b18-dabeba2f6710.summary: Supplementing with the concept of implicit rationality
fe298a2f-a6cb-4e73-9b18-dabeba2f6710.content: {Implicit rationality refers to the idea that one can act rationally without explicit self-awareness.}, {Positive liberty can include actions guided by implicit rationality, where one acts in accordance with rational will without conscious reflection.}, {The appearance of lacking freedom due to lack of self-awareness is explained by recognizing implicit rationality as a form of rational will.}

c013e1d8-000c-480b-8722-85da25dd7812.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to one's own rational will}, {A person is free if they are morally responsible for their actions}, {Moral responsibility requires the absence of coercion}

e3a63042-f625-4724-a7ec-4b5c51767562.content: {Freedom is the ability to pursue one's rational will}, {A person is free if they are accountable for their actions}, {Accountability requires that actions are not coerced}

7b3f4c3e-5d01-4fd3-9cc4-d029464b9998.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they are a moral agent}, {Moral agency requires the capacity to make uncoerced decisions}

59813df1-bbca-4a09-adf5-b61997c2621e.content: {Freedom is the ability to act autonomously according to rational will}, {A person is free if they are responsible for their actions}, {Responsibility requires freedom from coercion}

f4a390b7-9aaa-4b73-b4f1-dd81ed8ef91f.content: {Freedom is the ability to be morally autonomous}, {A person is free if they can pursue their rational will without coercion}, {Moral autonomy requires responsibility for one's actions}

1bcc037a-6678-4830-9aa1-a014c34d6b38.summary: Distinguishing between freedom and moral responsibility
1bcc037a-6678-4830-9aa1-a014c34d6b38.content: {There is a distinction between freedom and moral responsibility}, {Positive liberty is a theory about freedom as self-mastery, not about moral responsibility}, {A person can be free in the sense of pursuing their rational will even if they are not morally responsible for their actions}, {The intuition that freedom requires moral responsibility can be explained as a conflation of distinct concepts}

b5a81582-bea7-4c3d-aa15-5700d49754cf.summary: Rejecting the necessity of moral responsibility for freedom
b5a81582-bea7-4c3d-aa15-5700d49754cf.content: {It is false that moral responsibility is necessary for freedom}, {Freedom as the ability to pursue one's rational will does not inherently require moral responsibility}, {A person can be free if they act according to their rational will, regardless of their moral accountability}

a021f859-3fd3-4ae5-8970-08e3081045af.summary: Supplementing with a distinction between internal and external constraints
a021f859-3fd3-4ae5-8970-08e3081045af.content: {Freedom involves overcoming internal constraints, such as irrational desires, to pursue one's rational will}, {Moral responsibility is more concerned with external constraints, such as social or legal accountability}, {A person can be free in the sense of positive liberty by overcoming internal constraints, even if they are not externally accountable}

7d36fad4-94ae-4d97-992c-0bba34288917.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person can be free even if they cannot act otherwise}

adc90075-b5ee-441c-9bda-fd0ede6970aa.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Rational autonomy involves acting according to one's rational will}, {A person is free if they act autonomously, regardless of alternative possibilities}

071a9c31-c53e-423c-a6dc-5790f3525c16.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Freedom involves higher-order desires aligning with one's rational will}, {A person is free if their actions align with their higher-order desires, even without alternative actions}

7d901466-2485-43b2-b086-c1557cc58f28.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Freedom is determined by the alignment of actions with one's values}, {A person is free if their actions reflect their values, regardless of alternative possibilities}

5690d633-0024-40b1-884f-81791c1c17fa.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Freedom involves the realization of one's true self}, {A person is free if they act in accordance with their true self, even if no alternatives exist}

9b9bae71-edbd-4d05-ae6e-cb5eb499ce6d.summary: Distinguishing between rational determination and external compulsion
9b9bae71-edbd-4d05-ae6e-cb5eb499ce6d.content: {There is a distinction between being determined by one's rational will and being compelled by external forces}, {Freedom as positive liberty is concerned with self-mastery, not the availability of alternative actions}, {A person determined by their rational will is not unfree in the relevant sense, as they are acting according to their own rational deliberation}, {The intuition that freedom requires alternative actions can be explained as a confusion between self-determination and external compulsion}

5ad98c4b-41bf-4f00-983b-3b8875df4bfd.summary: Rejecting the necessity of alternative possibilities for freedom
5ad98c4b-41bf-4f00-983b-3b8875df4bfd.content: {It is false that freedom necessarily requires the ability to choose between different courses of action}, {Freedom as positive liberty is about the alignment of one's actions with one's rational will, not the presence of multiple options}, {A person who acts according to their rational will is free, even if they have no alternative actions available}

ca20a2c0-cece-4d75-b283-146dd693e2b7.summary: Supplementing with the concept of rational endorsement
ca20a2c0-cece-4d75-b283-146dd693e2b7.content: {Freedom involves the rational endorsement of one's actions, not merely the availability of alternatives}, {A person is free if they act in accordance with their rational will, which they endorse upon reflection}, {The appearance of lacking freedom due to a single course of action is mitigated by the person's rational endorsement of that action}

5b1e6d7a-c858-4ff2-ae44-335fce06cd18.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Social conditions are necessary for the realization of freedom}, {A person is not free if social conditions prevent the pursuit of their rational will}

0ff9ec4e-0e52-4bb4-a3c1-7cabf22fab9b.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Access to resources is necessary for the realization of freedom}, {A person is not free if lack of resources prevents the pursuit of their rational will}

c3d3b04d-d952-4dc0-9abe-73003b52d80d.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Freedom is inherently relational and depends on interactions with others}, {A person is not free if isolation from others prevents the pursuit of their rational will}

bd1885f5-5d8d-4ffa-a726-7886e301ae96.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {The context of social and environmental conditions is necessary for the realization of freedom}, {A person is not free if contextual conditions prevent the pursuit of their rational will}

75534ca9-0168-4cdb-a34c-b8c180e08195.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {Community support is necessary for the realization of freedom}, {A person is not free if lack of community support prevents the pursuit of their rational will}

90600116-a034-4eda-a4da-c6e77b9cf12b.summary: Distinguishing between internal and external conditions for freedom
90600116-a034-4eda-a4da-c6e77b9cf12b.content: {There is a distinction between internal freedom, which is the ability to pursue one's rational will, and external conditions that facilitate or hinder this pursuit}, {Positive liberty is primarily concerned with internal freedom, not the external conditions}, {A person can be internally free even if external conditions are not conducive to exercising that freedom}, {The intuition that freedom requires social conditions can be explained by conflating internal freedom with external facilitation}

9152bc2c-8c14-42b8-bb2d-9a8d90b1fe8b.summary: Rejecting the necessity of social conditions for freedom
9152bc2c-8c14-42b8-bb2d-9a8d90b1fe8b.content: {It is false that social conditions are necessary for the realization of positive liberty}, {Freedom as the ability to be one's own master does not inherently depend on social conditions}, {A person can possess positive liberty even in isolation if they have the capacity to pursue their rational will}, {The limitation of resources or social interaction does not negate the internal aspect of freedom}

771ec80d-9c34-4711-8ff4-8ea3044a2b39.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of potential freedom
771ec80d-9c34-4711-8ff4-8ea3044a2b39.content: {Positive liberty can be understood as including potential freedom, which is the capacity to pursue one's rational will under ideal conditions}, {The lack of resources or social interaction does not negate the potential freedom a person possesses}, {The realization of positive liberty can be seen as contingent on potential freedom rather than immediate social conditions}, {The intuition that freedom requires social conditions can be explained by the difference between potential and actualized freedom}

661e4233-11b7-4ff2-8dc4-fc6c36ac359d.summary: Freedom as Self-Mastery and Goal Achievement
661e4233-11b7-4ff2-8dc4-fc6c36ac359d.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {A person is free if they can achieve their rational goals}

bc246cc9-78ec-4063-a23e-c8947e57fb42.summary: Freedom as Non-Interference and Rational Will
bc246cc9-78ec-4063-a23e-c8947e57fb42.content: {Freedom is the absence of external interference}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {A person is free if they are not hindered by external obstacles}

2db37bdb-b3e9-4813-916a-534ba4f26386.summary: Freedom as Autonomy and Effective Agency
2db37bdb-b3e9-4813-916a-534ba4f26386.content: {Freedom is the ability to act autonomously}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {A person is free if they can effectively act on their decisions}

73823937-df72-4411-aab1-4836ea3e82df.summary: Freedom as Capability and Rational Pursuit
73823937-df72-4411-aab1-4836ea3e82df.content: {Freedom is the capability to achieve one's goals}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {A person is free if they have the means to realize their aims}

9446351a-2d69-4bab-8be1-1ac6728e7aae.content: {Freedom is the power of self-determination}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own rational will}, {A person is free if they can successfully achieve their rational objectives}

faa40ad0-ed34-4563-973d-187f1d0b2826.content: {There is a distinction between the pursuit of rational will and the achievement of goals}, {Positive liberty is concerned with the pursuit of rational will rather than the achievement of goals}, {A person can be free in the sense of positive liberty even if external circumstances prevent the achievement of their goals}, {The intuition that a person is not free if they do not achieve their goals can be explained as a confusion between pursuit and achievement}

0a01cdf5-2877-4d08-b244-c911449a8f12.summary: Rejecting the necessity of goal achievement for freedom
0a01cdf5-2877-4d08-b244-c911449a8f12.content: {It is false that achieving one's goals is necessary for freedom}, {Freedom as positive liberty is about the ability to pursue one's rational will, not the success of that pursuit}, {The presence of external obstacles does not negate the freedom to pursue one's rational will}

2704e76e-551c-4c6a-8344-aaf8d901d1fe.summary: Supplementing with the concept of internal freedom
2704e76e-551c-4c6a-8344-aaf8d901d1fe.content: {Internal freedom refers to the ability to align one's actions with one's rational will}, {Positive liberty is primarily concerned with internal freedom rather than external success}, {A person can be free in the sense of positive liberty if they maintain internal freedom, even if external circumstances prevent success}

59a5dcd5-817d-42fe-99b0-a5a457549cd0.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Freedom requires institutional safeguards that prevent the potential for interference}

c0465833-c8a1-48c5-b477-269ca48a75e1.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Freedom requires social norms that discourage the potential for interference}

79af4186-b0e7-4320-9ad5-3a495d902d06.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Freedom requires legal protections that eliminate the potential for interference}

ccd36819-5fc4-4d08-bb65-c23436a15243.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Freedom requires a balance of power that prevents the potential for interference}

560d9739-ae45-48d0-917e-c992cb377856.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Freedom requires collective vigilance to guard against the potential for interference}

0bb99110-34e1-473f-9a43-b5b57a045f5a.summary: Distinguishing between actual and potential interference
0bb99110-34e1-473f-9a43-b5b57a045f5a.content: {There is a distinction between actual interference and potential interference}, {Republican Liberty is a theory about the absence of actual domination rather than potential interference}, {The potential for interference does not constitute actual domination if it does not result in arbitrary interference}, {A person is free if they are not subject to actual arbitrary interference, even if potential interference exists}

31ab8c77-da34-43a9-b788-a5aba8c4604e.summary: Rejecting the principle that potential interference undermines freedom
31ab8c77-da34-43a9-b788-a5aba8c4604e.content: {It is false that the potential for interference necessarily undermines freedom}, {Freedom as the absence of domination focuses on actual instances of arbitrary interference}, {The presence of potential interference does not imply actual domination or lack of freedom}

51d5ba2b-9aac-4099-b5da-b3a07ebda86c.summary: Supplementing with a condition of non-arbitrariness
51d5ba2b-9aac-4099-b5da-b3a07ebda86c.content: {Freedom requires the absence of arbitrary interference, not the absence of all potential interference}, {A supplementary condition is that any potential interference must be non-arbitrary to preserve freedom}, {If potential interference is non-arbitrary, it does not undermine freedom as defined by Republican Liberty}

09060001-535c-48aa-8d89-a1ec21097416.content: {Freedom is the absence of arbitrary interference}, {A person is free if they are not subject to interference that is arbitrary}, {Interference is arbitrary if it is not guided by the interests and values of the person affected}

188a4240-ee28-43aa-8ad5-62fd84bb9cda.content: {Freedom is the absence of interference without consent}, {A person is free if they are not subject to interference without their consent}, {Consent transforms interference into a non-dominating act}

3aae0e76-81b7-42e3-89a2-d7c8c18f6dbf.content: {Freedom is the absence of irrational interference}, {A person is free if they are not subject to interference that is irrational}, {Interference is rational if it aligns with the person's rational interests and values}

7538a367-0920-4779-b6e3-cba1b4d2e939.content: {Freedom is the absence of interference in contexts where it is not justified}, {A person is free if they are not subject to interference in contexts where it is unjustified}, {Justification of interference depends on the context and the person's interests}

c60b7d4e-d7c2-433f-a713-d4b630f4661c.content: {Freedom is the absence of interference that undermines autonomy}, {A person is free if they are not subject to interference that undermines their autonomy}, {Autonomy is the capacity to make one's own decisions}

c27e74d4-442e-48c0-b765-258acc1e50bb.summary: Freedom as Non-Interference with Personal Development
c27e74d4-442e-48c0-b765-258acc1e50bb.content: {Freedom is the absence of interference that hinders personal development}, {A person is free if they are not subject to interference that hinders their personal development}, {Personal development involves the growth of one's abilities and potential}

4ff47cbf-4aae-4025-b821-2f9852b9e956.summary: Freedom as Non-Interference with Moral Agency
4ff47cbf-4aae-4025-b821-2f9852b9e956.content: {Freedom is the absence of interference that compromises moral agency}, {A person is free if they are not subject to interference that compromises their moral agency}, {Moral agency is the ability to make ethical decisions}

d0ed6684-204c-4df5-b401-c86c44fff7ec.content: {Freedom is the absence of interference that limits self-determination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to interference that limits their self-determination}, {Self-determination is the ability to control one's own life}

01192b08-5034-4ed4-bc42-67498cbd2179.content: {Freedom is the absence of interference that affects authenticity}, {A person is free if they are not subject to interference that affects their authenticity}, {Authenticity is the alignment of one's actions with one's true self}

9c9edfe3-aced-4e3b-81aa-ebe73d5284d4.content: {Freedom is the absence of interference that prevents flourishing}, {A person is free if they are not subject to interference that prevents their flourishing}, {Flourishing is the realization of one's potential and well-being}

c6684f4f-6f1d-428f-ab5a-828ac7260d3a.summary: Distinguishing between arbitrary and non-arbitrary interference
c6684f4f-6f1d-428f-ab5a-828ac7260d3a.content: {There is a distinction between arbitrary interference and non-arbitrary interference}, {Republican Liberty is concerned with the absence of arbitrary interference, not all interference}, {Benevolent interference can be non-arbitrary if it is guided by principles that respect the person's interests and autonomy}, {A person subject to non-arbitrary interference can still be considered free under Republican Liberty}

ca579b33-e8f5-478f-90e1-6ac6efc6bb30.summary: Rejecting the intuition that all interference undermines freedom
ca579b33-e8f5-478f-90e1-6ac6efc6bb30.content: {It is mistaken to assume that all interference undermines freedom}, {Benevolent interference does not necessarily compromise freedom if it aligns with the person's own values and interests}, {The intuition that benevolent interference is incompatible with freedom is based on a misunderstanding of what constitutes arbitrary interference}

6b1431d3-62e0-4dfa-bd90-64cbb77e0e1d.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of consent
6b1431d3-62e0-4dfa-bd90-64cbb77e0e1d.content: {Consent can transform interference from arbitrary to non-arbitrary}, {If a person consents to benevolent interference, it does not count as domination}, {The presence of consent ensures that the interference respects the person's autonomy and aligns with their interests}, {With consent, benevolent interference is compatible with Republican Liberty}

9f825e05-4684-4925-b422-e9a2eda80f17.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Freedom requires the ability to engage with others and society}

60ac5bc4-6299-4737-8e92-a9ef85a50e90.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Freedom involves the capacity to act upon one's own will and pursue one's own goals}

bd3373ca-15ef-44af-a5b9-55398a64ec01.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Freedom is constituted by the quality of relationships and interactions with others}

187012a2-3176-4b3b-b087-cf0bf8e36140.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Freedom involves having the capabilities to achieve valuable functionings in life}

64f001de-daa3-4bc5-bb89-f654ec7752e0.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Freedom is realized through participation in a community and shared social practices}

278b03d5-beff-4493-acfc-50ad14eb3bf6.content: {There is a distinction between being isolated and being free}, {Republican Liberty is concerned with the absence of domination, not mere isolation}, {A person on a deserted island is not dominated, but this does not imply they are free in the social or relational sense}, {Freedom involves the capacity to engage in social relations without domination, which is absent in isolation}

aacf6d1d-cdfa-4b21-8391-327fa31b3e0d.summary: Rejecting the intuition that isolation implies lack of freedom
aacf6d1d-cdfa-4b21-8391-327fa31b3e0d.content: {It is mistaken to intuitively judge that isolation implies a lack of freedom}, {Freedom as the absence of domination does not require social interaction}, {The absence of interference is a necessary condition for freedom, even if it is not sufficient for all conceptions of freedom}, {The intuition that freedom requires social engagement is not relevant to the concept of Republican Liberty}

93ca0f47-82c0-4b04-b911-104babb71227.summary: Supplementing with the concept of potential social engagement
93ca0f47-82c0-4b04-b911-104babb71227.content: {Freedom involves the potential for social engagement without domination}, {A person on a deserted island lacks the potential for social engagement, but this does not affect their freedom from domination}, {The absence of domination is compatible with a lack of current social interaction}, {Potential for social engagement is a supplementary condition for a fuller conception of freedom, but not for Republican Liberty}

6c4693fe-80b0-4cc9-b71d-00c6eec0b723.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to non-consensual arbitrary interference by others}, {Interference is non-arbitrary if it is justified or consensual}

79ce0263-b885-47e0-8a4f-0f0291a52162.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to interference without their consent}, {Interference is non-dominating if it is consensual}

a9c02433-f370-43c2-a2e4-01cfb90cf364.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to unjustified interference by others}, {Interference is non-dominating if it is justified}

c78fa039-87b4-49ad-9479-12bfa5888d63.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Interference is non-arbitrary if it is either justified or consensual}

bb93172e-0593-49d8-9ca6-deef60d30734.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to interference that violates a contractual agreement}, {Interference is non-dominating if it respects contractual agreements}

70a51dad-45d7-4954-8b96-c94cc187aacd.summary: Distinguishing between arbitrary and justified interference
70a51dad-45d7-4954-8b96-c94cc187aacd.content: {There is a distinction between arbitrary interference and justified interference}, {Republican Liberty is concerned with the absence of arbitrary interference, not all interference}, {Interference that is justified or consensual does not count as arbitrary interference}, {A person who consents to interference is not subject to domination in the relevant sense}

2135616c-672f-4d84-8f36-0b37a95da8b2.summary: Rejecting the intuition that all interference diminishes freedom
2135616c-672f-4d84-8f36-0b37a95da8b2.content: {It is false that all interference diminishes a person's freedom}, {Interference that is consensual or justified does not diminish freedom}, {The intuition that consensual interference diminishes freedom is mistaken}

32565ff4-15be-438b-b636-f3064f9e3737.summary: Supplementing with the concept of non-arbitrary interference
32565ff4-15be-438b-b636-f3064f9e3737.content: {Non-arbitrary interference is interference that is justified or consensual}, {Republican Liberty allows for non-arbitrary interference without diminishing freedom}, {The presence of non-arbitrary interference does not entail domination}

fc879a8e-c942-423e-9d06-3d34ab868b73.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Hierarchical structures can be legitimate if they are justified by consent or mutual benefit}, {A person is free within a hierarchical structure if the hierarchy is non-arbitrary and justified}

e2590abd-9bae-4c39-8a9d-1fbabc38c6a2.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {A person is free within a hierarchical structure if they have the ability to exit the structure without significant cost}, {Hierarchical structures do not inherently negate freedom if exit options are available}

52a0901d-3fe8-4fb5-8b89-44036c6a74c7.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Hierarchical structures can be compatible with freedom if they are subject to democratic accountability}, {A person is free within a hierarchy if they have a voice in decision-making processes}

9c037152-87ba-4aa4-8b68-6287c6ac4393.summary: Freedom with Rule of Law in Hierarchies
9c037152-87ba-4aa4-8b68-6287c6ac4393.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Hierarchical structures are compatible with freedom if governed by a rule of law that prevents arbitrary power}, {A person is free within a hierarchy if the rules are transparent and consistently applied}

e05d37e7-1f80-4799-88e7-9b0b6048f61f.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Hierarchical roles are compatible with freedom if they are based on merit and necessity}, {A person is free within a hierarchy if their role is justified by expertise or function}

ea561e22-a745-48da-b457-c95ec2bd4803.summary: Distinguishing between arbitrary and non-arbitrary interference
ea561e22-a745-48da-b457-c95ec2bd4803.content: {There is a distinction between arbitrary and non-arbitrary interference}, {Republican Liberty is concerned with the absence of arbitrary interference, not all forms of interference}, {Hierarchical structures can involve non-arbitrary interference if they are governed by rules and accountability}, {A person in a hierarchical structure can be free if the interference they experience is non-arbitrary}

8357eacf-e0b5-4fce-a21c-e922fb57f435.summary: Rejecting the intuition that all hierarchical structures are incompatible with freedom
8357eacf-e0b5-4fce-a21c-e922fb57f435.content: {It is mistaken to assume that all hierarchical structures inherently involve arbitrary interference}, {Hierarchical structures can be designed to prevent arbitrary interference through checks and balances}, {A person can be free within a hierarchical structure if the structure is designed to protect against arbitrary interference}

bf18542b-58f2-4d9e-a687-0bea08f983f0.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of procedural fairness
bf18542b-58f2-4d9e-a687-0bea08f983f0.content: {Procedural fairness can ensure that interference within hierarchical structures is not arbitrary}, {If a hierarchical structure includes fair procedures and accountability, it can be compatible with Republican Liberty}, {The presence of procedural fairness in hierarchical structures can prevent domination and maintain freedom}

f5f984c9-95e8-449f-9813-dfb548eed70f.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {True freedom requires some form of equality in power relations}

a585efa3-3bd1-41d8-ae86-b3f211027624.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Institutional safeguards are necessary to ensure that power imbalances do not lead to domination}

5533c633-dad5-414d-9bfb-ac7f14972846.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Mutual recognition of individuals as equals is necessary for true freedom}

dcff9d86-f6b5-4ae7-8222-e14d48622244.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Redistribution of power is necessary to prevent domination and ensure freedom}

2adee7ea-9ff7-4964-ac24-0fe9efeeef40.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Collective decision-making processes are necessary to prevent arbitrary interference}

2857e546-4a90-4250-82a7-d846b3a304c9.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Legal protections are necessary to ensure that power imbalances do not lead to domination}

a24244fb-4d63-477d-a4e5-64b0c8604d23.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Social equality is necessary to ensure that power imbalances do not lead to domination}

9cb1d411-9dd7-4167-9ff2-818662de7233.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Democratic oversight is necessary to prevent arbitrary interference}

b0bdeb60-bc04-4cd6-9db0-f13d4d61102d.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Checks on power are necessary to prevent domination}

111721b0-18ef-4f9b-b45e-506c1e9ea22e.summary: Republican Liberty with Reciprocal Power Relations
111721b0-18ef-4f9b-b45e-506c1e9ea22e.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Reciprocal power relations are necessary to ensure freedom}

acd76fe1-86d3-44de-8fc5-069e2c2796c8.summary: Distinguishing between domination and potential domination
acd76fe1-86d3-44de-8fc5-069e2c2796c8.content: {There is a distinction between actual domination and potential domination}, {Republican Liberty is a theory about the absence of actual domination rather than potential domination}, {A person is not dominated if the more powerful individual does not exercise their power arbitrarily}, {The intuition that the less powerful individual is not free can be explained as confusion between actual domination and potential domination}

437a07ba-a666-471f-919b-b353c206d7a4.summary: Rejecting the necessity of power equality for freedom
437a07ba-a666-471f-919b-b353c206d7a4.content: {It is false that true freedom requires equality of power}, {Freedom as the absence of domination does not necessitate equal power but rather the absence of arbitrary interference}, {The presence of unequal power does not imply domination if the power is not exercised arbitrarily}

ae08eb46-f948-4297-8426-9eb06bb6ea59.summary: Supplementing with a commitment to non-arbitrary power use
ae08eb46-f948-4297-8426-9eb06bb6ea59.content: {A supplementary assumption is that power must be used non-arbitrarily to maintain freedom}, {The absence of domination is maintained if the more powerful individual commits to using their power in a non-arbitrary manner}, {The less powerful individual remains free as long as there is a commitment to non-arbitrary interference}

b27e85c4-3451-4e04-ad25-6bb51f272fd0.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Surveillance does not constitute interference if it is non-arbitrary and regulated by law}

852dd36f-1f03-482f-8b3d-9749fb42b63c.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Surveillance does not constitute interference if the person has given informed consent}

404a4afa-2ee2-4893-b842-b863238a8399.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Surveillance does not constitute interference if it is transparent and accountable}

b7694d2d-90cc-433b-a154-fbf3373de272.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Surveillance does not constitute interference if there is a mechanism for recourse and challenge}

017bfafa-8261-4c08-85bf-7ce32e9e0171.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Surveillance does not constitute interference if it has minimal impact on the person's autonomy}

cd45faa9-3bd4-4494-9446-b58985a7aa3c.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Surveillance does not constitute interference if power is equally distributed among all parties}

e9f60bf0-dd4c-47ab-aa22-e484a28a6da9.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Surveillance does not constitute interference if it is publicly justified and necessary for the common good}

c77b448a-ac9a-47dc-b1da-d67107351c8d.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Surveillance does not constitute interference if it is subject to democratic oversight}

ff8c2544-a9bd-47df-920a-7ed57b9cd829.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Surveillance does not constitute interference if it respects personal autonomy and decision-making}

2cc4bca7-65aa-4d08-a62f-48169ce12310.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Surveillance does not constitute interference if it is proportional to the threat it addresses}

b944a29d-8ca4-4653-984f-ce39cf50ef4e.content: {There is a distinction between interference and domination}, {Republican Liberty is concerned with the absence of domination, not merely interference}, {Surveillance without arbitrary interference does not constitute domination}, {A person under surveillance can still be free if the surveillance does not lead to arbitrary interference}

2aebc4f5-906a-442e-b53e-ac2e26150766.summary: Rejecting the intuition that surveillance alone undermines freedom
2aebc4f5-906a-442e-b53e-ac2e26150766.content: {It is mistaken to assume that surveillance alone makes a person unfree}, {Freedom is compromised only when surveillance leads to arbitrary interference}, {Surveillance without arbitrary interference does not necessarily undermine freedom}

f9b08ca7-f50d-4200-9ac7-984857beb057.summary: Explaining freedom through the concept of non-arbitrary control
f9b08ca7-f50d-4200-9ac7-984857beb057.content: {Freedom involves the absence of arbitrary control, not just interference}, {Surveillance that is non-arbitrary and regulated does not compromise freedom}, {A person can be free under surveillance if it is conducted in a non-arbitrary manner}

8c7d812b-7467-4ef0-8cba-3ccc3b0fc5b5.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Freedom requires objective conditions that ensure the absence of domination}

7a9236ac-a905-4d16-bbe1-44d9f2230fb2.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Freedom is determined by objective conditions rather than subjective experiences}

65394fdc-2993-4421-97a2-913c86e7831d.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Awareness of constraints is necessary for true freedom}

9d9a6133-1bd1-429a-a3fe-a6d91a7a8b8b.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Freedom is an objective state, not dependent on subjective feelings}

9c721000-afab-493e-99e1-a6451d0766f8.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Objective guarantees are necessary to ensure freedom}

f9c4a062-ae52-4969-a74d-3d43deb536f3.summary: Distinguishing between subjective and objective freedom
f9c4a062-ae52-4969-a74d-3d43deb536f3.content: {There is a distinction between subjective freedom and objective freedom}, {Republican Liberty is a theory about objective freedom rather than subjective freedom}, {A person's subjective experience of freedom does not determine their actual freedom if they are subject to arbitrary interference}, {The intuition that subjective experience equates to freedom is a misunderstanding of the objective conditions required for true freedom}

ecbb8e26-6f5f-440b-afcc-bde350b8958d.summary: Rejecting the intuition that subjective experience defines freedom
ecbb8e26-6f5f-440b-afcc-bde350b8958d.content: {It is false that a person's subjective experience of freedom equates to actual freedom}, {Freedom as the absence of domination requires objective conditions that are independent of a person's awareness}, {The appearance that subjective experience defines freedom is mistaken because it overlooks the necessity of non-arbitrary interference}

b0eaa47e-c61b-4ad9-93be-f7e284b56928.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of objective conditions
b0eaa47e-c61b-4ad9-93be-f7e284b56928.content: {Objective conditions are necessary for true freedom, regardless of subjective experience}, {Republican Liberty requires that freedom be assessed by the absence of arbitrary interference, not by personal feelings}, {The scenario where a person feels free despite constraints highlights the need for objective criteria to determine actual freedom}

4c6b6592-0a01-485f-ab54-96377cee6669.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Interference is not arbitrary if it is justified by the aim of protecting individuals from significant harm}

7bc28776-4b99-423a-a469-fe715f6966df.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Interference is not arbitrary if it is consented to by the individuals affected}

31e96631-7154-481b-aeea-6d9483ef7bb0.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Interference is not arbitrary if it is based on reasons that all citizens can accept}

47a28721-a528-43eb-b469-8eef3ccd2573.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Interference is not arbitrary if it results from a democratic process in which all have an equal say}

cffb3457-59b4-4f04-8b67-242ec9cd8416.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Interference is not arbitrary if it is necessary to prevent harm to others}

2ef9f475-796f-4c2b-96d3-2ffc5dcbfda1.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Interference is not arbitrary if it enhances the rational autonomy of individuals}

febb921a-2743-41dd-b70a-74e6f0a75c8b.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Interference is not arbitrary if it is minimal and necessary for the individual's own good}

1a0eff6e-59a9-4431-a6b0-4e35f385100e.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Interference is not arbitrary if it respects the contextual autonomy of individuals}

372e8f47-9a80-4fd1-8750-ebf5c1ec095e.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Interference is not arbitrary if it is the result of collective self-determination}

a8f743bf-8597-4d1a-92da-18033905ed6e.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Interference is not arbitrary if it is proportionate to the aim of preventing significant harm}

3fb0179a-8395-4fa6-893e-1a160d2239fe.summary: Distinguishing between arbitrary and non-arbitrary interference
3fb0179a-8395-4fa6-893e-1a160d2239fe.content: {There is a distinction between arbitrary and non-arbitrary interference}, {Republican Liberty is concerned with the absence of arbitrary interference, not all interference}, {Paternalistic measures like mandatory seatbelt laws can be non-arbitrary if they are justified by democratic processes or public reasoning}, {Non-arbitrary interference does not undermine freedom as defined by Republican Liberty}

695d050b-6a7d-406c-a9d1-e8fdbe2ac9b5.summary: Rejecting the intuition that all paternalism undermines freedom
695d050b-6a7d-406c-a9d1-e8fdbe2ac9b5.content: {It is mistaken to assume that all paternalistic actions undermine freedom}, {Paternalistic measures can enhance autonomy by protecting individuals from harm and enabling them to pursue their own goals more effectively}, {The intuition that paternalism always conflicts with freedom is based on a misunderstanding of the role of autonomy in Republican Liberty}

8e5682b9-3c0a-443a-b2e4-fda89ee67261.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of collective self-governance
8e5682b9-3c0a-443a-b2e4-fda89ee67261.content: {Republican Liberty can include the assumption of collective self-governance}, {Paternalistic laws enacted through democratic processes reflect the collective will and are not arbitrary}, {Freedom can coexist with paternalism when it is the result of collective decision-making that respects individual autonomy}

c6c59a65-1601-4961-8f4c-e19f43c57871.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Freedom does not require the absence of natural constraints}

de3d1dda-09f2-438b-8bc7-0947cd67e8ea.content: {Freedom is the ability to pursue one's own goals}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Freedom includes the presence of enabling conditions to pursue one's goals}

1c40b462-14ea-4668-831f-cf1b9309b6b8.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Freedom requires the capability to achieve well-being}

4ea1ab02-07e0-4215-9f2e-f584b5906025.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Freedom allows for minimal natural constraints that do not hinder autonomy}

ed9fa15e-d35c-45ed-a8cd-67d0d6c0d0f8.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Freedom is connected to the capacity for human flourishing}

838c5342-b11f-4b71-bdc0-619c4b14a3ea.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Freedom acknowledges contextual constraints that are part of human life}

da744fd9-6078-4f47-89f2-1f7ebd705a8b.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Freedom involves practical autonomy within natural constraints}

133cc15f-4f6b-4cf1-b72b-6d2161c69b53.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Freedom includes the ability to adapt preferences within constraints}

f18f071e-1040-4247-997d-dca02cf45e8d.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Freedom involves relational autonomy that considers social contexts}

4a2e0d60-0b35-418e-a0bf-4a574b6226cd.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Freedom acknowledges environmental constraints as part of human existence}

596b7dfd-d74e-4bdb-8757-a640595f553c.summary: Distinguishing between social and natural constraints
596b7dfd-d74e-4bdb-8757-a640595f553c.content: {There is a distinction between social constraints and natural constraints}, {Republican Liberty is concerned with the absence of social or political domination, not natural constraints}, {Natural constraints do not constitute domination as they do not involve arbitrary interference by others}, {The intuition that freedom requires the absence of all constraints is a misunderstanding of the scope of Republican Liberty}

44b7e358-2ecb-471b-9faf-de244dca9101.summary: Rejecting the intuition that natural constraints affect freedom
