44b7e358-2ecb-471b-9faf-de244dca9101.content: {It is false that natural constraints impact a person's freedom in the context of Republican Liberty}, {Freedom as the absence of domination is not compromised by natural constraints, as they do not involve arbitrary interference}, {The presence of natural constraints does not entail a lack of freedom under the Republican Liberty framework}

355ea306-9c09-4517-81c4-7572ded96027.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of inherent human limitations
355ea306-9c09-4517-81c4-7572ded96027.content: {Human existence inherently involves natural constraints that do not affect freedom as defined by Republican Liberty}, {Freedom in the Republican sense is about the absence of arbitrary interference, not the absence of all constraints}, {Acknowledging inherent human limitations clarifies that freedom does not require the absence of natural constraints}

469b59f5-e37e-4bbd-b98a-a777bfd792d0.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated by human or non-human factors}

9e8a0712-53ad-4b52-ba8d-196162d6bec8.content: {Freedom is the ability to act upon one's free will}, {A person is free if they have the capacity and resources to pursue their goals}, {Freedom includes protection from both human and non-human constraints}

c438a29e-4177-4177-a37a-31af7133d32e.content: {Freedom is the capability to achieve valuable states of being}, {A person is free if they have the genuine opportunity to achieve their potential}, {Freedom requires the absence of constraints from both human and non-human factors}

af47eefc-28db-4a56-b95e-04f5fd2cc0d9.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated by any external constraints}, {Freedom includes protection from both human and non-human interferences}

9fbb1bb7-e671-4782-8c38-912e35e9ac7c.content: {Freedom is the overall well-being and autonomy of an individual}, {A person is free if they can pursue their life plans without undue interference}, {Freedom requires addressing both human and non-human barriers}

b2227bc4-f612-4aa5-8896-9e1392cabc47.summary: Distinguishing between human and non-human constraints
b2227bc4-f612-4aa5-8896-9e1392cabc47.content: {There is a distinction between constraints imposed by human actions and those imposed by non-human factors}, {Libertarian Liberty is concerned with freedom from human interference, not natural constraints}, {A person trapped by a natural disaster is not unfree in the libertarian sense because their rights are not violated by another person}, {The intuition that someone is unfree in a natural disaster can be explained by conflating human-imposed and natural constraints}

6a313dee-71a1-4cd9-ae70-93d690cb9c0b.summary: Rejecting the intuition that natural constraints affect freedom
6a313dee-71a1-4cd9-ae70-93d690cb9c0b.content: {It is mistaken to equate natural constraints with violations of freedom}, {Freedom in the libertarian sense is about the absence of human interference, not the absence of all constraints}, {A person in a natural disaster is not unfree because their rights remain intact despite the physical limitations}

01621776-d841-47a6-b3fb-2c93abbad731.summary: Supplementing with a focus on human responsibility
01621776-d841-47a6-b3fb-2c93abbad731.content: {Libertarian Liberty can include a supplementary focus on human responsibility to mitigate natural constraints}, {Freedom is maintained if individuals or communities take proactive measures to protect rights against natural threats}, {The intuition that someone is unfree in a natural disaster is addressed by emphasizing the role of human agency in disaster preparedness and response}

a623b3f0-525c-4ae3-b42f-48ef72118ecf.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Freedom includes the ability to access basic goods and services such as education and healthcare}

3bb3564f-4f50-4eb4-acb1-ddb7e699c3f5.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {The state has a role in ensuring access to basic welfare services to support individual freedom}

0fe4de19-07cd-41de-9ed0-f21bfe8491e8.summary: Libertarian Liberty with Social Safety Net
0fe4de19-07cd-41de-9ed0-f21bfe8491e8.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {A social safety net is necessary to ensure that individuals can exercise their freedom}

17390887-d862-469e-b448-f94f35eda2f6.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Freedom involves the capability to achieve well-being, which includes access to basic goods and services}

194eb7c3-acd1-4106-a81b-a5a57bd4bd55.summary: Libertarian Liberty with Basic Needs Fulfillment
194eb7c3-acd1-4106-a81b-a5a57bd4bd55.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Freedom requires the fulfillment of basic needs such as food, shelter, and healthcare}

2160ffa0-44be-4f46-9814-da089c521c4a.summary: Distinguishing between negative and positive rights
2160ffa0-44be-4f46-9814-da089c521c4a.content: {There is a distinction between negative rights and positive rights}, {Libertarian Liberty is concerned with negative rights, which are rights not to be interfered with}, {Positive rights, such as access to goods and services, are not part of the concept of freedom as non-violation of rights}, {The objection loses its force when recognizing that Libertarian Liberty does not claim to address positive rights}

0517bda4-f81c-4fb3-9ba2-d2b1d3a92c11.summary: Rejecting the necessity of positive rights for freedom
0517bda4-f81c-4fb3-9ba2-d2b1d3a92c11.content: {It is false that freedom necessarily involves access to basic goods and services}, {Freedom, in the context of Libertarian Liberty, is solely about the non-violation of individual rights}, {The ability to access goods and services is a separate issue from the protection of individual rights}

4c7135d6-0b9e-4a12-942e-723587c61d6a.summary: Supplementing with a focus on voluntary associations
4c7135d6-0b9e-4a12-942e-723587c61d6a.content: {Libertarian Liberty can be supplemented with the assumption that voluntary associations can provide access to basic goods and services}, {The protection of individual rights allows for the formation of voluntary associations to address needs for education and healthcare}, {The objection loses its force when considering that positive rights can be fulfilled through voluntary means without violating individual rights}

e05b7f00-3d7e-4fa4-a406-29ae111e6519.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {A society is free if it ensures equal access to resources and opportunities for all individuals}

3f3c0053-f42d-4f57-985e-67e187f10c00.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {A society is free if it actively addresses systemic inequalities that limit access to resources and opportunities}

89d0457e-cd29-4bd8-a1b4-15db61f22bb8.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Freedom requires that individuals have sufficient resources to exercise their rights effectively}

0fa995dd-e7e5-44f8-82e1-8fc9260417a4.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Freedom includes ensuring that all individuals have equal opportunities to pursue their goals}

599b1a71-e4df-4950-9f0d-276d17181a36.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Freedom must be understood in the context of social and economic conditions that affect individuals' ability to exercise their rights}

7dcef226-5c51-4761-8043-3fb27b1ed14d.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {A society is free if it includes mechanisms to ensure that disadvantaged groups can fully participate in social and economic life}

f1857779-7c23-410e-b2d5-309ca3f8560a.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Freedom requires addressing inequities that prevent individuals from having equal life chances}

0435e80d-224d-4dc3-b4ac-d03a10ac9a02.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Freedom involves a holistic approach that considers both legal rights and social conditions}

1b888fd9-df3e-4d74-a714-216f38944a1a.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Freedom includes the ability of individuals to participate in decision-making processes that affect their lives}

a38ca0fe-7b8c-4adc-a923-f54045d00cae.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Freedom involves ensuring that individuals have the capabilities to achieve their potential}

c693aa27-f2b5-4dbd-a87b-002915d8ff33.summary: Distinguishing between formal and substantive freedom
c693aa27-f2b5-4dbd-a87b-002915d8ff33.content: {There is a distinction between formal freedom and substantive freedom}, {Libertarian Liberty is a theory about formal freedom, which concerns the non-violation of individual rights}, {Systemic inequality affects substantive freedom, which involves access to resources and opportunities}, {The objection confuses formal freedom with substantive freedom, which are distinct concepts}

5bde16d6-6ed0-4c2d-91b0-72305ef8e278.summary: Rejecting the intuition that systemic inequality undermines freedom
5bde16d6-6ed0-4c2d-91b0-72305ef8e278.content: {It is mistaken to claim that systemic inequality inherently undermines freedom as defined by Libertarian Liberty}, {Freedom, in this view, is solely about the non-violation of individual rights, not about equal access to resources}, {The intuition that inequality affects freedom is based on a different conception of freedom not addressed by Libertarian Liberty}

8ee726c6-95b8-4777-958a-5b8b9b200680.summary: Supplementing with a focus on voluntary exchange
8ee726c6-95b8-4777-958a-5b8b9b200680.content: {Libertarian Liberty can be supplemented with the assumption that voluntary exchanges in a free market can mitigate systemic inequality}, {Voluntary exchanges allow individuals to improve their circumstances without violating others' rights}, {The objection loses its force if systemic inequality can be addressed through voluntary means consistent with Libertarian Liberty}

b85d4e0a-c255-4781-9334-176aa0d7fbc8.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {A person is not free if they enter into a contract under duress}

62e7c8ac-69e4-4bac-bec4-7dddd809428b.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Freedom requires consideration of the context in which agreements are made}

e388197f-a22b-4e4a-a4fc-1a0e6c5f98c3.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Coercive contracts violate the principle of freedom}

158fc6dd-284f-4894-8af6-f41a727c4978.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Freedom is conditional on the absence of coercion in agreements}

260c4cc0-1993-44c4-baf4-94f5dc515e6d.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Freedom includes protection against economic coercion}

02d48ae4-1c98-422f-81d8-1564ba7ea6a0.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Freedom requires fairness in contractual agreements}

6fc3a97f-ed40-4a9b-991d-ab1ddfa56385.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Freedom requires that contracts are entered into voluntarily}

f12ece0d-d3eb-41f5-8053-6bffebf42aae.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Contracts made under duress are exceptions to freedom}

975944fd-fcf5-472b-b908-fdd213d40a9c.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Economic context is relevant to determining freedom}

92985031-d7d4-49dc-9740-cef6f00ed676.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Awareness of coercion is necessary for true freedom}

c61c6ee6-060a-47f7-b091-acb5d841b205.summary: Distinguishing between voluntary and involuntary contracts
c61c6ee6-060a-47f7-b091-acb5d841b205.content: {There is a distinction between voluntary and involuntary contracts.}, {Libertarian Liberty concerns itself with voluntary agreements where rights are not violated.}, {A contract entered under duress is not voluntary and thus does not align with the conditions of Libertarian Liberty.}, {The intuition that coercive contracts undermine freedom is based on a misunderstanding of what constitutes a voluntary agreement.}

a5bdca70-0e75-4f35-80c7-074c0a88479a.summary: Rejecting the intuition that coercive contracts are compatible with freedom
a5bdca70-0e75-4f35-80c7-074c0a88479a.content: {It is false that a person is free if they enter into a contract under duress.}, {Freedom under Libertarian Liberty requires that contracts be entered into without coercion.}, {The presence of coercion indicates a violation of the conditions necessary for freedom, even if rights are not overtly violated.}

822d2645-b495-49f8-acd1-d11505a2c4f5.summary: Supplementing with a principle of fair opportunity
822d2645-b495-49f8-acd1-d11505a2c4f5.content: {A supplementary principle of fair opportunity can be added to Libertarian Liberty.}, {This principle ensures that individuals have reasonable alternatives and are not forced into contracts due to lack of options.}, {With this principle, coercive contracts are seen as incompatible with freedom because they violate the condition of fair opportunity.}

5b635e8b-641b-4ffa-85ba-d95056bdeefe.summary: Revised Libertarian Liberty with Consent Consideration
5b635e8b-641b-4ffa-85ba-d95056bdeefe.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {A person is not free if they consent to an arrangement that severely limits their future options}, {Consent does not justify arrangements that undermine future autonomy}

00dc7870-419f-4071-8682-f02e7e84ab45.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {A person is not free if their autonomy is compromised by their own consent}, {Autonomy is a necessary condition for freedom}

cf02b704-b002-42ad-94d2-928b43206c84.summary: Libertarian Liberty with Future Options Clause
cf02b704-b002-42ad-94d2-928b43206c84.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {A person is not free if they consent to arrangements that eliminate significant future options}, {Preservation of future options is essential for freedom}

c11d20f9-a93c-47d1-8214-9f2607061e75.summary: Libertarian Liberty with Non-Revocable Consent Restriction
c11d20f9-a93c-47d1-8214-9f2607061e75.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Consent to arrangements that cannot be revoked does not constitute freedom}, {Revocability of consent is necessary for freedom}

ef16f283-be64-4ad6-a90e-11469219d3f0.summary: Libertarian Liberty with Informed Consent Requirement
ef16f283-be64-4ad6-a90e-11469219d3f0.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {A person is not free if they consent without full understanding of future limitations}, {Informed consent is required for true freedom}

3c3fa62d-0f53-4914-af56-b59e9b878de8.summary: Distinguishing between voluntary and involuntary consent
3c3fa62d-0f53-4914-af56-b59e9b878de8.content: {There is a distinction between voluntary consent and involuntary consent.}, {Libertarian Liberty is concerned with protecting rights against involuntary violations.}, {A person who consents to an arrangement like indentured servitude is exercising voluntary consent.}, {The intuition that such a person is not free can be explained by misunderstanding the nature of voluntary consent.}

5101e073-53bb-4111-bf93-c769fb68bbc3.summary: Rejecting the intuition that consented limitations are unfree
5101e073-53bb-4111-bf93-c769fb68bbc3.content: {It is false that a person is not free if they consent to limitations on their future options.}, {Freedom under Libertarian Liberty is defined by the absence of rights violations, not by the range of options available.}, {The appearance of unfreedom in consented limitations is a mistaken intuition about the nature of freedom.}

03427a47-4def-418a-8ddc-b56d36c4b5a9.summary: Supplementing with a principle of informed consent
03427a47-4def-418a-8ddc-b56d36c4b5a9.content: {Informed consent requires that individuals fully understand the implications of their choices.}, {Libertarian Liberty can incorporate a principle of informed consent to ensure that consent is meaningful.}, {With informed consent, the objection loses its force as individuals are aware of and accept the consequences of their decisions.}

276ad263-6d8b-42f3-ad40-99fd20755bcf.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Collective rights, such as the right to a clean environment, are essential for individual freedom}, {Collective rights are compatible with individual rights when they enhance individual freedom}

630c0140-1a80-4ad7-8214-509368dc6ff0.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Collective rights are necessary to enhance the exercise of individual rights}, {Collective rights are justified when they support the flourishing of individual rights}

d81757ea-65f6-49cd-b524-4e93024f1119.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {The right to a clean environment is an individual right}, {Environmental protection is necessary for the protection of individual rights}

f654ad14-1eca-4c86-b5f6-c19823d43c17.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Collective rights are balanced with individual rights to ensure overall freedom}, {The balance of rights is determined by their contribution to individual freedom}

c201b334-5f17-49cb-b649-b5485986c45e.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Collective rights entail collective responsibilities that support individual rights}, {Collective responsibilities are necessary for the protection of individual rights}

691ee924-f881-4b49-8353-5bfcf08db3cd.summary: Distinguishing between individual and collective rights
691ee924-f881-4b49-8353-5bfcf08db3cd.content: {There is a distinction between individual rights and collective rights.}, {Libertarian Liberty is a theory about individual rights rather than collective rights.}, {Collective rights can be seen as instrumental to the protection of individual rights.}, {The potential conflict is resolved by understanding collective rights as means to safeguard individual rights.}

fa956630-72b5-4430-b17c-c0147d86d509.summary: Rejecting the necessity of collective rights for individual freedom
fa956630-72b5-4430-b17c-c0147d86d509.content: {It is false that collective rights are necessary for individual freedom.}, {Individual rights can be fully protected without invoking collective rights.}, {The principle that collective rights are essential for individual freedom is mistaken.}

b8a8e10f-61ca-4efb-b6d3-06ead6e7489c.summary: Supplementing with a framework for collective rights as derived from individual rights
b8a8e10f-61ca-4efb-b6d3-06ead6e7489c.content: {Collective rights can be understood as derived from the aggregation of individual rights.}, {A clean environment can be seen as a collective right that emerges from the individual right to health and well-being.}, {This supplementary framework allows for the inclusion of collective rights without conflicting with the focus on individual rights.}

3e771590-7851-4e37-b9a5-5df72e97f6c3.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {A person is free if they have a reasonable expectation of privacy in their personal affairs}

8fc3db7f-532b-4a94-9a6c-0d9fb0463874.summary: Libertarian Liberty with Minimal State Interference
8fc3db7f-532b-4a94-9a6c-0d9fb0463874.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {A person is free if the state does not interfere in their personal decisions without compelling justification}

4f62924e-4a03-4f71-805e-81197ad09863.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {A person is free if they can make autonomous decisions without undue influence or coercion}

51aa7afa-ff20-4f5c-9a7f-3f88e18a2829.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {A person is free if any surveillance conducted is with their informed consent}

e033c032-909e-43d5-8074-8827cc1cf854.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {A person is free if government actions, including surveillance, are transparent and accountable}

8ab8ec85-0094-4d7b-9762-bd910c17e795.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {A person is free if surveillance does not intrude upon their personal life or decision-making processes}

2e1cc08d-4ad8-4998-a778-fad91461e90c.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {A person is free if any surveillance is justified by a legitimate and proportionate purpose}

b8c47ec4-39b8-4e57-8eeb-8dbe72765bf1.summary: Libertarian Liberty with Right to Privacy
b8c47ec4-39b8-4e57-8eeb-8dbe72765bf1.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {A person is free if they have a right to privacy that is respected and protected}

ae89a87f-676d-47cb-b971-e302376cbc17.summary: Distinguishing between rights violation and privacy invasion
ae89a87f-676d-47cb-b971-e302376cbc17.content: {There is a distinction between rights violation and privacy invasion}, {Libertarian Liberty is concerned with the protection of rights, not privacy per se}, {Surveillance without direct rights violation does not constitute a loss of freedom under Libertarian Liberty}, {The intuition that surveillance undermines freedom can be explained by conflating privacy concerns with rights violations}

dacfd6a4-d57e-421f-8b67-9ce7b1f0e982.summary: Rejecting the intuition that surveillance inherently undermines freedom
dacfd6a4-d57e-421f-8b67-9ce7b1f0e982.content: {It is mistaken to assume that surveillance inherently undermines freedom if no rights are violated}, {Freedom under Libertarian Liberty is defined by the absence of rights violations, not by the presence or absence of surveillance}, {The feeling of being unfree due to surveillance is a psychological response, not a reflection of actual rights infringement}

267e8d09-6dbf-483e-9dd8-1f53101b0e14.summary: Supplementing with a focus on consent
267e8d09-6dbf-483e-9dd8-1f53101b0e14.content: {Freedom can be maintained if surveillance is conducted with the informed consent of the individuals}, {Informed consent ensures that surveillance does not constitute a rights violation}, {The presence of consent transforms surveillance from a potential threat to a neutral or even protective measure under Libertarian Liberty}

8115ee64-291b-45dc-bde5-143133602384.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Freedom includes the protection of the rights of future generations}, {A person is free if their actions do not infringe on the rights of future generations}

0a04a90a-fb7d-4045-bcca-03f87b52f444.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Freedom requires sustainable practices that preserve resources for future generations}, {A person is free if their use of resources does not compromise the ability of future generations to meet their needs}

f5d7e535-2ea8-43b9-a6f6-a744b0ff57e2.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Justice requires that the rights of future generations are considered}, {A person is free if their actions respect the rights of future generations to life, liberty, and property}

d6169587-08fc-48b5-87d3-4d112e55db78.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Freedom extends to ensuring the rights of future generations}, {A person is free if their actions do not harm the potential rights of future generations}

07d4476a-687b-454f-9cf8-90b7f93c01fe.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Freedom involves a commitment to the rights of future generations}, {A person is free if their actions do not diminish the rights of future generations}

f07a1181-0b1f-4b6e-958b-8931686fe848.summary: Distinguishing between current and future rights
f07a1181-0b1f-4b6e-958b-8931686fe848.content: {There is a distinction between current individual rights and future generational rights}, {Libertarian Liberty is primarily concerned with the protection of current individual rights}, {The objection conflates the protection of current rights with the consideration of future rights}, {The view does not deny the importance of future generational rights but focuses on current rights as its primary concern}

e9b6219b-faeb-4398-ba5b-bca9c9d16e3d.summary: Rejecting the necessity of intergenerational justice in defining freedom
e9b6219b-faeb-4398-ba5b-bca9c9d16e3d.content: {It is false that a definition of freedom must include intergenerational justice to be complete}, {Libertarian Liberty defines freedom in terms of current individual rights without requiring future considerations}, {The view maintains that freedom is adequately captured by the protection of current rights without needing to account for future generations}

5fa67ef4-da3b-41c6-8cf8-1e3dd5048401.summary: Supplementing with a principle of non-aggression
5fa67ef4-da3b-41c6-8cf8-1e3dd5048401.content: {A supplementary principle of non-aggression can be adopted to address future generational concerns}, {The principle of non-aggression ensures that actions today do not harm the rights of future generations}, {With this supplementary principle, Libertarian Liberty can account for the rights of future generations while maintaining its focus on current individual rights}

746140a0-326a-4df6-b1d5-94a5ebacf3ff.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Economic freedom requires a competitive market environment}, {A monopolistic market structure can infringe on economic freedom even if individual rights are not directly violated}

d03911f6-be34-4706-9fc2-55126a0662e4.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Economic fairness is necessary for true freedom}, {A monopolistic economy undermines economic fairness and thus limits freedom}

108bf9cc-2f73-474e-9abb-a4a6af1f21d9.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Market regulation is necessary to prevent monopolies}, {Preventing monopolies is essential to maintaining freedom in the market}

4e1e37db-01d6-4bb1-b4a4-6a0f5311b69a.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Consumer autonomy is a component of freedom}, {A monopolistic market limits consumer autonomy and thus restricts freedom}

e7fb9a76-6cce-478f-be4f-024ded72829f.content: {Freedom is the protection of individual rights}, {A person is free if their rights to life, liberty, and property are not violated}, {Economic diversity is necessary for freedom}, {A lack of economic diversity due to monopolies restricts freedom}

c46f447c-8f51-4e19-8bb5-6f10d3509129.summary: Distinguishing between rights and market freedom
c46f447c-8f51-4e19-8bb5-6f10d3509129.content: {There is a distinction between individual rights and market freedom}, {Libertarian Liberty is concerned with the protection of individual rights, not market freedom}, {A monopolistic economy does not necessarily violate individual rights to life, liberty, and property}, {The intuition that consumers are not free in a monopolistic market can be explained by conflating market freedom with individual rights}

ca49b69c-248e-4310-85d3-f732e7dfa13b.summary: Rejecting the intuition that market dominance violates freedom
ca49b69c-248e-4310-85d3-f732e7dfa13b.content: {It is mistaken to believe that market dominance inherently violates individual freedom}, {Freedom, in the libertarian sense, is about the non-violation of rights, not the presence of market competition}, {A monopolistic market does not directly infringe on individual rights to life, liberty, and property}

8d563273-70e8-45f1-a702-8cd49fc1a85d.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of voluntary market participation
8d563273-70e8-45f1-a702-8cd49fc1a85d.content: {Market participation is assumed to be voluntary under Libertarian Liberty}, {As long as individuals voluntarily engage in market transactions, their rights are not violated}, {The presence of a monopoly does not negate the voluntary nature of market participation}

03daf0f9-1584-47f0-98cc-086d5b355298.content: {Freedom includes the ability to pursue one's own conception of the good life}, {A person is free if they have the capacity to make meaningful choices}, {Cultural norms that restrict meaningful choices limit freedom}

d1543a20-ef5d-4e05-b97e-3a317573b7a2.content: {Freedom is the absence of structural barriers to opportunity}, {A person is free if they can access opportunities without cultural or social constraints}, {Cultural oppression is a structural barrier to freedom}

23704b93-c8d9-466d-bb30-da2155322ce9.summary: Relational Freedom with Emphasis on Social Context
23704b93-c8d9-466d-bb30-da2155322ce9.content: {Freedom is defined by one's social relationships and context}, {A person is free if their social context allows for equal participation}, {Cultural norms that limit participation reduce freedom}

1cc63c25-b6fa-4ec4-b77a-5e873ee4f51c.content: {Freedom is the capacity for autonomous decision-making}, {A person is free if they can make decisions without undue cultural influence}, {Cultural oppression undermines autonomy}

55c949ba-2fc1-4b95-bfe3-b460e17185a1.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capability to pursue valued life activities}, {Cultural norms that limit capabilities restrict freedom}

c5dd9ec7-21c4-4d3d-b7df-efb18baaa4de.content: {Freedom requires cultural equality}, {A person is free if they are not culturally disadvantaged}, {Cultural oppression creates inequality that limits freedom}

43f7a6e9-d47b-4fe1-ba38-6c67da9e028a.content: {Freedom includes the integration of diverse cultural perspectives}, {A person is free if their cultural identity is respected and integrated}, {Cultural oppression excludes and limits freedom}

89ae6e6b-d36f-41ed-838a-90499277513a.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in cultural and social life}, {A person is free if they can engage fully in cultural practices}, {Cultural norms that restrict participation limit freedom}

d9706fd9-6867-4d7f-bfab-6d8d5768f24b.summary: Freedom as Non-Domination with Cultural Awareness
d9706fd9-6867-4d7f-bfab-6d8d5768f24b.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not dominated by cultural norms}, {Cultural oppression is a form of domination}

392fe1da-3170-4009-a88b-6542307eba37.content: {Freedom is context-dependent and culturally dynamic}, {A person is free if their cultural context supports diverse roles}, {Cultural norms that restrict roles limit freedom}

a2dea1e8-8761-4f81-9025-b9f6d7d1dc5e.summary: Distinguishing between legal and social freedom
a2dea1e8-8761-4f81-9025-b9f6d7d1dc5e.content: {There is a distinction between legal freedom and social freedom.}, {Libertarian Liberty is a theory about legal freedom, focusing on the protection of individual rights.}, {Cultural norms and practices do not constitute a violation of legal freedom if they do not infringe on individual rights.}, {The intuition that cultural oppression undermines freedom can be explained as a confusion between legal freedom and social freedom.}

f29a97ca-24d4-4944-aa11-e7d4f74d23a8.summary: Rejecting the intuition that cultural norms violate freedom
f29a97ca-24d4-4944-aa11-e7d4f74d23a8.content: {It is mistaken to claim that cultural norms inherently violate individual freedom.}, {Cultural norms do not infringe on individual rights unless they involve coercion or force.}, {The perception that cultural oppression limits freedom is based on a misunderstanding of what constitutes a violation of rights.}

cdaacfa1-3924-4916-80e8-2f5c4be5ee13.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of voluntary association
cdaacfa1-3924-4916-80e8-2f5c4be5ee13.content: {Individuals have the right to voluntarily associate with cultural norms and practices.}, {The presence of cultural norms does not violate freedom if individuals choose to participate in them.}, {The appearance of restricted freedom due to cultural norms is explained by the voluntary nature of cultural participation.}

5d0c9ba1-510a-4ba0-ba18-9b3c63958492.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without manipulation}

23084433-461c-45e7-9fc1-186880117430.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if their choices reflect their authentic desires and values}

dafcec75-a2bb-4724-af6f-87fd01b300cb.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if they reflectively endorse their choices}

9cd7049e-effe-4c2a-a9a3-07d9e6e47814.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if they make choices based on adequate information}

2d1a951d-6151-4f40-8289-be0b399814e0.summary: Liberty as Absence of External Control
2d1a951d-6151-4f40-8289-be0b399814e0.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if they are not subject to external control or influence}

056f43c4-4992-4ec2-999b-4d9f5f075e21.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if their choices are guided by rational deliberation}

60d199f0-f021-487d-9fc5-253ed6412b8b.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if they are not interfered with or manipulated}

14b4b178-e28e-4999-812f-e213a3b48ba5.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if they determine their own path in life}

a88b1ca5-e367-4d45-a798-19ec21846918.summary: Liberty as Absence of Undue Influence
a88b1ca5-e367-4d45-a798-19ec21846918.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if they are not subject to undue influence}

7f58bdaf-316a-45d9-9915-79f55ed8c7b4.summary: Liberty as Control Over One's Will
7f58bdaf-316a-45d9-9915-79f55ed8c7b4.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if they have control over their own will}

16a2b576-a639-414f-8ade-fdc164359ea9.content: {There is a distinction between coercion and manipulation in the context of autonomy-based liberty}, {Freedom as self-governance is primarily concerned with the absence of coercion, not manipulation}, {Manipulation does not necessarily undermine self-governance if the person still makes their own choices}, {The intuition that manipulation undermines freedom can be explained by conflating it with coercion}

e8c67e65-ac78-4c40-8fd6-bfa9c9f279c7.summary: Rejecting the intuition that manipulation undermines freedom
e8c67e65-ac78-4c40-8fd6-bfa9c9f279c7.content: {It is mistaken to assume that manipulation inherently undermines freedom}, {A person can still be considered free if they make their own choices, even if influenced by manipulation}, {The presence of manipulation does not automatically negate self-governance if the individual retains decision-making capacity}

6c7d9992-c0c0-4d61-b948-d7184511db43.summary: Supplementing with a focus on informed decision-making
6c7d9992-c0c0-4d61-b948-d7184511db43.content: {Freedom as self-governance can be supplemented with the requirement of informed decision-making}, {A person is free if they make choices based on adequate information, even if influenced by manipulation}, {The objection loses its force if manipulation does not prevent the person from accessing relevant information for decision-making}

1e5ca3cc-9d15-4a85-b011-72400f77451d.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without external coercion}, {Internal compulsions can limit self-governance without negating freedom}

37742457-204e-4c1a-886a-df2a757467c7.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Authenticity of desires is crucial for self-governance}

28889bec-7746-4f63-a4cb-68d3e104e28c.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Deterministic internal factors can coexist with self-governance}

fbfc575c-8b64-43e3-bbbe-2aa3d5585189.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Rational deliberation is essential for self-governance}

5a696eed-a226-4e91-bcec-138ab1907b65.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Self-governance requires alignment with personal values}

88c939f2-0951-4a79-ae8b-51b221807a41.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Self-governance operates on both conscious and subconscious levels}

2907c4f4-5abe-466f-aa7b-f94bbae7e732.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Integration of conflicting desires is necessary for self-governance}

78ea6ade-c5ec-41b1-b4f7-c2df85ad1abe.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Self-governance is guided by normative principles}

98ecbe68-5cb8-4cda-8287-b181cf2763c7.summary: Distinguishing between external and internal coercion
98ecbe68-5cb8-4cda-8287-b181cf2763c7.content: {There is a distinction between external coercion and internal compulsion}, {Freedom as self-governance primarily addresses external coercion rather than internal compulsion}, {Internal compulsion does not negate self-governance in the same way external coercion does}, {The intuition that internal compulsion undermines self-governance can be explained by conflating it with external coercion}

cdb2af70-5da3-4d9f-9302-a60bded80a91.summary: Rejecting the intuition that internal compulsion negates autonomy
cdb2af70-5da3-4d9f-9302-a60bded80a91.content: {It is mistaken to assume that internal compulsion entirely negates autonomy}, {A person can still exercise self-governance even when influenced by internal compulsions}, {The presence of internal compulsion does not automatically mean a lack of freedom if the person can still reflect and make choices}

22965975-5f29-469e-9eb1-c49d97116895.summary: Supplementing with a capacity for reflection
22965975-5f29-469e-9eb1-c49d97116895.content: {A supplementary assumption is that autonomy includes a capacity for reflection}, {Even under internal compulsion, a person can be self-governing if they retain the capacity to reflect on their desires}, {The capacity for reflection allows for self-governance despite internal compulsions}

71d74cb7-373d-4016-ae9d-b1535accafae.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Freedom requires the ability to critically reflect on social norms}, {A person is free if they can potentially reject social norms}

ef7dd1e8-b13e-464b-b2d4-74badce911ed.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Freedom requires self-awareness of social influences}, {A person is free if they can determine their own values independently}

d195a0e5-c221-40c4-99c0-5a5021741e75.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Freedom requires independence from social norms}, {A person is free if they can form beliefs and desires independently of social conditioning}

d475800e-eb7e-4a93-b3d3-79bbb9ecef7b.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Freedom requires the capacity for critical deliberation}, {A person is free if they can engage in critical deliberation about their choices}

920de6b8-353a-41ac-a4b0-c41034838d7b.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Freedom requires authenticity in decision-making}, {A person is free if their choices reflect their authentic self, independent of social norms}

4545fdc3-a6e8-4455-a1ce-d0e4407833bf.content: {There is a distinction between coercion and influence}, {Autonomy-based liberty is concerned with freedom from coercion, not freedom from influence}, {Social norms influence choices but do not necessarily coerce individuals}, {A person can be free if they are not coerced, even if their choices are influenced by social norms}

29f6d6f8-6394-4fee-bc86-3c02b2be8ef9.summary: Rejecting the intuition that social influence compromises freedom
29f6d6f8-6394-4fee-bc86-3c02b2be8ef9.content: {It is mistaken to think that social influence inherently compromises freedom}, {Freedom as self-governance allows for choices influenced by social norms as long as they are not coerced}, {The ability to make choices within a framework of social norms does not negate autonomy}

c8142a5e-515c-4213-a9ee-c306a107a73a.summary: Supplementing with the capacity for critical reflection
c8142a5e-515c-4213-a9ee-c306a107a73a.content: {Freedom requires the capacity for critical reflection on social norms}, {A person is free if they can critically assess and potentially reject social norms}, {The presence of social conditioning does not undermine freedom if the individual retains the capacity for critical reflection}

9d44cce3-d6ab-43aa-b424-5ebb7f03d07a.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if they make informed choices}

6bdf010b-f16e-4757-b3e6-54fa5e0a19c9.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if their choices are based on true beliefs}

fc31a2f1-e960-4f76-a2d5-833ef2f8249c.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if their choices reflect their authentic desires and values}

da84e999-1ffc-4f4e-92b9-bea817bd4439.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if they consent to their choices with full understanding}

3020a52b-9339-4019-b698-29d04a2fdadb.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if they have cognitive clarity about their options}

3f4bdc65-c7ae-4cf2-a3df-7ac6c2aff1ab.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if their decision-making process is transparent to themselves}

8339d779-0bcf-4f12-9299-7bb4a842e420.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if their choices are reasoned and justified}

8f1a1bcc-0827-42e6-be40-8cabf2c82bc2.summary: Distinguishing between informed and uninformed self-governance
8f1a1bcc-0827-42e6-be40-8cabf2c82bc2.content: {There is a distinction between informed self-governance and uninformed self-governance}, {Autonomy-based liberty is concerned with informed self-governance}, {A person making a choice based on false beliefs is exercising uninformed self-governance}, {The intuition that a person is not free due to ignorance can be explained by the lack of informed self-governance}

aaee704f-9985-4158-8f7c-095a62136fd9.summary: Rejecting the intuition that ignorance undermines freedom
aaee704f-9985-4158-8f7c-095a62136fd9.content: {It is false that ignorance necessarily undermines a person's freedom}, {Freedom as self-governance does not require perfect information}, {A person can still be considered free if they make choices based on their own beliefs, even if those beliefs are false}

45b8c8ad-4048-48c4-9f58-bc5bcddf7fac.summary: Explaining the role of epistemic responsibility
45b8c8ad-4048-48c4-9f58-bc5bcddf7fac.content: {Epistemic responsibility involves the duty to seek out true beliefs and avoid false ones}, {Autonomy-based liberty includes the assumption of epistemic responsibility}, {A person who fails to fulfill their epistemic responsibility may still be free, but their freedom is compromised by their own negligence}

5bcbb75a-945a-4b9e-a8ab-efac3a3108e2.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Economic conditions can influence the range of meaningful options available to a person}, {Freedom requires a range of meaningful options}

47b21e5e-2005-43dd-88b7-ae662e8afe3b.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {The context in which choices are made affects the degree of freedom}, {Economic necessity is a contextual factor that can limit freedom}

f16535d0-d8d8-4ad0-8b88-72ec268bb8fa.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Freedom requires access to a variety of meaningful options}, {Economic necessity can restrict access to meaningful options}

c5de4a35-c96f-4708-b518-ef7491a3e1b2.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Freedom is influenced by the resources available to a person}, {Economic necessity can limit the resources available for making free choices}

05f9121b-4eaa-4c73-b752-6b55f9334a64.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Freedom requires having a sufficient range of opportunities}, {Economic necessity can constrain the range of opportunities}

86a75636-30d0-4308-905d-6b1b7e8dc605.summary: Distinguishing between coercion and economic necessity
86a75636-30d0-4308-905d-6b1b7e8dc605.content: {There is a distinction between coercion and economic necessity}, {Autonomy-based liberty is concerned with freedom from coercion, not freedom from economic necessity}, {Economic necessity does not involve coercion by others and thus does not limit autonomy-based freedom}, {The intuition that economic necessity limits freedom can be explained as a confusion between different types of constraints}

e041bfb4-6f89-427e-804f-45fcf2b0cd58.summary: Rejecting the principle that freedom requires a range of meaningful options
e041bfb4-6f89-427e-804f-45fcf2b0cd58.content: {It is false that freedom requires a range of meaningful options}, {Autonomy-based liberty focuses on the ability to make one's own choices without coercion, regardless of the range of options}, {Economic necessity does not prevent self-governance if the choice is made without external coercion}

f6e28a21-8852-41e6-bf94-71da75de7e01.summary: Supplementing with a distinction between internal and external constraints
f6e28a21-8852-41e6-bf94-71da75de7e01.content: {There is a distinction between internal and external constraints on freedom}, {Autonomy-based liberty is primarily concerned with external constraints, such as coercion by others}, {Economic necessity is an internal constraint and does not affect autonomy-based freedom}, {The appearance of limited freedom due to economic necessity is explained by the presence of internal constraints, not by a lack of autonomy}

45469db0-2a13-4614-9019-fa4bfa4c229c.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Determinism is compatible with self-governance}, {A person can be self-governing even if their actions are determined by prior causes}

46b614e3-52ac-4cd5-b5ae-8db314bab280.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is self-governing if their higher-order desires align with their actions}, {Determinism does not undermine the alignment of higher-order desires with actions}

6057119a-353c-44ba-b240-e5b0ae8f6649.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is self-governing if they respond to reasons}, {Determinism is compatible with responding to reasons}

db6a4d29-babc-4b35-8e23-34b43ae5a9bb.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is self-governing if they are the source of their actions}, {Determinism does not preclude being the source of one's actions}

b02e709f-fde7-462d-8464-06189b3220cf.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Agents can cause actions independently of deterministic laws}, {Self-governance is maintained through agent causation}

d35fc206-c2dc-463a-9001-5e3b5af78f98.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Moral responsibility is compatible with determinism}, {Self-governance is linked to moral responsibility}

e3d4e058-f5db-473b-b3e3-b3b064596bc5.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Practical reasoning is compatible with determinism}, {Self-governance involves practical reasoning}

7bc12f74-09f4-499f-a5b4-6417210b287a.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is self-governing if they reflectively endorse their desires}, {Determinism does not prevent reflective endorsement}

f25b6ac9-82f2-4751-9b73-00a83be3b206.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is self-governing if they have volitional control over their actions}, {Determinism is compatible with volitional control}

82cbb9ea-ba50-4283-9b86-d17dd104fcb8.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Rational deliberation is compatible with determinism}, {Self-governance involves rational deliberation}

6a290221-5dc4-4a1c-880b-b1dcb2356f2e.summary: Distinguishing between causal determination and coercion
6a290221-5dc4-4a1c-880b-b1dcb2356f2e.content: {There is a distinction between causal determination and coercion}, {Freedom as self-governance is concerned with the absence of coercion, not the absence of causal determination}, {Determinism does not entail coercion, as it does not involve external forces compelling a person against their will}, {A person can be causally determined and still make autonomous choices if they are not coerced}

b62ee552-3616-4b23-99c2-ac9e7294ff97.summary: Rejecting the intuition that determinism undermines autonomy
b62ee552-3616-4b23-99c2-ac9e7294ff97.content: {It is mistaken to think that determinism undermines autonomy}, {Autonomy involves making choices based on one's own reasons and values, not the absence of causal determination}, {A person can be autonomous even if their actions are determined, as long as they align with their own reasons and values}

d426a612-7c82-4727-ac80-c2330ade27e3.summary: Supplementing with compatibilist understanding of freedom
d426a612-7c82-4727-ac80-c2330ade27e3.content: {Compatibilism is the view that freedom and determinism are compatible}, {Under compatibilism, freedom is understood as acting according to one's desires and reasons, even if these are determined}, {A person can be free in the sense of self-governance if they act according to their own desires and reasons, regardless of determinism}

5505b165-5fe3-47e4-bb9e-0c4fa1ba8cb2.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Freedom does not require the ability to do otherwise}

c5a51d6f-8f00-4a5b-985f-3519baa355ca.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if their higher-order desires align with their actions}

5b835f9f-08e6-4f9b-8327-84645ca98fe0.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if they can respond to reasons}

f3c8cc74-09ea-4998-8e23-994d92691551.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if their choices align with their values}

31c6fa5c-3a21-4b86-ae6b-aebd3dba5e54.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if they reflectively endorse their desires}

0a685544-e132-4349-aeb8-0b370c85b03c.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if they are morally responsible for their actions}

3f2fa32c-5c62-48e4-ae1f-3c2e62e88473.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if they are the originator of their actions}

1254abc9-76ba-4a03-a484-1431d06dfe99.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if their identity constitutes their choices}

beacc8e9-d875-4770-9821-a9f045265a01.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if they act according to practical reason}

a59c470b-ca3d-4250-ba60-63677624a670.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if they engage in rational deliberation}

3b80992f-0cdb-497c-b2e5-75dae1daa37f.summary: Distinguishing between freedom and alternative possibilities
3b80992f-0cdb-497c-b2e5-75dae1daa37f.content: {There is a distinction between freedom as self-governance and freedom as having alternative possibilities}, {Autonomy-based liberty is concerned with self-governance rather than the availability of alternative possibilities}, {A person can be free in the sense of self-governance even if they could not have chosen otherwise}, {The intuition that freedom requires alternative possibilities can be explained as a confusion between different senses of freedom}

cafa8bd7-787a-4716-ab25-7af95ace4477.summary: Rejecting the necessity of alternative possibilities for freedom
cafa8bd7-787a-4716-ab25-7af95ace4477.content: {It is false that freedom necessarily requires the ability to do otherwise}, {Freedom as self-governance is achieved when a person makes their own choices without coercion, regardless of alternative possibilities}, {The intuition that a lack of alternative possibilities compromises freedom is mistaken when considering autonomy-based liberty}

941c79d2-86ed-495f-a9a2-865b98cc40e3.summary: Supplementing with a focus on internal conditions
941c79d2-86ed-495f-a9a2-865b98cc40e3.content: {Freedom as self-governance focuses on internal conditions such as rational deliberation and absence of coercion}, {The presence of alternative possibilities is not necessary for self-governance if internal conditions are met}, {A person can be free in making their own choices if they are internally autonomous, even without alternative possibilities}

b05f6681-6090-4a56-8df8-29ab5d20438d.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is self-governing if their choices are the result of rational deliberation}, {External influences do not undermine self-governance if they are subject to rational deliberation}

389e937f-6f54-4419-b34b-dc03fbbbda9a.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is self-governing if their choices align with their authentic preferences}, {External influences do not undermine self-governance if they do not distort authentic preferences}

5e068085-f396-4b95-97bf-cd65210bbcc8.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is self-governing if they reflectively endorse their choices}, {External influences do not undermine self-governance if the person reflectively endorses the influenced choice}

c891d49c-7039-42e9-8d38-a1383d212c75.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is self-governing if their choices are informed}, {External influences do not undermine self-governance if the person is informed about the influence}

62f26aba-b80c-4a21-8f4f-53c5e538f4c5.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is self-governing if their choices are part of a coherent life plan}, {External influences do not undermine self-governance if they fit within a coherent life plan}

0c617fe5-3554-402a-85dc-81f1a3f9e733.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is self-governing if their higher-order desires align with their choices}, {External influences do not undermine self-governance if higher-order desires are not compromised}

b58bbda2-ff61-4e97-b7ac-b039704f1137.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is self-governing if their choices are consistent with their values}, {External influences do not undermine self-governance if choices remain consistent with values}

82e98e32-ad6e-4449-b046-668109d19e30.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is self-governing if their choices are directed towards self-determined goals}, {External influences do not undermine self-governance if they do not alter self-determined goals}

0cf4b61e-de90-4278-b98b-3c189015c9e5.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is self-governing if their motivation is autonomous}, {External influences do not undermine self-governance if motivation remains autonomous}

6be2d456-372a-4ea2-976a-80c5745bcb1b.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is self-governing if their choices are not manipulated}, {External influences do not undermine self-governance if they do not manipulate choices}

405e37b7-2d5e-4d46-92f0-6d71ef867f01.content: {There is a distinction between coercion and mere influence}, {Freedom as self-governance is concerned with the absence of coercion, not influence}, {Persuasive advertising does not constitute coercion as it does not involve force or threats}, {A person influenced by advertising can still be self-governing if they retain the ability to reflect and choose freely}

652cb4ca-a5c1-4ce7-8248-c5f9f1185410.summary: Rejecting the intuition that influence negates self-governance
652cb4ca-a5c1-4ce7-8248-c5f9f1185410.content: {It is mistaken to equate external influence with a loss of self-governance}, {Self-governance involves the capacity to make choices, even when influenced}, {The presence of influence does not inherently undermine a person's ability to govern themselves}

e2bda62d-2217-4739-af9e-6c87133deb1e.summary: Supplementing with the concept of reflective endorsement
e2bda62d-2217-4739-af9e-6c87133deb1e.content: {Reflective endorsement involves a person reflecting on and endorsing their influenced choices}, {A person can be self-governing if they reflectively endorse their choices, even if influenced}, {The concept of reflective endorsement allows for autonomy despite external influences}

b8480ba0-7e49-4702-aa12-f18d68c19bcd.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Freedom requires self-awareness and reflection}

acac27ec-93fc-4a01-a106-6e0dde2279af.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Freedom requires rational deliberation}

01b75e49-9e05-484e-b187-ca323689b915.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Freedom requires conscious awareness of one's motivations}

819c8f4d-f7a3-4031-90dd-7390ef658080.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Freedom requires being informed about one's options}

3642410a-2e96-40a7-b853-2b2a92567ccc.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Freedom requires authenticity in decision-making}

3bce1f03-8bc8-4765-b091-3f524eea3602.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Freedom requires deliberation about one's values and goals}

5c37a60b-a1c8-4979-8dc4-700f626ef790.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Freedom requires self-reflection on one's desires and actions}

b8ef94cf-7a11-4570-ac97-5f862879a9af.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Freedom requires self-knowledge}

6359d5ec-95d3-4d6c-a607-62e577e836ed.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Freedom requires critical evaluation of one's beliefs}

6721f6d4-b936-40e3-a382-2708adc810a6.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {Freedom requires integration of conscious and unconscious motivations}

157bf296-3463-42ca-b095-d2d2dc075199.content: {There is a distinction between self-governance and self-awareness}, {Autonomy-based liberty is a theory about self-governance rather than self-awareness}, {A person can be self-governing even if they lack self-awareness, as long as their choices are not coerced}, {The intuition that lack of self-awareness limits freedom can be explained as a confusion between self-governance and self-awareness}

6eeec33a-a58f-4366-9089-127e0855008b.summary: Rejecting the necessity of self-awareness for freedom
6eeec33a-a58f-4366-9089-127e0855008b.content: {It is false that self-awareness is necessary for freedom}, {Freedom as self-governance is concerned with the absence of coercion, not the presence of self-awareness}, {A person can make autonomous choices without being fully self-aware, as long as those choices are not influenced by external coercion}

9995983f-edac-4e79-940f-88ca3d46d4c6.summary: Explaining the intuition through the role of reflection
9995983f-edac-4e79-940f-88ca3d46d4c6.content: {Reflection is a process that can enhance self-governance but is not necessary for it}, {A person can be free in the sense of self-governance even if they do not engage in reflection}, {The appearance that self-awareness is necessary for freedom can be explained by the beneficial role of reflection in improving decision-making, not by its necessity for autonomy}

767fbcd7-ae12-4576-8167-263e47c61f1a.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without emotional manipulation}
