838a3a7b-ad6e-401e-9b81-ec2b6fe9f089.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if they reflect critically on their desires before making choices}

72821f1a-53ec-4b5a-b4d4-691abd22b7a7.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if their choices align with their true self}

c3a43727-ec90-4f13-b546-4a3487951cd6.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if their choices are based on their own volitions}

8b08dca5-0517-4477-b269-e0ac85b4c2af.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if their choices are not influenced by manipulation}

eac2e94f-6e07-4948-a87b-a25d9cfa6f12.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if they are aware of emotional influences on their choices}

995ff75a-c9ee-49e4-aa25-4bb298169d32.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if their choices are self-determined}

d4d8090f-e5e9-4cc3-8c99-1fc1b053d062.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if they critically evaluate external influences on their choices}

d71fba70-0dce-484f-b2f8-869102bbc647.content: {Freedom is self-governance}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices without coercion}, {A person is free if their choices are consistent with their values}

74842492-5964-45a0-aed9-65e8e326181d.content: {There is a distinction between coercion and emotional manipulation}, {Freedom as self-governance is a theory about freedom from coercion, not manipulation}, {Emotional manipulation does not involve direct coercion and thus does not directly compromise autonomy-based liberty}, {The intuition that emotional manipulation compromises freedom can be explained by conflating it with coercion}

d364dd3f-0c05-4330-9dbb-fb8582113647.summary: Rejecting the intuition that manipulation undermines freedom
d364dd3f-0c05-4330-9dbb-fb8582113647.content: {It is mistaken to assume that emotional manipulation necessarily undermines freedom}, {A person can still be self-governing if they are aware of and can resist emotional manipulation}, {The presence of emotional manipulation does not automatically negate the capacity for self-governance}

38ed6815-8f32-4446-b664-3a332b1196d6.summary: Supplementing with a requirement for informed awareness
38ed6815-8f32-4446-b664-3a332b1196d6.content: {Autonomy-based liberty can include a requirement for informed awareness}, {A person is free if they are aware of the influences on their decision-making process}, {Emotional manipulation does not compromise freedom if the person is aware of it and can choose to act against it}

ce9fe14d-1840-43fc-919a-c3da77000b2d.summary: Liberty as Capability and Absence of Constraints
ce9fe14d-1840-43fc-919a-c3da77000b2d.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Freedom requires the absence of external constraints on exercising capabilities}

095ff99d-bef0-41a6-9699-8ddcb0eb78a9.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Freedom requires that a person has effective opportunities to exercise their capabilities}

83cd1055-7ab5-4d10-93ed-ec9964104f68.summary: Liberty as Capability and Legal Rights
83cd1055-7ab5-4d10-93ed-ec9964104f68.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Freedom requires legal rights that protect the exercise of capabilities}

027714fc-86c9-4475-bcb5-412f41f2292d.summary: Liberty as Capability and Social Conditions
027714fc-86c9-4475-bcb5-412f41f2292d.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Freedom requires social conditions that support the exercise of capabilities}

e952b3a8-1f20-48f6-90e5-a51b703eed36.summary: Liberty as Capability and Absence of Coercion
e952b3a8-1f20-48f6-90e5-a51b703eed36.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Freedom requires the absence of coercion in exercising capabilities}

6fb93fea-1039-47e7-ac2f-615a840d2995.summary: Distinguishing between internal and external freedom
6fb93fea-1039-47e7-ac2f-615a840d2995.content: {There is a distinction between internal capabilities and external freedom}, {The Capability Approach to Liberty is a theory about internal capabilities rather than external freedom}, {A person with internal capabilities but facing external constraints is not free in the external sense}, {The intuition that someone is not free when legally prohibited from acting can be explained as a confusion between internal capabilities and external freedom}

567d3ab0-5e5a-4b31-b2c3-3dce58215224.summary: Rejecting the necessity of external freedom for capability-based freedom
567d3ab0-5e5a-4b31-b2c3-3dce58215224.content: {It is false that external constraints necessarily negate freedom if internal capabilities are present}, {Freedom in the Capability Approach is defined by the presence of valuable functionings, not the absence of external constraints}, {A person can be considered free in terms of capabilities even if external constraints exist, as long as they can achieve valuable functionings}

e7685e69-0144-4f85-8330-e70d3bf6ebef.summary: Supplementing with a focus on opportunity freedom
e7685e69-0144-4f85-8330-e70d3bf6ebef.content: {Opportunity freedom involves both having capabilities and the absence of external constraints}, {The Capability Approach can be supplemented with the assumption that true freedom requires opportunity freedom}, {With this supplementary assumption, the objection loses its force as it accounts for both internal capabilities and external constraints}

025820f1-92f2-41a4-93c3-992c2bbd845e.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {A person is free if they have the opportunity to exercise their capabilities}

3e4c0bea-4f61-4e3d-8000-d8055cf733c8.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {A person is free if they can practically exercise their capabilities without external restrictions}

3d48116f-9111-445b-949d-8a2e7a1de433.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {A person is free if their social and legal context allows the exercise of their capabilities}

e625a853-840c-46bc-b5f4-8653abd589ef.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {A person is free if they have both the capabilities and the opportunities to exercise them}

22a6726e-46de-401a-8edd-455b9423e909.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {A person is free if the conditions allow the exercise of their capabilities}

c7d29d8f-f9b1-4442-9aa9-74d9d6857696.content: {There is a distinction between having capabilities and having opportunities to exercise those capabilities}, {The Capability Approach to Liberty is concerned with the presence of capabilities, not necessarily the opportunities to exercise them}, {A person can be considered free in terms of capabilities even if societal restrictions limit their opportunities}, {The intuition that freedom requires opportunities can be explained by conflating capabilities with opportunities}

23d12f38-f8cf-49b6-a6d2-16e99c127fe9.summary: Rejecting the necessity of opportunity for freedom
23d12f38-f8cf-49b6-a6d2-16e99c127fe9.content: {It is false that having opportunities is necessary for being free in terms of capabilities}, {Freedom in the Capability Approach is defined by the presence of capabilities, not by the opportunities to exercise them}, {The presence of societal restrictions does not negate the existence of capabilities}

19e03b59-ff23-4a15-8fb5-10671c6a5d51.summary: Supplementing with a focus on potential opportunity
19e03b59-ff23-4a15-8fb5-10671c6a5d51.content: {The Capability Approach can be supplemented by considering potential opportunities as part of the evaluation of freedom}, {A person is free if they have capabilities and the potential for opportunities to exercise them in a different societal context}, {The lack of current opportunities does not negate the potential for future opportunities, preserving the notion of freedom}

c4ff29f3-346e-46e3-9706-ce8c432f282e.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Achieving valuable functionings requires both capabilities and access to necessary resources}

2df28126-1bb5-4a5b-be20-deaad451f0b4.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Opportunities to utilize capabilities are necessary for achieving valuable functionings}

5c16061a-466d-4b36-8e8c-2914f0fef9d6.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {The context in which capabilities are exercised affects the achievement of valuable functionings}

73bb4c25-d5e2-4b86-9d53-e34e0d711956.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Instrumental means are necessary to convert capabilities into valuable functionings}

ea9e0ce8-e62f-452e-9870-72572d045e72.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Integration of capabilities with external conditions is necessary for achieving valuable functionings}

bb20d121-9d96-4c1d-a642-3c20a460bbbd.summary: Distinguishing between capabilities and access to resources
bb20d121-9d96-4c1d-a642-3c20a460bbbd.content: {There is a distinction between having capabilities and having access to resources necessary to exercise those capabilities}, {The Capability Approach to Liberty is a theory about the potential to achieve valuable functionings, not the actual achievement of them}, {A person may have the capability to pursue a life they value but still require access to resources to realize those capabilities}, {The objection confuses the possession of capabilities with the realization of functionings, which requires additional conditions}

81bf3672-89ec-471d-baee-77b8afff9d90.summary: Rejecting the sufficiency of capabilities alone
81bf3672-89ec-471d-baee-77b8afff9d90.content: {It is false that capabilities alone are sufficient for achieving valuable functionings}, {Achieving valuable functionings requires both capabilities and access to necessary resources}, {The Capability Approach to Liberty does not claim that capabilities alone guarantee the realization of functionings}, {The objection mistakenly assumes that the theory claims capabilities alone are sufficient, which it does not}

82a89092-4295-42e3-bcdc-31479e844db2.summary: Supplementing with a resource access assumption
82a89092-4295-42e3-bcdc-31479e844db2.content: {The Capability Approach to Liberty can be supplemented with the assumption that access to resources is necessary for achieving functionings}, {With the supplementary assumption, the objection loses its force as it acknowledges the need for resources in addition to capabilities}, {The theory remains intact by incorporating the necessity of resource access for the realization of valuable functionings}, {The objection is addressed by recognizing that capabilities must be paired with resources to achieve functionings}

aea93d3a-14a4-49cb-8fb9-0fa952973e0d.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {A person is free if they have the motivation to utilize their capabilities}

61f6cfe3-a405-4534-8761-7816c59c3534.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {A person is free if they have desires aligned with utilizing their capabilities}

1040a359-6796-4031-b0ed-f3be2930a3f4.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {A person is free if they have both the opportunity and motivation to utilize their capabilities}

013c841e-4451-4511-bed2-d45668396579.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {A person is free if they have a value system that motivates the use of their capabilities}

9241e6d6-57ef-4eea-bff3-e76f0e1ab9d8.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {A person is free if they have an interest in utilizing their capabilities}

1ffacdad-5d3f-4e89-a36e-57c883553676.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {A person is free if their motivation conditions the use of their capabilities}

681dfabf-ccd1-4c1a-911e-f9126434003b.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {A person is free if they are willing to utilize their capabilities}

4634beeb-9271-4d2b-b5a0-2abf9f47b676.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {A person is free if their capabilities are responsive to their motivations}

cf99c94e-d418-4d48-b9e6-77e1e4b2c04d.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {A person is free if their liberty depends on their motivation to act}

dc8de606-e410-4fbd-ac45-e4bb63021b39.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {A person is free if there is a synergy between their capabilities and motivation}

f03011a0-810f-4fd1-bd05-786e85ebf8a0.content: {There is a distinction between having capabilities and having the motivation to use them}, {The Capability Approach to Liberty is concerned with the presence of capabilities, not the motivation to exercise them}, {A person is considered free if they have the capabilities, regardless of their motivation to use them}, {The intuition that motivation affects freedom can be explained by conflating freedom with personal desire or interest}

689e6950-3d00-4f2d-bcc3-5d16abe4bccd.summary: Rejecting the intuition that motivation is necessary for freedom
689e6950-3d00-4f2d-bcc3-5d16abe4bccd.content: {It is false that motivation is necessary for a person to be considered free}, {Freedom is defined by the presence of capabilities, not by the motivation to act on them}, {A person can be free to pursue higher education if they have the capability, even if they lack the motivation}

89e4d014-3681-4156-8c68-bcfe5f7b3fc5.summary: Supplementing with a distinction between internal and external freedom
89e4d014-3681-4156-8c68-bcfe5f7b3fc5.content: {Freedom can be understood as having both internal and external dimensions}, {The Capability Approach focuses on external freedom, which is about having the capabilities}, {Internal freedom, which involves motivation and desire, is separate from the external freedom provided by capabilities}, {A person can have external freedom without internal freedom, maintaining the focus on capabilities}

6e9ae25f-4a52-4044-882d-175a65e12f6a.summary: Revised Capability Approach with Social Context
6e9ae25f-4a52-4044-882d-175a65e12f6a.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Social and cultural influences are integral to understanding a person's freedom}, {A person's freedom is constrained if social or cultural pressures significantly limit their choices}

92f0733a-09e6-49d1-9d8b-11af6429be74.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Freedom must be assessed within the context of social and cultural environments}, {Cultural pressures can limit the real freedom of individuals}

6b33a2eb-4906-4edb-9708-45b16bddcf40.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {The assessment of freedom includes the evaluation of social and cultural constraints}, {Cultural expectations can impact the realization of capabilities}

b1c69db2-4934-4563-b301-3199306c49b9.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Freedom is a holistic concept that includes social and cultural dimensions}, {Cultural and social factors are essential in evaluating true freedom}

27b8b23d-e019-44f8-b641-2a05c8c3bd33.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Cultural sensitivity is necessary for a complete understanding of freedom}, {Cultural influences can shape and limit the capabilities available to individuals}

69e546fa-c157-4183-8d1c-6f0ec493e2d7.summary: Distinguishing between internal and external constraints
69e546fa-c157-4183-8d1c-6f0ec493e2d7.content: {There is a distinction between internal constraints, such as cultural pressures, and external constraints, such as legal restrictions}, {The capability approach primarily addresses external constraints on freedom}, {Cultural pressures are internal constraints and do not directly limit the capabilities defined by the capability approach}, {The intuition that cultural pressures constrain freedom can be explained by conflating internal and external constraints}

60a0b6dd-bea6-4d03-9c0f-c917b904873c.summary: Rejecting the intuition that cultural pressures negate freedom
60a0b6dd-bea6-4d03-9c0f-c917b904873c.content: {It is mistaken to assume that cultural pressures negate freedom if the individual still possesses the capability to choose otherwise}, {Cultural pressures influence preferences but do not eliminate the capability to pursue alternative options}, {The presence of cultural expectations does not inherently reduce the set of capabilities available to an individual}

e519ffd9-57ce-4c1d-a375-01ac0b50c436.summary: Incorporating social context as a supplementary assumption
e519ffd9-57ce-4c1d-a375-01ac0b50c436.content: {The capability approach can be supplemented with the assumption that social context influences the value of capabilities}, {Cultural pressures can be seen as factors that affect the desirability of exercising certain capabilities}, {With this supplementary assumption, the capability approach can account for the influence of social and cultural factors on the perceived value of capabilities}

22699624-6fe0-4c5e-8a84-f99fd2242eb1.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {A person is free if external conditions do not prohibit the use of their capabilities}

44cee617-2522-4378-95cb-fbd10d5df518.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {A person is free if they have the opportunity to use their capabilities without external constraints}

19e56b0f-4d32-40c8-ad70-e0967e6b4e2b.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {A person is free if they have both the capabilities and the opportunity to act on them}

b32433d6-5e08-4902-8f6c-9e3876378131.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {A person is free if the context allows the exercise of their capabilities}

ac2a76a9-971f-4a74-8fe4-10dcd3ba2058.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {A person is free if they can practically exercise their capabilities in their environment}

ee98d93b-41e8-49d2-b31f-cb4a1b430a11.content: {There is a distinction between having capabilities and having opportunities to exercise those capabilities}, {The Capability Approach to Liberty is concerned with the possession of capabilities, not necessarily the opportunities to exercise them}, {External conditions that prevent the exercise of capabilities do not negate the possession of those capabilities}, {A person can be considered free in terms of capabilities even if external conditions limit their opportunities to act on them}

519d35b9-cfb8-4712-8cf2-6d7b51a028a6.summary: Rejecting the intuition that external conditions negate freedom
519d35b9-cfb8-4712-8cf2-6d7b51a028a6.content: {It is mistaken to claim that external prohibitions negate the freedom defined by capabilities}, {Freedom in the Capability Approach is about the internal ability to achieve functionings, not the external conditions}, {The presence of external prohibitions does not alter the internal capabilities a person possesses}, {The intuition that external conditions negate freedom can be explained by conflating capabilities with opportunities}

81350d00-3a0d-4059-9ef0-2b09a9fad93d.summary: Supplementing with a distinction between freedom and effective freedom
81350d00-3a0d-4059-9ef0-2b09a9fad93d.content: {Introduce a distinction between freedom and effective freedom, where effective freedom includes the ability to act on capabilities}, {The Capability Approach to Liberty focuses on freedom as the possession of capabilities}, {Effective freedom requires both capabilities and the absence of prohibitive external conditions}, {The objection loses its force when recognizing that the Capability Approach addresses freedom, not effective freedom}

3811cec4-e8cf-4354-b7e4-d106aa3361a2.summary: Capability Approach with Emphasis on Non-Coercion
3811cec4-e8cf-4354-b7e4-d106aa3361a2.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {A person is free only if they are not coerced in their choices}

03fe54db-1a2e-498e-a77e-31413de23647.summary: Capability Approach with Actual Choice Requirement
03fe54db-1a2e-498e-a77e-31413de23647.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {A person is free only if they can make actual choices among their capabilities}

504e5fb3-87d9-4123-91f9-e61de7e55585.summary: Capability Approach with Emphasis on Autonomy
504e5fb3-87d9-4123-91f9-e61de7e55585.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {A person is free only if they exercise autonomy in their decision-making}

feb1f53a-9fb7-413d-9c89-b26b1cc31f1f.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {A person is free only if they have volitional control over their choices}

56c262dc-3c15-4400-802e-53424fb7e6b8.summary: Capability Approach with Integrated Choice and Capability
56c262dc-3c15-4400-802e-53424fb7e6b8.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Freedom requires both the presence of capabilities and the exercise of choice}

8afc69c1-0af7-4b91-bb55-234864340c39.summary: Distinguishing between capabilities and actual choice
8afc69c1-0af7-4b91-bb55-234864340c39.content: {There is a distinction between having capabilities and exercising actual choice}, {The capability approach focuses on the potential to achieve valuable functionings, not on the exercise of choice itself}, {A person can be considered free in terms of capabilities even if their actual choices are constrained}, {The intuition that actual choice is necessary for freedom can be explained by a different conception of freedom that is not the focus of the capability approach}

a9ffbdff-e834-4828-b81e-e5afa8a086a4.summary: Rejecting the necessity of actual choice for freedom
a9ffbdff-e834-4828-b81e-e5afa8a086a4.content: {It is false that actual choice is necessary for freedom within the capability approach}, {Freedom is defined by the presence of capabilities, not by the exercise of choice}, {A person coerced into a specific path still possesses freedom in terms of capabilities if they have the potential to pursue other valuable functionings}, {The objection mistakenly conflates freedom with the exercise of choice, which is not required by the capability approach}

0ad4de9f-4507-475d-8ee7-826da82e0e35.summary: Supplementing with a focus on internal capabilities
0ad4de9f-4507-475d-8ee7-826da82e0e35.content: {The capability approach can be supplemented by considering internal capabilities, which include the ability to make choices}, {Internal capabilities are part of the broader set of capabilities that define freedom}, {A person coerced into a specific path may lack internal capabilities, which affects their freedom}, {The objection loses its force when internal capabilities are included in the assessment of freedom}

a4061fdc-73d0-4463-b2b2-dc5e6408cc82.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Freedom requires the absence of significant risks in exercising capabilities}

b0ba45e4-3698-4c4b-8030-59438ec9cffe.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Freedom requires a secure environment for exercising capabilities}

7ba198c9-77b8-4c6a-a065-d28b6520eaea.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Freedom requires responsiveness to risks in exercising capabilities}

bcbdc4db-71ee-49a1-8434-7de8996666f8.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Freedom requires the elimination of significant risks in exercising capabilities}

233da87e-9202-4bff-91c8-0c4358427965.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Freedom requires protective measures against risks in exercising capabilities}

57e9be4b-d2e6-4a6f-8e18-3ce271b3108f.summary: Distinguishing between capabilities and effective freedom
57e9be4b-d2e6-4a6f-8e18-3ce271b3108f.content: {There is a distinction between having capabilities and having effective freedom to exercise them}, {The Capability Approach to Liberty is a theory about having capabilities, not necessarily about the absence of risks in exercising them}, {A person can have the capability to protest even if exercising it involves significant risks}, {The intuition that someone is not free due to risks can be explained as a confusion between capabilities and effective freedom}

fdf7c5fe-9eac-4480-ab53-31611e1dcbba.summary: Rejecting the principle that freedom requires absence of significant risks
fdf7c5fe-9eac-4480-ab53-31611e1dcbba.content: {It is false that freedom necessarily requires the absence of significant risks in exercising capabilities}, {Freedom as defined by the Capability Approach is about having the capabilities themselves, not the conditions under which they are exercised}, {The presence of risks does not negate the existence of capabilities, and thus does not negate freedom as defined by the Capability Approach}

05bbafe3-984f-4cce-b262-26ad608c12dc.summary: Supplementing with a distinction between internal and external constraints
05bbafe3-984f-4cce-b262-26ad608c12dc.content: {There is a distinction between internal constraints, which are about capabilities, and external constraints, which are about risks}, {The Capability Approach focuses on internal constraints and the presence of capabilities}, {By supplementing the theory with a focus on internal constraints, the objection about risks as external constraints loses its force}, {A person can be considered free in terms of capabilities even if external constraints like risks are present}

b20e23a0-ef16-4623-9b73-1b503545f7d7.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Personal autonomy is a necessary component of freedom}, {A person is free if they are not manipulated by others in their decision-making}

6cf74085-98c8-4d4a-bbb0-5499d71ead9e.summary: Capability Approach with Autonomy and Non-Interference
6cf74085-98c8-4d4a-bbb0-5499d71ead9e.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Personal autonomy is a necessary component of freedom}, {A person is free if they are not subject to interference by others in their decision-making}

c0d07d96-8ccc-47f5-9e66-46045cb6c96c.summary: Capability Approach with Autonomy and Authenticity
c0d07d96-8ccc-47f5-9e66-46045cb6c96c.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Personal autonomy is a necessary component of freedom}, {A person is free if their decisions reflect their authentic self}

16dd4075-88cb-40fb-9bb3-dd2b824e847b.summary: Capability Approach with Autonomy and Informed Decision-Making
16dd4075-88cb-40fb-9bb3-dd2b824e847b.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Personal autonomy is a necessary component of freedom}, {A person is free if they make decisions based on adequate information}

274fab2f-7b56-49d1-9d6a-fdb2e5205438.summary: Capability Approach with Autonomy and Voluntariness
274fab2f-7b56-49d1-9d6a-fdb2e5205438.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Personal autonomy is a necessary component of freedom}, {A person is free if their decisions are made voluntarily}

51494039-c9f1-453d-ab1e-bf8675626d82.content: {There is a distinction between having capabilities and exercising personal autonomy}, {The capability approach focuses on the availability of opportunities rather than the exercise of autonomy}, {A person can have capabilities without necessarily exercising autonomy if they are manipulated}, {The intuition that autonomy is necessary for freedom can be explained by the difference between having opportunities and making autonomous choices}

af492122-3dd4-41ad-b0b1-a95c41cbd7e3.summary: Rejecting the necessity of autonomy for freedom
af492122-3dd4-41ad-b0b1-a95c41cbd7e3.content: {It is false that personal autonomy is necessary for freedom in the capability approach}, {Freedom is defined by the presence of capabilities, not by the exercise of autonomy}, {A person can be considered free if they have the capabilities to pursue valuable functionings, regardless of manipulation}

169dc337-96e8-4733-935d-1dbfcfb09689.summary: Supplementing with a focus on autonomy as a capability
169dc337-96e8-4733-935d-1dbfcfb09689.content: {Autonomy can be considered a valuable functioning within the capability approach}, {The capability to make autonomous decisions can be included as one of the valuable functionings}, {The presence of autonomy as a capability addresses concerns about manipulation and compromised freedom}

33144a48-ca59-4b8f-96c7-d54cd8d7b4a3.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Freedom requires not only capabilities but also equality of opportunity}

54a29677-9204-4136-b24d-85a660aaea49.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Freedom is constrained by systemic discrimination that limits opportunities}

fcd9b20b-39c4-4e17-ab29-6ece736b9517.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Freedom involves social and relational factors that affect capabilities}

aa73b1d2-960e-4863-8a4d-1fab6d61a1b1.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Freedom is context-dependent and influenced by social and economic conditions}

0fe330e1-100c-4404-8299-e25bf103238c.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Freedom requires both capabilities and fair access to opportunities}

4072bbc1-ae62-4fb6-92ed-4205f262ee6d.content: {There is a distinction between capabilities and opportunities.}, {The capability approach focuses on the internal abilities of individuals rather than external opportunities.}, {Freedom as capabilities does not necessarily entail equality of opportunity.}, {A person can be considered free in terms of capabilities even if they face unequal opportunities.}

c1b1aeb9-e814-4caf-8d88-89e39ca6a6fc.summary: Rejecting the necessity of equality of opportunity for freedom
c1b1aeb9-e814-4caf-8d88-89e39ca6a6fc.content: {It is false that equality of opportunity is necessary for freedom.}, {Freedom can be understood as the ability to achieve valuable functionings regardless of the equality of opportunity.}, {Systemic discrimination does not negate the presence of capabilities.}, {A person can still be free in terms of capabilities even if they face systemic discrimination.}

54b60544-9c6a-40a5-8ea3-87160680afe9.summary: Supplementing with a focus on social structures
54b60544-9c6a-40a5-8ea3-87160680afe9.content: {The capability approach can be supplemented with a focus on social structures.}, {Social structures can influence the realization of capabilities.}, {Freedom involves not only having capabilities but also the ability to navigate social structures.}, {Addressing systemic discrimination can enhance the realization of capabilities.}

f5338ac9-ddbc-47a8-a73e-23f2f0322083.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {Individual freedom can coexist with community participation}

a0755387-2a2c-4c75-b5c3-981cb342aea0.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {Individual freedom can exist independently of community participation}, {Community participation enhances individual freedom}

566f46ab-1dd8-47d7-afd2-b17cce1f918d.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {Freedom has both individual and communal aspects}

0c5442d0-219a-48bc-80d9-592a562503cf.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {The context determines whether individual or communal freedom is primary}

4102e010-b45a-456a-b550-1869ad3b8cf6.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {Individual freedom and community participation are complementary}

c545c8de-a5b3-4c9d-941a-8c42aa4d5700.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {Individual freedom is integrated with community participation}

a0af2c8a-7ca3-4b7a-b892-13c28eceb5ef.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {A balance between individual freedom and community participation is necessary}

e8049574-9bc6-493c-a8e2-320f48eb2927.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {Individual freedom and community participation are interdependent}

18a4fc82-8c2e-4b45-ad9b-ad58c0115ab0.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {Freedom is fundamentally relational, involving both individual and community aspects}

0c519cd7-2d9b-4087-98ba-8173dd9b3d8d.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {Freedom encompasses multiple dimensions, including individual and communal}

c3b45882-3efb-4da4-a89b-94365f10948b.summary: Distinguishing between individual and communal freedom
c3b45882-3efb-4da4-a89b-94365f10948b.content: {There is a distinction between individual freedom and communal freedom}, {Communitarian Liberty is a theory about communal freedom rather than individual freedom}, {A person living in isolation may experience individual freedom but lacks communal freedom}, {The intuition that someone in isolation is free can be explained as a focus on individual freedom rather than communal freedom}

32c419fe-07b5-4ed4-aea1-04c7cd57d3da.summary: Rejecting the intuition that isolation equates to freedom
32c419fe-07b5-4ed4-aea1-04c7cd57d3da.content: {It is false that a person living in isolation is fully free if they are not participating in community life}, {Freedom as participation in community life emphasizes the importance of communal decision-making processes}, {The appearance of freedom in isolation can be explained by a limited understanding of freedom that neglects communal aspects}

98596eaf-d662-46e8-95a1-c8b559716274.content: {Relational autonomy suggests that true freedom involves relationships and interactions with others}, {Freedom as participation in community life aligns with the idea that autonomy is relational}, {The intuition that someone in isolation is free can be explained by a misunderstanding of autonomy as purely individual rather than relational}

1d1df348-2b91-4b43-853a-6df3778a9e2f.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can voluntarily engage in communal decision-making processes}, {Coerced participation does not constitute true freedom}

dc54b80f-8c19-45e5-b7e2-cf6a06bf262c.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they have the option to engage in communal decision-making processes}, {Freedom requires the absence of coercion in participation}

f1d05d88-00ee-463c-972b-1ff57b52baef.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they consent to engage in communal decision-making processes}, {Freedom is undermined by participation without consent}

e437569a-456b-4b29-830a-45673e6a3e48.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if their autonomy is respected in communal decision-making processes}, {Respect for autonomy requires that participation is not coerced}

449c7f9e-c798-44f6-aeba-9e72308793bf.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they choose to engage in communal decision-making processes}, {Freedom involves the ability to choose whether or not to participate}

a035d85b-6b92-463b-a54c-9c1b6750f8d0.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they engage in communal decision-making processes without coercion}, {Coercion negates the freedom of participation}

ca3e3c70-fdd8-464b-b6c7-458f2bc825f9.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they act as an agent in communal decision-making processes}, {Agency requires freedom from coercion}

cf93583d-8219-47a8-a09d-0beee5cf3112.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they are empowered to engage in communal decision-making processes}, {Empowerment requires voluntary participation}

6ca44688-eb37-4272-bfd2-508567715be3.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they autonomously engage in communal decision-making processes}, {Autonomy in participation is incompatible with coercion}

319159cb-ee00-414e-91ce-132dd191eea9.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they self-determine their engagement in communal decision-making processes}, {Self-determination excludes coerced participation}

a55a74cd-5407-4302-a96c-cc54a926a2a1.summary: Distinguishing between voluntary and coerced participation
a55a74cd-5407-4302-a96c-cc54a926a2a1.content: {There is a distinction between voluntary participation and coerced participation in community life}, {Communitarian Liberty is a theory about voluntary participation rather than coerced participation}, {Coerced participation does not fulfill the conditions of freedom as it lacks genuine consent}, {The intuition that coerced participation undermines freedom is consistent with Communitarian Liberty when participation is understood as voluntary}

19e45d62-9b80-4b78-888e-73288fc125a4.summary: Rejecting the intuition that coercion always undermines freedom
19e45d62-9b80-4b78-888e-73288fc125a4.content: {It is false that coercion always undermines freedom in the context of community participation}, {Participation in community decision-making can still contribute to freedom even if initially coerced, as it may lead to genuine engagement and consent over time}, {The intuition that coercion undermines freedom can be explained by a misunderstanding of the potential transformative effects of participation}

721754ef-8ccc-485b-9016-68f8c0687aef.summary: Supplementing with a requirement for initial consent
721754ef-8ccc-485b-9016-68f8c0687aef.content: {Communitarian Liberty can include a supplementary assumption that initial consent is required for true freedom}, {This assumption allows for the possibility that participation must begin with consent to be considered free}, {The objection loses its force because coerced participation without initial consent does not meet the criteria for freedom under this supplemented view}

3d92279b-8647-4fad-b370-6d09ce3135a6.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {Freedom also involves an internal state of autonomy and self-determination}

75d7059c-93e2-417a-9b4a-95e1ffd685a9.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {Freedom is also an internal state of mind independent of external conditions}

beb71462-e11b-42a1-809e-c3e9b993fdf1.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {Freedom requires both external participation and internal psychological states of freedom}

3aaad497-0be6-4a01-ae90-81c8b2bfef39.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {Freedom is also about the relationships and connections that foster a sense of autonomy}

0d900030-f1ba-4f7c-8b67-ac361d7187ec.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {Freedom is a holistic concept that includes both internal and external dimensions}

4ce0ab3c-0a74-449a-a499-2032855f67c4.summary: Distinguishing between internal and external freedom
4ce0ab3c-0a74-449a-a499-2032855f67c4.content: {There is a distinction between internal freedom and external freedom}, {Communitarian Liberty is a theory about external freedom rather than internal freedom}, {A person can feel internally free without participating in community life, but this does not affect their external freedom}, {The intuition that someone is free due to their internal state can be explained as a confusion between internal and external freedom}

a7b07cda-d619-42c7-a4b5-b53a3eea9845.summary: Rejecting the intuition that internal feelings alone constitute freedom
a7b07cda-d619-42c7-a4b5-b53a3eea9845.content: {It is false that a person is free solely based on their internal state of mind}, {Freedom as participation in community life requires external conditions to be met}, {The feeling of freedom without external participation is not sufficient for true freedom}

db1738c7-2287-406f-be75-af40538659a2.content: {Freedom involves relational conditions that go beyond internal states}, {Participation in community life provides the relational conditions necessary for true freedom}, {The appearance of freedom based solely on internal feelings is explained by overlooking the importance of relational conditions}

a0cd72f9-4f30-4130-bcc4-e2fbbca523ce.content: {Freedom is participation in community life when the community is just}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes that are non-oppressive}

c9d52227-c3d6-482f-827b-03497b1bf4ec.content: {Freedom is participation in community life under conditions of equality}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes that respect individual rights}

7286c7e4-adb1-43d8-908a-5746cf869ffe.content: {Freedom is participation in community life that promotes individual autonomy}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes that enhance personal development}

c7637246-93db-4246-bbe5-d23623c52667.content: {Freedom is participation in community life that is contextually beneficial}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes that are contextually empowering}

86ebae30-c764-41d1-8926-7177a43c0b2a.content: {Freedom is participation in community life balanced with individual rights}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes that do not infringe on personal freedoms}

39d433ab-8d21-443f-8661-b9547ee56707.content: {Freedom is participation in community life guided by ethical principles}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes that adhere to ethical standards}

44a915cf-929b-45ca-a768-f716a7b7d417.content: {Freedom is participation in community life that is inclusive}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes that include diverse perspectives}

b4b861cf-7776-4ab7-9b2b-c7f7a40e196a.content: {Freedom is participation in community life that empowers individuals}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes that empower all members}

cf1e0032-88b4-4e46-8a9a-a317e8a77ee7.content: {Freedom is participation in community life that is democratic}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes that are democratic and fair}

0349b134-6741-4802-9687-f82bb1d803b4.content: {Freedom is participation in community life that responds to individual needs}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes that are responsive to individual needs}

2843716e-f437-41a3-9fe7-beb568ad9ff3.summary: Distinguishing between beneficial and non-beneficial participation
2843716e-f437-41a3-9fe7-beb568ad9ff3.content: {There is a distinction between beneficial and non-beneficial participation in community life}, {Communitarian Liberty is a theory about beneficial participation in community life}, {Participation in oppressive or discriminatory decision-making processes is not considered beneficial participation}, {A person is not truly participating in community life if the processes are oppressive or discriminatory}, {The intuition that participation does not enhance freedom in oppressive scenarios can be explained by distinguishing between beneficial and non-beneficial participation}

b7004aa1-ae42-4d99-967a-49327ee08fec.summary: Rejecting the intuition that all participation is beneficial
b7004aa1-ae42-4d99-967a-49327ee08fec.content: {It is false that all participation in community life is beneficial for an individual's freedom}, {Only participation in fair and inclusive decision-making processes is beneficial for freedom}, {The appearance that participation in oppressive processes enhances freedom is mistaken}, {True participation requires processes that respect individual rights and equality}

4a64955b-c5ee-4256-9308-09532f1246f9.content: {A supplementary assumption is that community decision-making processes must be fair and inclusive}, {Participation in community life enhances freedom only if the processes are fair and inclusive}, {The objection loses its force when considering that oppressive or discriminatory processes do not meet the fairness condition}, {Freedom as participation is contingent on the fairness of the decision-making processes}

2664f59d-9cd0-4ed6-bcf1-030a55986b65.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in democratic communal decision-making processes}

6394f9f1-f89f-429f-9c67-7e9d786ae1f7.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in fair and transparent communal decision-making processes}

dd848e0f-b80b-4ee7-b6c9-45b4e92dcde0.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in consensus-based communal decision-making processes}

7b1fb0cd-9e88-4df5-9aa4-1f00fde8f951.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in deliberative communal decision-making processes}

d42921da-8199-4185-ad09-51f9d2255047.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes that respect individual rights}

193391f9-6a92-4e5e-81f7-2a3e0ba0a3b9.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in inclusive communal decision-making processes}

d023528e-d215-4025-8909-a0737c87fa50.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in egalitarian communal decision-making processes}

5b280392-4651-4cac-8582-d7832a7b16ed.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in participatory communal decision-making processes}

a43fbba7-18ea-46de-bee2-b5552f161ff8.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes that promote individual autonomy}

fa21dfc9-bddd-414b-a1e1-a5aa231b69e8.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in pluralistic communal decision-making processes}

096fdf2f-5197-44ea-949a-3420622c1040.content: {There is a distinction between meaningful and token participation in community life}, {Communitarian liberty requires meaningful participation, which involves having a genuine influence on decision-making}, {Participation in a non-democratic community may be token rather than meaningful, thus not constituting true freedom}, {The intuition that participation in non-democratic processes limits freedom can be explained by the lack of meaningful influence}

c5ed9442-8ce2-4d23-b681-5343ed78d398.summary: Rejecting the intuition that non-democratic participation limits freedom
c5ed9442-8ce2-4d23-b681-5343ed78d398.content: {It is mistaken to assume that all non-democratic processes inherently limit freedom}, {A person can be free if they participate in a community where decisions are made through consensus or other non-democratic means}, {The key is whether the individual has a role in shaping the community's decisions, not the specific decision-making structure}

d515675a-6e5a-4169-883b-f3423c27d3aa.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of voluntary association
d515675a-6e5a-4169-883b-f3423c27d3aa.content: {Freedom as participation in community life assumes voluntary association with the community}, {A person is free if they choose to participate in a community, regardless of its decision-making structure}, {The objection loses its force if we assume that individuals freely choose to engage with non-democratic communities}

23d66c24-534a-4e63-813e-d2d37e3550cd.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {True freedom requires equal influence in decision-making processes}

ecc02c9d-c98b-4ebf-bcd4-7a71078df500.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {Freedom is achieved through deliberative democracy where all voices are equally considered}

3c819cae-14ad-479c-b5cd-5078b38c61ff.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {Freedom is realized when decisions are made by consensus, ensuring equal influence}

ba2cc666-16e3-4ef4-af59-b6077a6e9936.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {Freedom requires mechanisms to ensure equitable influence in decision-making}

c9ab10c5-602f-4ff8-bcd2-d28bc2b92aaf.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {Freedom is proportional to the influence one has in decision-making, adjusted for fairness}

d750dd14-4633-4702-8692-1839fd4fda40.content: {There is a distinction between participation and influence in community decision-making}, {Communitarian Liberty is a theory about participation rather than equal influence}, {Unequal influence does not negate the freedom to participate in communal decision-making}, {The intuition that unequal influence undermines freedom can be explained as a confusion between participation and influence}

cfe9c139-d61a-4680-9953-06b147355870.summary: Rejecting the principle of equal influence
cfe9c139-d61a-4680-9953-06b147355870.content: {It is false that true freedom requires equal influence in decision-making processes}, {Freedom as participation in community life does not necessitate equal influence for all participants}, {The appearance that unequal influence undermines freedom is based on a mistaken principle}

cef59caf-ecd4-4853-9707-18f83af44bd7.summary: Supplementing with the value of diverse roles
cef59caf-ecd4-4853-9707-18f83af44bd7.content: {Community decision-making benefits from diverse roles and levels of influence}, {Freedom as participation includes the freedom to occupy different roles with varying influence}, {The intuition that unequal influence undermines freedom is addressed by recognizing the value of diverse contributions in community life}

181f0b6b-0735-4ce0-830b-e294ce981eae.content: {Freedom is the ability to make autonomous choices}, {A person is free if they have the capacity for self-determination}, {Community provides resources and support for individual autonomy}

b7743fe3-374e-4fd8-931f-606c9b25f844.content: {Freedom is the capacity for self-determination}, {A person is free if they can form and pursue their own goals}, {Social relationships are essential for developing and exercising autonomy}

3fea4be5-19f9-45b1-9ccb-4bb67952b7d6.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to one's own will}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own interests}, {Community context shapes and influences individual freedom}

e7523311-4910-4e92-a62f-82addfbf4729.content: {Freedom is the capacity for personal autonomy}, {A person is free if they can make independent choices}, {Community context provides a framework for understanding autonomy}

5c79c800-b2bf-4d38-b5cc-87ae2571e3c2.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in decision-making}, {A person is free if they can engage in self-governance}, {Community participation enhances but is not necessary for autonomy}

42368806-fecb-44e1-81a5-cef8105df68f.summary: Distinguishing between individual and communal freedom
42368806-fecb-44e1-81a5-cef8105df68f.content: {There is a distinction between individual freedom and communal freedom}, {Communitarian Liberty is a theory about communal freedom rather than individual freedom}, {A person can be individually free through personal autonomy, but this does not negate the value of communal freedom}, {The intuition that freedom can exist without community is based on a focus on individual freedom, not communal freedom}

c99b314b-4382-413c-bd10-dd094b81794c.summary: Rejecting the intuition that freedom is solely individual
c99b314b-4382-413c-bd10-dd094b81794c.content: {It is mistaken to think that freedom is solely about personal autonomy}, {Freedom involves both individual autonomy and participation in community life}, {The scenario of personal autonomy without community overlooks the social dimension of human life}, {The intuition that freedom can be defined without community is incomplete}

a42da9f9-615d-4409-ba0b-98305e5cc89d.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of social nature
a42da9f9-615d-4409-ba0b-98305e5cc89d.content: {Humans are inherently social beings, and this affects their conception of freedom}, {Freedom as participation in community life reflects the social nature of human existence}, {The scenario of personal autonomy without community is an abstraction that ignores the social context of human life}, {The appearance of freedom without community is explained by overlooking the social aspect of human nature}

2dfe4535-4d61-4c40-b035-d98f5e9f5011.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can voluntarily engage in communal decision-making processes}, {Community obligations do not inherently limit freedom if they are voluntarily accepted}

811d5f94-30b6-47ec-8c3b-731698d761e9.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they choose to engage in communal decision-making processes}, {Obligations that are chosen do not limit freedom}

84bdb0f8-f2e0-48b9-b327-ff12b70ecf7a.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they engage in communal decision-making processes under conditions they have agreed to}, {Community obligations are compatible with freedom if they are based on prior consent}

2ff80bae-85dc-4c5c-95ba-6cd71cfe9d44.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they engage in communal decision-making processes with informed consent}, {Community obligations do not limit freedom if they are consented to}

e5ef7b57-386c-4a3b-ac37-af4fc915282b.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they engage in communal decision-making processes autonomously}, {Community obligations respect freedom if they preserve individual autonomy}

a67040e8-2bdf-4d00-ab1d-bae8fca77b80.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they autonomously choose to engage in communal decision-making processes}, {Community obligations are compatible with freedom if they enhance participatory autonomy}

1f79ec05-8d32-4d3b-8930-fca0c730bfcd.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they engage in communal decision-making processes through mutual agreement}, {Community obligations do not limit freedom if they arise from mutual agreement}

278e20d4-4bb2-4037-8d1a-f58a85a3409e.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they engage in communal decision-making processes that harmonize with personal goals}, {Community obligations are compatible with freedom if they align with personal goals}

8304e87c-3b1b-47f7-afd7-73dad357d930.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they engage in communal decision-making processes that integrate personal and communal interests}, {Community obligations do not limit freedom if they integrate personal and communal interests}

3c61f018-3349-48f3-9cc3-4f6da3be619b.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they engage in communal decision-making processes based on reciprocal understanding}, {Community obligations are compatible with freedom if they are based on reciprocal understanding}

1cd6538b-fd21-4ca6-acde-20e3ccebcdbc.content: {There is a distinction between obligations and constraints on freedom}, {Obligations are commitments that do not necessarily limit freedom if they are voluntarily accepted}, {Freedom as participation in community life involves voluntary engagement in communal decision-making}, {A person who voluntarily accepts community obligations is not constrained in the relevant sense of freedom}

b43d2fd3-a47d-43b8-b61d-5fc714869188.summary: Rejecting the intuition that obligations limit freedom
b43d2fd3-a47d-43b8-b61d-5fc714869188.content: {It is mistaken to assume that obligations inherently limit freedom}, {Community obligations can enhance freedom by enabling participation in decision-making processes}, {The intuition that obligations limit freedom fails to recognize the value of communal engagement in defining freedom}

c750c68c-c6f5-4ea1-b931-327ac0f0cb1e.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of voluntary commitment
c750c68c-c6f5-4ea1-b931-327ac0f0cb1e.content: {Freedom as participation assumes voluntary commitment to community obligations}, {Voluntary commitment to community obligations aligns with the concept of freedom as participation}, {The appearance of limited freedom due to obligations is resolved by recognizing the voluntary nature of participation}

3f2f7083-1709-42a0-b819-d8d89cbeeb77.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {A person is free if they are not subject to oppressive rules}

96de0550-8878-4268-90a8-89cda4483c7d.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {A person is free if they have personal autonomy}

4b09ea3f-d8a9-40a5-acce-13a7e619e269.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {A person is free if they are not dominated by others}

24fa436f-aff4-4625-aae8-a61d9464fb7a.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {A person is free if they have equal influence in decision-making}

39d30faf-c134-4a69-99a0-b0e7d30c5d0f.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {A person is free if they consent to the rules they follow}

c8e99b1e-7a4e-4688-92e1-cbb11a93ccbc.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {A person is free if the community's rules are just}

e93d6309-941e-4a73-af8d-9d2d5bf0b43b.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {A person is free if the decision-making processes are transparent}

58745eec-5461-4ccb-8a55-172c8f960868.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {A person is free if community leaders are accountable}

9d36d5a1-935f-40a7-b127-84a9da5e8c39.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {A person is free if diverse perspectives are included}

e6bf3d98-967d-4bec-a2f2-a465f60ccbfe.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes}, {A person is free if there is reciprocity in community interactions}

7c4b7fd3-00e3-4b4a-891d-3728765c3ced.content: {There is a distinction between mere participation and meaningful influence in community decision-making}, {Communitarian Liberty is a theory about meaningful influence rather than mere participation}, {A person who participates but has no influence is not truly engaging in the relevant sense of community life}, {The intuition that someone is not free despite participation can be explained by the lack of influence in decision-making}

4ce0cd1f-c8af-4b58-8169-49601922f193.summary: Rejecting the intuition that participation under oppressive rules negates freedom
4ce0cd1f-c8af-4b58-8169-49601922f193.content: {It is false that participation under oppressive rules necessarily negates freedom}, {Freedom as participation in community life can exist even if some rules are oppressive, as long as individuals have a say in shaping those rules}, {The appearance of unfreedom can be explained by the failure to recognize the value of participation itself as a form of freedom}

88a4b2da-9007-4425-9bf5-2b4e2035a8a1.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of evolving community norms
88a4b2da-9007-4425-9bf5-2b4e2035a8a1.content: {Community norms and rules are not static and can evolve through participation}, {Freedom as participation in community life includes the potential to change oppressive rules over time}, {The appearance of unfreedom is mitigated by the understanding that participation can lead to progressive change in community norms}

9c0533ff-64b5-4c51-b2ac-b14d8496a9b6.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can choose whether or not to engage in communal decision-making processes}

db5e013f-468e-4504-a2c7-7de0b41a6ee8.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they voluntarily choose to engage in communal decision-making processes}

2ca08b2b-cf8f-4fd0-a1cd-62dc5e32ba35.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes under conditions they find acceptable}

012ba737-23ab-432f-908a-5f815e24ed96.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they can engage in communal decision-making processes or opt out without penalty}

4a138cca-9b4c-47d0-9d95-9ec8a89123e3.content: {Freedom is participation in community life}, {A person is free if they have the choice to engage or not engage in communal decision-making processes}

92d0ab44-34f6-4f3f-9a23-cd6c9775001d.content: {There is a distinction between communal freedom and individual autonomy}, {Communitarian Liberty is a theory about communal freedom rather than individual autonomy}, {Choosing not to participate in community decision-making is an exercise of individual autonomy, not a negation of communal freedom}, {The intuition that non-participation can be a form of freedom reflects a different understanding of freedom, namely individual autonomy}

24cd1586-ba78-4ac8-9178-0a9bc9938bc1.summary: Rejecting the intuition that non-participation equates to freedom
24cd1586-ba78-4ac8-9178-0a9bc9938bc1.content: {It is mistaken to equate non-participation with freedom in the context of Communitarian Liberty}, {Freedom as participation in community life emphasizes the value of collective decision-making}, {Choosing not to participate does not fulfill the criteria of freedom as defined by Communitarian Liberty}

b0ec6be6-87c8-4fbf-984a-827cb9052010.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of voluntary participation
b0ec6be6-87c8-4fbf-984a-827cb9052010.content: {Voluntary participation is a key component of Communitarian Liberty}, {Freedom is achieved when individuals have the genuine option to participate in community life}, {Non-participation is a choice that presupposes the availability of participation, thus maintaining the framework of Communitarian Liberty}

1425558a-6f8b-4ea7-8677-fde398fef434.content: {Freedom is the creation of one's own essence}, {A person is free if they can define their own identity and purpose}, {External influences provide a context within which individuals define their identity and purpose}

c1a22db4-b79e-443b-97db-9ce93a885ef9.content: {Freedom is the creation of one's own essence}, {A person is free if they can define their own identity and purpose}, {Authentic choices are those made with awareness of external influences}

561e51bb-220e-4f3b-9ade-077fb56082ba.content: {Freedom is the creation of one's own essence}, {A person is free if they can define their own identity and purpose}, {A person is free if they reflectively endorse the influences shaping their identity and purpose}

744d49f6-2dbe-43b1-aa58-a6271eaab919.content: {Freedom is the creation of one's own essence}, {A person is free if they can define their own identity and purpose}, {Recognition by others is a necessary condition for defining one's identity and purpose}

01b22b9d-b12d-43f1-a927-a5f90deb7ed6.content: {Freedom is the creation of one's own essence}, {A person is free if they can define their own identity and purpose}, {Autonomy is situated within a network of social and cultural influences}

559747e6-9855-40fa-9bf2-7c210bc2ac75.content: {Freedom is the creation of one's own essence}, {A person is free if they can define their own identity and purpose}, {Identity and purpose are dynamically shaped through interaction with external influences}

de381edb-9269-4c10-b53c-ac9d610b9e32.content: {Freedom is the creation of one's own essence}, {A person is free if they can define their own identity and purpose}, {Constructive engagement with external influences is essential for defining identity and purpose}

f85c0518-0600-478d-a67e-bf2ced27d79b.content: {Freedom is the creation of one's own essence}, {A person is free if they can define their own identity and purpose}, {Freedom is exercised within the context of external influences}

038421d0-5026-432d-83c7-fe050e686d44.content: {Freedom is the creation of one's own essence}, {A person is free if they can define their own identity and purpose}, {An integrated self considers both internal desires and external influences}

d4b8d262-c408-488b-9087-7a20fc5d7285.content: {Freedom is the creation of one's own essence}, {A person is free if they can define their own identity and purpose}, {Identity and purpose are co-created with external influences}

45743c89-ddfa-408d-932f-e969b3d1d069.summary: Distinguishing between internal and external influences
45743c89-ddfa-408d-932f-e969b3d1d069.content: {There is a distinction between internal and external influences on identity formation}, {Existential liberty concerns the internal process of defining one's identity and purpose}, {External influences do not negate the internal freedom to interpret and integrate experiences}, {A person can still exercise existential liberty by choosing how to respond to external influences}

0952ff57-fb3d-4f33-8f74-fc6fb2a89986.summary: Rejecting the intuition that external control negates freedom
0952ff57-fb3d-4f33-8f74-fc6fb2a89986.content: {It is false that external control completely negates the ability to define one's own identity}, {A person can still exercise freedom by critically engaging with and interpreting curated experiences}, {The intuition that controlled environments eliminate freedom is mistaken because it overlooks the individual's capacity for reflection and reinterpretation}

4e543a10-7129-4477-9179-bea0c6dfd02c.summary: Supplementing with the concept of reflective endorsement
4e543a10-7129-4477-9179-bea0c6dfd02c.content: {Reflective endorsement is the process of consciously affirming or rejecting influences on one's identity}, {Existential liberty includes the capacity for reflective endorsement of external influences}, {A person can still define their own identity by reflectively endorsing or rejecting curated experiences}, {The objection loses its force when considering the role of reflective endorsement in identity formation}

3c6f2161-fc05-46d9-921e-8b7fe83c7101.content: {Freedom involves the creation of one's own essence within certain constraints}, {A person is free if they can define their own identity and purpose within the limits of biological and psychological factors}, {Biological and psychological factors significantly influence a person's identity and purpose}

766f62a4-b26a-4694-a478-15f19ae642e6.content: {Freedom is the creation of one's own essence}, {A person is free if they can define their own identity and purpose}, {Economic and social structures are dynamic and can be influenced by individuals}, {A person is free if they can influence and be influenced by economic and social structures in defining their identity}

e33883f0-cc8c-4890-ae0a-3a5270fe326c.summary: Distinguishing between internal and external identity factors
e33883f0-cc8c-4890-ae0a-3a5270fe326c.content: {There is a distinction between internal identity factors, which are self-defined, and external identity factors, which are influenced by economic and social structures}, {Existential liberty concerns the internal identity factors that a person can define for themselves}, {Economic and social structures are external factors that do not negate the ability to define one's internal identity and purpose}, {The objection confuses the influence of external factors with the core concept of existential liberty, which is about internal self-definition}

a9186ecc-56cf-4038-b438-523ff270a51e.summary: Rejecting the necessity of complete autonomy for existential liberty
a9186ecc-56cf-4038-b438-523ff270a51e.content: {It is false that existential liberty requires complete autonomy from economic and social structures}, {Existential liberty is about the capacity to define one's own essence within the constraints of one's environment}, {Economic and social structures provide a context within which individuals exercise their freedom, not a negation of it}, {The intuition that freedom is negated by external constraints is mistaken if freedom is understood as the ability to navigate and define oneself within those constraints}

5f8ea200-276a-4a2a-b02c-daba8eee25d3.summary: Supplementing existential liberty with the concept of adaptive self-definition
5f8ea200-276a-4a2a-b02c-daba8eee25d3.content: {Adaptive self-definition is the ability to redefine one's identity and purpose in response to changing circumstances}, {Existential liberty includes the capacity for adaptive self-definition, allowing individuals to maintain freedom despite economic and social constraints}, {Economic and social structures may influence the context of self-definition but do not eliminate the possibility of existential liberty}, {The objection loses its force when existential liberty is understood as including adaptive self-definition}

3bd459a6-0766-48d4-9da2-471f2db5512a.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they can effectively utilize opportunities to pursue their goals}, {Freedom requires both equal access to opportunities and the capability to utilize them}

b1992b7d-b470-49f2-b227-649736a31c3c.content: {Freedom is the presence of conditions that enable self-realization}, {A person is free if they have the internal and external resources to pursue their goals}, {Freedom requires not only equal access to opportunities but also the means to make use of them}

7c6a6263-988d-464a-90bf-dffb2ee4f0cc.content: {Freedom is the substantive ability to pursue one's goals}, {A person is free if they have the necessary resources and skills to utilize opportunities}, {Freedom requires more than equal access; it requires the capacity to act on opportunities}

5d10042a-4ddb-4ca4-be88-a0d3099609f1.content: {Freedom is empowerment to achieve personal goals}, {A person is free if they are empowered to utilize opportunities effectively}, {Freedom involves both equal access to opportunities and empowerment to use them}

4f8c4ef6-3a68-4d73-9d60-00dcc25c1bc6.content: {Freedom is context-dependent ability to pursue goals}, {A person is free if their specific context allows them to utilize opportunities}, {Freedom requires consideration of individual circumstances in addition to equal access}

f52122ac-7b77-4388-8f9d-16e4219a56fa.summary: Distinguishing between access and effective use of opportunities
f52122ac-7b77-4388-8f9d-16e4219a56fa.content: {There is a distinction between having access to opportunities and being able to effectively use those opportunities}, {Liberal Egalitarian Liberty is a theory about equal access to opportunities, not about the ability to utilize them effectively}, {The intuition that someone with a disability is not equally free can be explained as a confusion between access and effective use of opportunities}

bac13816-119d-4786-9413-4c3eecea3297.summary: Rejecting the intuition that equal access is insufficient for freedom
bac13816-119d-4786-9413-4c3eecea3297.content: {It is false that equal access to opportunities is insufficient for freedom}, {Freedom is defined by the availability of opportunities, not by individual capacities to utilize them}, {The appearance that someone with a disability is less free is due to factors outside the scope of equal access}

f55a42c8-5105-4587-aac2-ded5a6913469.content: {Freedom requires not only equal access to opportunities but also the capability to utilize them}, {A supplementary assumption is that society should provide support to enhance individuals' capabilities}, {With this assumption, equal access combined with capability support ensures freedom}

a48e1310-f9a1-42d9-a3e7-748b634d0dbe.summary: Liberal Egalitarian Liberty with Social Considerations
