a48e1310-f9a1-42d9-a3e7-748b634d0dbe.content: {Freedom is equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the same opportunities as others to pursue their goals}, {Social discrimination impacts a person's freedom}, {Freedom requires both equal opportunities and absence of social discrimination}

83e5e186-c8b8-4e50-9dcc-1685214b68fe.summary: Liberal Egalitarian Liberty with Capability Approach
83e5e186-c8b8-4e50-9dcc-1685214b68fe.content: {Freedom is equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the same opportunities as others to pursue their goals}, {Freedom includes the capability to convert opportunities into achievements}, {A person is free if they can effectively utilize their opportunities}

e53a7f9c-3125-483a-87ee-7bfa56fcaefb.summary: Liberal Egalitarian Liberty with Positive Freedom
e53a7f9c-3125-483a-87ee-7bfa56fcaefb.content: {Freedom is equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the same opportunities as others to pursue their goals}, {Freedom includes the ability to act upon one's free will}, {A person is free if they can act without external constraints}

7b88c250-dcf6-417a-aaed-f3240f9e2cd0.content: {Freedom is equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the same opportunities as others to pursue their goals}, {Freedom requires the absence of domination by others}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference}

fd21b824-3df7-4c12-b803-73161efcd041.summary: Liberal Egalitarian Liberty with Social Justice
fd21b824-3df7-4c12-b803-73161efcd041.content: {Freedom is equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the same opportunities as others to pursue their goals}, {Freedom requires a just social structure}, {A person is free if social institutions ensure fair treatment and equality}

7a736076-e96c-4ce9-b2b3-764be6411442.summary: Distinguishing between opportunities and social conditions
7a736076-e96c-4ce9-b2b3-764be6411442.content: {There is a distinction between formal opportunities and actual social conditions}, {Liberal Egalitarian Liberty is a theory about formal opportunities rather than actual social conditions}, {Social discrimination affects actual social conditions but does not negate the presence of formal opportunities}, {A person can be considered free in terms of formal opportunities even if social discrimination affects their actual ability to pursue those opportunities}

31a84f27-5f6e-4018-8c22-bce6a9774b25.summary: Rejecting the intuition that social discrimination negates freedom
31a84f27-5f6e-4018-8c22-bce6a9774b25.content: {It is false that social discrimination inherently negates freedom as defined by equal access to opportunities}, {Freedom in the context of Liberal Egalitarian Liberty is about the availability of opportunities, not the ease of accessing them}, {The presence of social discrimination does not alter the fact that opportunities are formally available}

3166782d-a7da-4578-9eb6-54e4c13a7aca.summary: Supplementing with a focus on institutional support
3166782d-a7da-4578-9eb6-54e4c13a7aca.content: {Liberal Egalitarian Liberty can be supplemented with the assumption that institutions should provide support to mitigate social discrimination}, {With institutional support, the impact of social discrimination on the ability to pursue opportunities is reduced}, {This supplementary assumption allows the theory to account for social discrimination while maintaining that freedom is about equal access to opportunities}

2ac3b61d-e067-477c-971d-3fa2628c8cfb.summary: Liberal Egalitarian Liberty with Resource Provision
2ac3b61d-e067-477c-971d-3fa2628c8cfb.content: {Freedom is equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the same opportunities as others to pursue their goals}, {Equal opportunity requires provision of necessary skills and resources}

56dec32d-b56d-4186-8b33-18874ee3de55.summary: Liberal Egalitarian Liberty with Skill Development
56dec32d-b56d-4186-8b33-18874ee3de55.content: {Freedom is equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the same opportunities as others to pursue their goals}, {Equal opportunity includes access to skill development}

a17a7d18-fe08-496a-b1e3-09f698ae0ea5.summary: Liberal Egalitarian Liberty with Comprehensive Support
a17a7d18-fe08-496a-b1e3-09f698ae0ea5.content: {Freedom is equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the same opportunities as others to pursue their goals}, {Equal opportunity requires comprehensive support including education and resources}

b362a156-0ac0-45b7-b7c5-efed036f04c0.summary: Liberal Egalitarian Liberty with Contextual Equality
b362a156-0ac0-45b7-b7c5-efed036f04c0.content: {Freedom is equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the same opportunities as others to pursue their goals}, {Equal opportunity must consider individual contexts and needs}

c0360222-0d3d-4d46-8b87-7adae3b955cf.summary: Liberal Egalitarian Liberty with Adaptive Measures
c0360222-0d3d-4d46-8b87-7adae3b955cf.content: {Freedom is equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the same opportunities as others to pursue their goals}, {Equal opportunity requires adaptive measures to address individual deficiencies}

ab3fbc62-c295-43df-a48a-adeddda0dd11.content: {There is a distinction between having equal opportunities and having equal capabilities}, {Liberal Egalitarian Liberty is a theory about equal opportunities, not equal capabilities}, {A person with equal opportunities but lacking skills is still free in the relevant sense of having equal opportunities}, {The intuition that someone is not free due to lack of skills can be explained as a confusion between opportunity and capability}

d08cb569-8750-43b6-95b1-2b262fa66e0d.summary: Rejecting the intuition that skills are part of freedom
d08cb569-8750-43b6-95b1-2b262fa66e0d.content: {It is false that lacking skills undermines freedom as equal access to opportunities}, {Freedom in the context of Liberal Egalitarian Liberty is about the availability of opportunities, not the possession of skills}, {The appearance that someone is not free due to lack of skills is a mistaken intuition about the nature of freedom}

48a405e4-d139-43b9-a594-bbee74d13104.summary: Supplementing with a focus on resource distribution
48a405e4-d139-43b9-a594-bbee74d13104.content: {Equal opportunity can be supplemented with a focus on equitable resource distribution}, {Liberal Egalitarian Liberty can include the assumption that resources necessary to develop skills should be distributed equitably}, {With equitable resource distribution, the objection that equal opportunity is insufficient loses its force}

db839110-a72e-4dac-9ebe-ec47a82af7c1.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they can achieve the functionings they have reason to value}, {Equal opportunity requires addressing personal circumstances that affect the ability to achieve functionings}

02982609-a7d7-4df0-9e4d-7306f2533423.content: {Freedom is access to a fair share of resources}, {A person is free if they have resources to pursue their goals}, {Equal opportunity requires compensating for differences in personal circumstances through resource distribution}

dbdb8b89-228f-4278-8fb8-cc0c1802101a.content: {Freedom is not being disadvantaged by brute luck}, {A person is free if they are not worse off due to circumstances beyond their control}, {Equal opportunity requires correcting for inequalities arising from personal circumstances}

b542ad8f-1de2-4077-a729-88b9f5f883a8.content: {Freedom is the absence of oppressive social relations}, {A person is free if they are not subject to social hierarchies that limit their opportunities}, {Equal opportunity requires addressing social structures that affect personal circumstances}

06ebf808-035b-4768-8a9d-a5429c4fb608.content: {Freedom is having enough opportunities to lead a good life}, {A person is free if they have sufficient opportunities to achieve their goals}, {Equal opportunity requires ensuring everyone has a sufficient level of opportunities, considering personal circumstances}

02326f70-8fac-4d37-9017-72a6f8c9c928.summary: Distinguishing between formal and effective opportunities
02326f70-8fac-4d37-9017-72a6f8c9c928.content: {There is a distinction between formal opportunities and effective opportunities}, {Liberal Egalitarian Liberty is concerned with formal opportunities, which are equal access to resources and rights}, {Personal circumstances like family obligations affect effective opportunities, not formal ones}, {The objection confuses formal equality of opportunity with effective equality of opportunity}

96641041-cb09-4f09-b360-5b73064ca32f.summary: Rejecting the intuition that personal circumstances affect freedom
96641041-cb09-4f09-b360-5b73064ca32f.content: {It is false that personal circumstances like family obligations affect a person's freedom in terms of equal opportunity}, {Freedom as equal opportunity is about access to opportunities, not the ability to take advantage of them}, {The intuition that personal circumstances undermine freedom is mistaken because it conflates opportunity with capability}

a4b0cf28-5b39-4d23-ba43-82c1b568f44d.summary: Supplementing with a principle of personal responsibility
a4b0cf28-5b39-4d23-ba43-82c1b568f44d.content: {A supplementary principle of personal responsibility can be adopted}, {Individuals are responsible for how they manage their personal circumstances in relation to opportunities}, {Equal opportunity provides the framework for freedom, while personal responsibility addresses how individuals navigate their circumstances}, {The objection loses its force when personal responsibility is considered alongside equal opportunity}

de9335e2-4e2b-4d08-8f0c-0908e4b9bad9.content: {Freedom is equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the same opportunities as others to pursue their goals}, {Systemic barriers must be removed to ensure equal opportunities}

d079953d-1ca9-42b6-b8b5-479b4bc4091d.content: {Freedom is effective access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their goals}, {Systemic barriers must be addressed to ensure effective access}

c8a08c7c-f0ed-4ba5-97de-05335db1a853.content: {Freedom is the capability to achieve valuable outcomes}, {A person is free if they have the capability to pursue their goals}, {Systemic barriers must not hinder capabilities}

e07e028c-1460-42cd-ba97-1fb088cc68df.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference}, {Systemic barriers constitute forms of domination}

20dbb6a6-280b-449e-9596-c354c7dc8dfb.content: {Freedom is fair access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have fair opportunities to pursue their goals}, {Systemic barriers must be eliminated to ensure fairness}

ce9d51c4-27af-4212-beec-31702ef26e5d.content: {Freedom is real access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have real opportunities to pursue their goals}, {Systemic barriers must be dismantled to ensure real access}

f9f7431b-cbc1-423f-933d-275a404bb81d.content: {Freedom is equality of outcome}, {A person is free if they achieve similar outcomes as others}, {Systemic barriers must be removed to ensure equal outcomes}

2a3ffebf-1252-430f-af65-bd0f84749abe.content: {Freedom is empowerment to pursue goals}, {A person is free if they are empowered to achieve their goals}, {Systemic barriers must not disempower individuals}

56b3ba27-2f25-44ff-968d-9f3036dc80dd.content: {Freedom is contextual access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have opportunities suited to their context}, {Systemic barriers must be addressed in context}

dad18c03-9305-4d65-abb6-407f5068bc9e.content: {Freedom is the absence of interference}, {A person is free if they are not interfered with in pursuing their goals}, {Systemic barriers are forms of interference}

d7acb698-4d44-471a-8990-163eb61e3e54.summary: Distinguishing between formal and substantive opportunities
d7acb698-4d44-471a-8990-163eb61e3e54.content: {There is a distinction between formal opportunities and substantive opportunities}, {Liberal Egalitarian Liberty is concerned with substantive opportunities rather than merely formal ones}, {Systemic barriers affect substantive opportunities, not formal ones}, {Equal access to opportunities requires addressing systemic barriers to ensure substantive equality}, {The objection confuses formal equality with substantive equality}

755d5170-56b2-430d-8720-e31dc46ed233.summary: Rejecting the intuition that systemic barriers negate equal opportunities
755d5170-56b2-430d-8720-e31dc46ed233.content: {It is false that systemic barriers inherently negate equal opportunities}, {Equal opportunities can exist alongside systemic barriers if individuals have the means to overcome those barriers}, {The presence of systemic barriers does not automatically imply a lack of freedom if individuals can still achieve their goals}, {The intuition that systemic barriers negate freedom is mistaken if individuals can navigate or dismantle those barriers}

2d98822f-a6ae-48c7-a483-34592c3be80b.summary: Supplementing with a commitment to dismantling systemic barriers
2d98822f-a6ae-48c7-a483-34592c3be80b.content: {Liberal Egalitarian Liberty includes a commitment to dismantling systemic barriers}, {Equal access to opportunities involves actively removing systemic barriers that hinder freedom}, {The presence of systemic barriers is addressed by a supplementary commitment to social and political reform}, {Ensuring freedom requires both equal opportunities and the removal of systemic barriers}

be0954aa-c013-488f-a071-65d6b90ad62b.content: {Freedom involves having the capability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they can achieve the functionings they have reason to value}, {Opportunities are necessary but not sufficient for freedom}

53569e46-2032-4b42-bf84-994c931b4fd6.content: {Freedom is the ability to act in accordance with one's true self}, {A person is free if they can pursue their rational desires without external interference}, {Freedom requires the absence of internal constraints such as irrational desires}

7c10d5e8-780d-46b6-9977-182328fc6f61.content: {Freedom is the capacity for autonomous decision-making}, {A person is free if they can make decisions based on their own values and reasoning}, {External and internal constraints that undermine autonomy limit freedom}

21ba5d5b-dc85-4141-a8e7-0feb1bec59dd.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference}, {Freedom requires social and political structures that prevent domination}

f4b12bfa-2f28-4a5f-b7fd-c80fba405e7d.content: {Freedom is constituted by social relationships that enable choice}, {A person is free if their social environment supports their ability to make meaningful choices}, {Freedom involves both opportunities and supportive social contexts}

6b06ae3b-5909-4a70-99fb-52cedd728588.summary: Distinguishing between opportunities and meaningful choice
6b06ae3b-5909-4a70-99fb-52cedd728588.content: {There is a distinction between having opportunities and being able to make meaningful choices}, {Liberal Egalitarian Liberty is a theory about equal access to opportunities, not about the absence of external constraints}, {A person coerced by family expectations still has equal opportunities, even if their choices are influenced by external factors}, {The intuition that someone is not free due to coercion can be explained as a confusion between opportunities and meaningful choice}

59149fb7-35df-4cdf-bec9-a77b16075708.summary: Rejecting the intuition that external constraints negate freedom
59149fb7-35df-4cdf-bec9-a77b16075708.content: {It is false that external constraints like family expectations negate freedom if equal opportunities are present}, {Freedom as equal access to opportunities does not require the absence of all external influences}, {The presence of external constraints does not eliminate the fact that opportunities are equally available}

ab264c69-0161-4f39-b99f-96259874089b.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of personal agency
ab264c69-0161-4f39-b99f-96259874089b.content: {Personal agency is the capacity to make choices and act upon them}, {Liberal Egalitarian Liberty can be supplemented with the assumption that individuals have personal agency}, {With personal agency, individuals can navigate external constraints while still having equal opportunities}, {The appearance of a lack of freedom due to coercion is mitigated by the presence of personal agency}

53705a98-4aee-468b-8419-f3c4a14dd66b.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they can achieve the functionings they have reason to value}, {Equal opportunity requires addressing differences in individual capabilities}

93b01a11-d899-4928-a5ff-d7eace9ccfa0.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference}, {Equal opportunity requires ensuring individuals are not dominated by others}

8202f487-51a8-479e-a4aa-712c1c442766.content: {Freedom is about equal social relations}, {A person is free if they are treated as an equal in social interactions}, {Equal opportunity requires addressing social hierarchies and power imbalances}

7b624a13-3ec2-4db6-8cd5-3fda0445432a.content: {Freedom is the ability to be one's own master}, {A person is free if they can make autonomous choices}, {Equal opportunity requires ensuring individuals have the power to make autonomous decisions}

4b64d2bc-514d-4194-b6dc-f0a595ee474d.content: {Freedom is having effective opportunities to pursue goals}, {A person is free if they have the means to take advantage of opportunities}, {Equal opportunity requires addressing barriers to effective use of opportunities}

fb62730a-607f-462e-9d77-c67f89c07c48.content: {Freedom is having substantive opportunities to succeed}, {A person is free if they have the resources to pursue their goals}, {Equal opportunity requires providing resources to overcome power imbalances}

e0eedc12-51f4-4aa2-b309-560847f962ee.content: {Freedom is the empowerment to act}, {A person is free if they have the power to influence their circumstances}, {Equal opportunity requires empowering individuals to overcome power imbalances}

72e44183-170f-4f57-907e-5f4d173744c5.summary: Freedom as Fair Equality of Opportunity
72e44183-170f-4f57-907e-5f4d173744c5.content: {Freedom is fair access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have fair chances to pursue their goals}, {Equal opportunity requires addressing structural inequalities that affect bargaining power}

3a3df970-57a3-4a92-9e8d-d7e02514b16a.content: {There is a distinction between having equal opportunities and having equal power}, {Liberal Egalitarian Liberty is a theory about equal access to opportunities, not about equal power}, {A person can have equal opportunities without having equal bargaining power}, {The intuition that power imbalances affect freedom can be explained as a confusion between opportunity and power}

9eaee32d-747b-4440-8001-9261ccf51f8f.summary: Rejecting the intuition that power imbalances negate freedom
9eaee32d-747b-4440-8001-9261ccf51f8f.content: {It is mistaken to think that power imbalances necessarily negate freedom}, {Equal access to opportunities is sufficient for freedom under Liberal Egalitarian Liberty}, {Bargaining power differences do not inherently undermine the freedom provided by equal opportunities}

22c4034d-69a5-44cc-8c51-e0f181feab2c.summary: Supplementing with a focus on procedural fairness
22c4034d-69a5-44cc-8c51-e0f181feab2c.content: {Procedural fairness can be an additional requirement to address power imbalances}, {Liberal Egalitarian Liberty can incorporate procedural fairness to ensure negotiations are conducted fairly}, {With procedural fairness, equal opportunities can coexist with power imbalances without undermining freedom}

a6a05452-55d2-4bbf-82ee-28f5c4d88d95.content: {Freedom is equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the same opportunities as others to pursue their goals}, {Historical injustices require additional measures beyond equal opportunities to ensure freedom}, {Compensation for historical injustices is necessary for true equality of opportunity}

2cccad67-6eb0-4150-9db2-90b9410f5165.content: {Freedom is equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the same opportunities as others to pursue their goals}, {The context of historical injustices must be considered when assessing equal opportunities}, {True freedom requires addressing the specific contexts of individuals' historical backgrounds}

dde29808-e44a-49ea-a185-e246a6b543a7.content: {Freedom is equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the same opportunities as others to pursue their goals}, {Rectification of historical injustices is necessary for achieving equal opportunities}, {Freedom requires rectifying past wrongs to ensure genuine equality}

b582e07c-53b3-4030-a528-39670e14e57d.content: {Freedom is equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the same opportunities as others to pursue their goals}, {Compensation for the effects of historical injustices is required for true freedom}, {Equal opportunities must be supplemented with compensatory measures for historical injustices}

a99cc306-9be5-4078-bd8e-b7daaed0df88.content: {Freedom is equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the same opportunities as others to pursue their goals}, {Equal opportunities must be dynamically adjusted to account for historical injustices}, {Freedom requires ongoing adjustments to opportunities in light of historical contexts}

1318d676-43dc-48e6-baf4-200e3d312107.summary: Distinguishing between equal opportunities and equal outcomes
1318d676-43dc-48e6-baf4-200e3d312107.content: {There is a distinction between equal opportunities and equal outcomes.}, {Liberal Egalitarian Liberty is concerned with equal opportunities, not equal outcomes.}, {The intuition that individuals are not equally free due to historical injustices can be explained by a confusion between opportunities and outcomes.}, {Ensuring equal opportunities does not necessarily rectify all past injustices, but it aligns with the principle of providing a fair starting point.}

b04f702b-a168-4366-a552-ac1725de3026.summary: Rejecting the principle that equal opportunities cannot compensate for historical injustices
b04f702b-a168-4366-a552-ac1725de3026.content: {It is false that equal opportunities cannot compensate for historical injustices.}, {Equal opportunities provide a framework for individuals to overcome the effects of past injustices.}, {The principle that historical injustices have lasting effects is not incompatible with the potential for equal opportunities to mitigate these effects.}

8d743079-f11a-45e0-ac04-b5a893ff7ab1.summary: Supplementing with a commitment to address historical injustices
8d743079-f11a-45e0-ac04-b5a893ff7ab1.content: {Liberal Egalitarian Liberty can be supplemented with a commitment to address historical injustices.}, {This supplementary commitment involves implementing policies that specifically target the effects of past injustices.}, {With this commitment, equal opportunities can be seen as part of a broader strategy to ensure freedom in the context of historical injustices.}

503eeecb-c952-4478-a867-504009fd554d.content: {Freedom is equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the same opportunities as others to pursue their goals}, {Economic resources are necessary for equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the economic resources to utilize opportunities}

1edc605e-89d4-4c02-b7dd-129515dc7de7.content: {Freedom is equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the same opportunities as others to pursue their goals}, {Capabilities are necessary for utilizing opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to convert opportunities into achievements}

9d7965d9-d40f-4530-9cd7-04274995fe9d.content: {Freedom is equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the same opportunities as others to pursue their goals}, {Economic equality is necessary for equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have economic equality with others}

b67dadf0-9fc1-4489-9195-b5c166cb2879.content: {Freedom is equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the same opportunities as others to pursue their goals}, {Enhancing opportunities requires addressing economic disparities}, {A person is free if economic disparities are addressed to enhance opportunities}

b30ba275-105b-4cbe-981f-d55e7594691f.content: {Freedom is equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the same opportunities as others to pursue their goals}, {Socioeconomic conditions are necessary for equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have socioeconomic conditions that allow utilization of opportunities}

cb8654cf-d9c0-463d-ae10-ef53454064d6.summary: Distinguishing between formal and effective opportunities
cb8654cf-d9c0-463d-ae10-ef53454064d6.content: {There is a distinction between formal opportunities and effective opportunities}, {Liberal Egalitarian Liberty is a theory about formal opportunities rather than effective opportunities}, {Economic disparities affect effective opportunities but do not negate the existence of formal opportunities}, {A person with equal formal opportunities is considered free even if economic disparities affect their ability to utilize those opportunities}, {The intuition that economic disparities undermine freedom can be explained as confusion between formal and effective opportunities}

e3ed5227-46e0-402c-a884-0ae1c043193a.summary: Rejecting the necessity of economic means for freedom
e3ed5227-46e0-402c-a884-0ae1c043193a.content: {It is false that economic means are necessary for freedom as defined by equal access to opportunities}, {Freedom in the context of Liberal Egalitarian Liberty is about the availability of opportunities, not the ability to utilize them}, {The lack of financial means does not negate the presence of equal opportunities}, {The scenario where one cannot afford tuition does not imply a lack of freedom in terms of opportunity access}

86760b22-ae9d-4a36-997d-707f5a0cc413.summary: Supplementing with a principle of compensatory mechanisms
86760b22-ae9d-4a36-997d-707f5a0cc413.content: {A supplementary principle of compensatory mechanisms can be introduced to address economic disparities}, {Compensatory mechanisms ensure that individuals can utilize opportunities despite economic disparities}, {With compensatory mechanisms, the objection that economic disparities undermine freedom loses its force}, {Liberal Egalitarian Liberty remains intact as it focuses on equal access to opportunities, supplemented by mechanisms to address utilization}

31fe3ed3-3e94-40e9-a83a-8bfaae833454.summary: Liberal Egalitarian Liberty with Motivation Consideration
31fe3ed3-3e94-40e9-a83a-8bfaae833454.content: {Freedom is equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the same opportunities as others to pursue their goals}, {Equal opportunity must consider differences in personal motivation}, {A person is not fully free if they lack motivation despite having equal opportunities}

8c38fb2b-abf3-4233-bd64-9d7c9b538cdf.content: {Freedom is equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the same opportunities as others to pursue their goals}, {Freedom includes the capacity to be motivated}, {Equal opportunity requires support for personal motivation}

9ecf5bf3-dc2f-4127-9b46-5cffcb006470.content: {Freedom is equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the same opportunities as others to pursue their goals}, {Equal opportunity must account for individual motivational differences}, {A person is free if they have both opportunities and motivation to pursue their goals}

a3cf71c3-fca4-4c5e-a92c-abf69226f449.content: {Freedom is equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the same opportunities as others to pursue their goals}, {Equal opportunity includes access to resources that enhance motivation}, {A person is free if they have opportunities and resources to maintain motivation}

74376d38-5538-4a3b-80bc-0e4fe04772d7.content: {Freedom is equal access to opportunities}, {A person is free if they have the same opportunities as others to pursue their goals}, {Equal opportunity includes consideration of motivational factors}, {A person is free if they have opportunities and are supported in their motivational needs}

238bf7a7-399d-4bb7-a768-ced2d5a132ee.content: {There is a distinction between having opportunities and having the motivation to pursue them}, {Liberal Egalitarian Liberty is concerned with equal access to opportunities, not with personal motivation}, {Differences in personal motivation do not affect the equality of opportunity provided}, {A person is considered equally free if they have the same opportunities, regardless of their motivation to act on them}

be488256-d5b3-4807-8f90-a1aa86c985ea.summary: Rejecting the relevance of motivation to freedom
be488256-d5b3-4807-8f90-a1aa86c985ea.content: {It is false that differences in personal motivation affect a person's freedom in the context of equal opportunity}, {Freedom, in this view, is defined solely by the availability of opportunities, not by the individual's motivation to pursue them}, {The intuition that motivation affects freedom is mistaken when considering the definition of freedom as equal access to opportunities}

2d36ec44-8823-4fb3-80b4-1c29ec0b4464.summary: Supplementing with a focus on external conditions
2d36ec44-8823-4fb3-80b4-1c29ec0b4464.content: {Liberal Egalitarian Liberty can be supplemented with the assumption that freedom is primarily about external conditions rather than internal states like motivation}, {Equal opportunity is about ensuring external conditions are the same for everyone}, {Personal motivation is an internal state and does not alter the external conditions of opportunity}

feea3f09-ca01-4cce-b853-052c92d90ae0.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the prevention of significant self-harm}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others or themselves significantly}

37c930d4-07a4-415a-bcbc-16b9c82c8de8.content: {Freedom is limited only by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by paternalistic intervention to prevent self-harm}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others or require paternalistic intervention to prevent self-harm}

3ad380c0-9318-48a1-b2e1-10f80178cf84.content: {Freedom is limited only by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the prevention of self-harm if the individual lacks full autonomy}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others or themselves when lacking full autonomy}

65078859-1c6d-4361-bf62-c709b24afb08.content: {Freedom is limited only by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the prevention of self-harm when autonomy is compromised}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others or themselves when their autonomy is compromised}

725e626e-34d9-4a29-b03e-e9fa417ae5ae.content: {Freedom is limited only by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the prevention of self-harm unless informed consent is given}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others or themselves without informed consent}

530ec2a4-70bf-40dc-a5f3-015e509a405a.content: {Freedom is limited only by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the prevention of self-harm unless the decision is rational}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others or themselves without a rational decision}

f0662f70-72be-4ac1-97eb-0f58af74ea97.content: {Freedom is limited only by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the prevention of self-harm unless the action is voluntary}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others or themselves without voluntary action}

1d070eff-c66d-476c-b177-89698f73c815.content: {Freedom is limited only by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the prevention of self-harm unless the individual is competent}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others or themselves without competence}

27c05a2c-b54b-4746-9767-b78e12bbc357.content: {Freedom is limited only by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by temporary intervention to prevent self-harm}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others or require temporary intervention to prevent self-harm}

aa953c6b-9b57-4c72-9102-857a6706ff6d.content: {Freedom is limited only by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by preventive care to avoid self-harm}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others or require preventive care to avoid self-harm}

7fb91b66-a5ec-4f98-aa4b-291ddd423702.summary: Distinguishing between harm to self and harm to others
7fb91b66-a5ec-4f98-aa4b-291ddd423702.content: {There is a distinction between harm to oneself and harm to others}, {The Harm Principle Liberty is concerned only with harm to others, not self-harm}, {The intuition that society should intervene in cases of self-harm does not conflict with the Harm Principle Liberty, as it is outside its scope}, {The principle that society should protect individuals from self-harm is a separate moral consideration not addressed by the Harm Principle Liberty}

1d86b13e-961c-48c6-b11c-f73fe5204559.summary: Rejecting the intuition that self-harm justifies limiting freedom
1d86b13e-961c-48c6-b11c-f73fe5204559.content: {It is false that society has a responsibility to intervene in all cases of self-harm}, {The intuition that self-harm justifies limiting freedom is mistaken when it conflicts with the Harm Principle Liberty}, {The principle that freedom is limited only by the prevention of harm to others remains intact even if self-harm occurs}, {The responsibility to prevent self-harm is not a necessary condition for limiting freedom under the Harm Principle Liberty}

137ef5c1-231f-4673-95f2-47b240a41225.summary: Supplementing with a principle of informed consent
137ef5c1-231f-4673-95f2-47b240a41225.content: {A supplementary assumption is that individuals have the right to make informed decisions about their own well-being}, {The Harm Principle Liberty can incorporate the idea that individuals should be free to engage in self-harm if they do so with informed consent}, {The principle that society should protect individuals from self-harm can be addressed by ensuring informed consent rather than limiting freedom}, {The appearance of a conflict between self-harm and the Harm Principle Liberty is resolved by emphasizing informed consent}

391487eb-56af-46c3-bfc2-32944b10b5ee.summary: Revised Harm Principle with Indirect Harm Consideration
391487eb-56af-46c3-bfc2-32944b10b5ee.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of both direct and indirect harm to others}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not cause direct or indirect harm to others}

89dcd9f9-d318-4487-8058-5ba4a780251e.summary: Harm Principle with a Threshold for Indirect Harm
89dcd9f9-d318-4487-8058-5ba4a780251e.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of direct harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the prevention of indirect harm to others if it surpasses a significant threshold}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not cause direct harm or significant indirect harm to others}

5ec41140-3bc1-4367-a8d6-fad881bc6c5b.summary: Harm Principle with a Balancing Test for Indirect Harm
5ec41140-3bc1-4367-a8d6-fad881bc6c5b.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of direct harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the prevention of indirect harm to others if a balancing test shows the harm outweighs the benefits of the action}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not cause direct harm or outweighing indirect harm to others}

7e4a914b-5170-4fa8-9338-b3f629d620ea.summary: Harm Principle with a Precautionary Approach to Indirect Harm
7e4a914b-5170-4fa8-9338-b3f629d620ea.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of direct harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the prevention of indirect harm to others if there is a reasonable precautionary basis to believe harm will occur}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not cause direct harm or reasonably preventable indirect harm to others}

86d00380-d9c2-43ad-b197-6c16503fca05.summary: Harm Principle with a Contextual Analysis of Indirect Harm
86d00380-d9c2-43ad-b197-6c16503fca05.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of direct harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the prevention of indirect harm to others based on a contextual analysis of the situation}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not cause direct harm or contextually significant indirect harm to others}

02b2786f-37e6-4d7b-9d66-8cbc1e696b7c.summary: Distinguishing between direct and indirect harm
02b2786f-37e6-4d7b-9d66-8cbc1e696b7c.content: {There is a distinction between direct harm and indirect harm.}, {The Harm Principle is concerned with direct harm rather than indirect harm.}, {Indirect harm does not constitute a violation of the Harm Principle if it does not result in immediate and tangible harm to others.}, {The intuition that indirect harm should limit freedom can be explained as a misunderstanding of the scope of the Harm Principle.}

0ad99a62-7196-403a-a8e8-d38b721dffba.summary: Rejecting the significance of indirect harm
0ad99a62-7196-403a-a8e8-d38b721dffba.content: {It is false that indirect harm is as significant as direct harm in the context of limiting freedom.}, {Indirect harm lacks the immediacy and clear causal connection required to justify limiting freedom under the Harm Principle.}, {The potential for indirect harm does not provide sufficient grounds to restrict individual liberty according to the Harm Principle.}

78317fa6-f2a9-4b91-a795-917ffdbd46eb.summary: Supplementing with a threshold for harm
78317fa6-f2a9-4b91-a795-917ffdbd46eb.content: {A supplementary assumption is that only harm above a certain threshold justifies limiting freedom.}, {Indirect harm often falls below this threshold and thus does not warrant restriction under the Harm Principle.}, {The Harm Principle can accommodate concerns about indirect harm by considering the severity and likelihood of harm.}

877efdb5-4d2c-47d7-a551-cee137fce8e5.summary: Modified Harm Principle with Cumulative Harm Consideration
877efdb5-4d2c-47d7-a551-cee137fce8e5.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the prevention of cumulative harm}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others or contribute to cumulative harm}

54c28466-da85-42d4-8c72-643745f4920c.summary: Harm Principle with Threshold for Cumulative Harm
54c28466-da85-42d4-8c72-643745f4920c.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the prevention of cumulative harm when it exceeds a certain threshold}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others or contribute to cumulative harm that exceeds a threshold}

0fd0b69b-26da-4de8-a66b-bf85c7c69796.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm caused by collective actions}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others or participate in collective actions that cause harm}

b023d0b5-39c0-425d-8bdb-d110fcec3779.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the prevention of environmental harm}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others or the environment}

96ba3004-bd03-47e4-90c7-cdbb89f77f15.summary: Harm Principle with Future Generations Consideration
96ba3004-bd03-47e4-90c7-cdbb89f77f15.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to future generations}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others or future generations}

b999ab54-4d8c-4f1e-a009-7c4d6660e5ac.summary: Distinguishing between direct and cumulative harm
b999ab54-4d8c-4f1e-a009-7c4d6660e5ac.content: {There is a distinction between direct harm and cumulative harm.}, {The Harm Principle is primarily concerned with direct harm rather than cumulative harm.}, {Cumulative harm does not constitute a direct infringement on another's freedom under the Harm Principle.}, {The intuition that cumulative harm should limit freedom can be explained by a misunderstanding of the scope of the Harm Principle.}

3cdf7927-b7aa-4276-92c7-233332c88ca5.summary: Rejecting the necessity of restricting freedom for cumulative harm
3cdf7927-b7aa-4276-92c7-233332c88ca5.content: {It is false that cumulative harm necessarily justifies restricting individual freedom.}, {The Harm Principle focuses on preventing direct harm to others, not on cumulative effects.}, {The responsibility for addressing cumulative harm lies in collective action or policy, not in restricting individual freedom.}

d66887a9-058f-43cb-8eb4-2405af263efd.summary: Supplementing with a collective action framework
d66887a9-058f-43cb-8eb4-2405af263efd.content: {The Harm Principle can be supplemented with a framework for collective action.}, {Collective action problems, like cumulative harm, require solutions beyond individual restrictions.}, {The Harm Principle remains intact by addressing cumulative harm through collective agreements or policies.}

e36cce99-1765-4402-b6b5-fc647cdc6560.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of physical harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the prevention of moral harm to others}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not cause physical or moral harm to others}

db24bc59-751e-4753-9a9d-0935d4405abc.summary: Revised Harm Principle with Moral Consideration
db24bc59-751e-4753-9a9d-0935d4405abc.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Harm includes both physical and moral harm}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not cause physical or moral harm to others}

356ec49a-ef3d-426c-a644-b6f05d8bf050.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Harm is defined as both physical and moral harm}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not cause harm, defined as physical or moral, to others}

ed185a77-8a58-4619-9fa1-07ff8c05fd59.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Harm includes physical, psychological, and moral harm}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not cause physical, psychological, or moral harm to others}

a7b57871-ec0a-46bc-a627-f53a26481f82.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Harm includes physical, emotional, and moral harm}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not cause physical, emotional, or moral harm to others}

f4d8e508-afbf-4348-bbad-edcd69571977.summary: Distinguishing between physical and moral harm
f4d8e508-afbf-4348-bbad-edcd69571977.content: {There is a distinction between physical harm and moral harm}, {The Harm Principle is concerned with preventing physical harm rather than moral harm}, {Moral harm does not constitute a limitation on freedom under the Harm Principle}, {The intuition that moral harm should limit freedom can be explained by conflating moral harm with physical harm}

0e2f5de2-1410-4566-8d01-79f91cf69abd.summary: Rejecting the principle that moral harm justifies limiting freedom
0e2f5de2-1410-4566-8d01-79f91cf69abd.content: {It is false that moral harm justifies limiting freedom}, {The Harm Principle is based on the prevention of physical harm as the sole justification for limiting freedom}, {Moral harm does not provide a sufficient basis for restricting freedom under the Harm Principle}

b0ae459a-e8fd-44d9-beb0-8173a9e03cc6.summary: Supplementing with a distinction between public and private morality
b0ae459a-e8fd-44d9-beb0-8173a9e03cc6.content: {There is a distinction between public morality and private morality}, {The Harm Principle applies to actions that cause harm in the public sphere}, {Moral harm is often a matter of private morality and does not justify public restrictions on freedom}, {The appearance that moral harm should limit freedom can be explained by confusing public and private morality}

3999ba10-6b93-490f-b4ed-fb65c8e94c26.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the need to promote community well-being}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others and do not undermine community well-being}

0df50beb-87c5-494c-a02b-8863e0cf261e.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the balance between individual rights and community interests}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others and respect the balance between individual and community interests}

222209f2-7ce7-4531-9f0d-5458d98c790a.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the necessity to follow public health guidelines}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others and adhere to public health guidelines}

1e6b94df-79ba-414d-b0e6-3cf4fdbc88e4.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the responsibility to contribute to collective well-being}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others and fulfill their responsibility to collective well-being}

5a4405b8-3216-4c58-a4ea-2f2a01af66eb.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the need to maintain social harmony}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others and maintain social harmony}

39af53f2-83a2-47f9-8447-707972a9629a.summary: Distinguishing between direct harm and indirect community impact
39af53f2-83a2-47f9-8447-707972a9629a.content: {There is a distinction between direct harm to individuals and indirect impact on community well-being}, {The Harm Principle is concerned with preventing direct harm to others, not indirect community impacts}, {Actions that do not directly harm others but affect community well-being do not fall under the scope of the Harm Principle}, {The intuition that community well-being should sometimes take precedence can be explained by a concern for indirect impacts rather than direct harm}

75a549c4-8459-444e-813d-1de47ec31f9a.summary: Rejecting the intuition that community well-being always justifies limiting freedom
75a549c4-8459-444e-813d-1de47ec31f9a.content: {It is mistaken to assume that community well-being always justifies limiting individual freedom}, {The Harm Principle maintains that only direct harm to others can justify limiting freedom}, {The principle that community well-being can justify limiting freedom is not necessarily valid within the framework of the Harm Principle}, {The prioritization of individual freedom over community well-being is consistent with the Harm Principle when no direct harm is involved}

a6bf0a2c-43da-442c-8d2b-91f01f9617d4.summary: Supplementing with a principle of collective harm
a6bf0a2c-43da-442c-8d2b-91f01f9617d4.content: {A supplementary principle of collective harm can be introduced to address community well-being}, {Collective harm occurs when individual actions collectively lead to harm, even if no single action directly harms others}, {The Harm Principle can accommodate limitations on freedom when actions collectively result in harm to others}, {This supplementary principle allows for consideration of community well-being without altering the core of the Harm Principle}

398a0131-f8b8-44b8-b5b0-ef3650430ccb.summary: Harm Principle with Future Generations Consideration
398a0131-f8b8-44b8-b5b0-ef3650430ccb.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to future generations}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others or future generations}

373c2dac-da4e-48fd-b59a-0f05d2cbd963.summary: Extended Harm Principle with Environmental Consideration
373c2dac-da4e-48fd-b59a-0f05d2cbd963.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to the environment}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others or the environment}

9c89012d-0a0e-4daa-8262-c8ed62460d3f.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to future generations}, {Justice requires considering the rights of future generations}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others or future generations}

a948b9e1-6ad2-4f84-a565-4752fe491831.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the prevention of unsustainable practices}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others or engage in unsustainable practices}

5e03889b-706b-4c16-aed3-2b4b21ef0e55.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the prevention of potential harm to future generations}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others or pose potential harm to future generations}

a9e7983d-afce-40aa-9007-972cb1d77dd3.summary: Distinguishing between current and future harm
a9e7983d-afce-40aa-9007-972cb1d77dd3.content: {There is a distinction between harm to current individuals and harm to future generations}, {The Harm Principle is primarily concerned with harm to current individuals}, {The principle can be interpreted to include potential future harm as a form of indirect harm to current individuals}, {Activities that pose a risk to future generations can be seen as indirectly harming current individuals by threatening their legacy or future interests}

81d20c99-03c8-4a35-8a34-2ccc10871828.summary: Rejecting the intuition that future harm should limit freedom
81d20c99-03c8-4a35-8a34-2ccc10871828.content: {It is mistaken to assume that potential future harm should limit current freedom in the same way as direct harm to current individuals}, {The Harm Principle is focused on immediate and direct harm, not speculative future harm}, {The intuition that future harm should limit freedom can be addressed by other ethical principles, not the Harm Principle}

1a618e6b-4496-48f0-abee-a37a826b340c.summary: Supplementing with a principle of intergenerational justice
1a618e6b-4496-48f0-abee-a37a826b340c.content: {A supplementary principle of intergenerational justice can be adopted alongside the Harm Principle}, {This principle can address the moral responsibility to future generations without altering the Harm Principle itself}, {The Harm Principle remains focused on current harm, while intergenerational justice addresses future risks}

d2f6f636-fb8d-4ebb-a699-ceed4c8159af.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not cause physical or non-physical harm to others}, {Non-physical harm includes emotional distress and psychological manipulation}

6fa119e2-b18b-45d4-9513-a59423b7696b.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not cause harm to others}, {Harm includes both physical and non-physical harm}

06c9ad88-7fcd-4ecc-b20a-743c345375a2.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not cause harm to others}, {Harm is assessed contextually, considering both physical and non-physical aspects}

abf648ad-3b7a-4967-aa00-fd537faaa0d1.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not cause harm to others}, {Harm is understood as a spectrum including physical, emotional, and psychological harm}

ddd88bf9-1ccb-4356-be87-07ab23715aa3.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not cause harm to others}, {Harm includes any action that significantly impairs another's well-being}

bca00acc-eade-4170-935f-17021bdceaac.summary: Distinguishing between physical and non-physical harm
bca00acc-eade-4170-935f-17021bdceaac.content: {There is a distinction between physical harm and non-physical harm such as emotional distress or psychological manipulation}, {The Harm Principle is primarily concerned with preventing physical harm rather than non-physical harm}, {Non-physical harm does not fall under the same category of harm that the Harm Principle seeks to prevent}, {The intuition that non-physical harm should limit freedom can be explained by conflating different types of harm}

8f50718c-c846-4d6c-b54e-1d1f488f9826.summary: Rejecting the principle that non-physical harm justifies limiting freedom
8f50718c-c846-4d6c-b54e-1d1f488f9826.content: {It is false that non-physical harm should justify limiting freedom in the same way as physical harm}, {The Harm Principle is based on the prevention of direct and tangible harm to others}, {Non-physical harm lacks the directness and tangibility required to justify restrictions under the Harm Principle}

1e0c16aa-badf-4e9a-9f59-b702bc15bd5b.summary: Supplementing with a principle of consent
1e0c16aa-badf-4e9a-9f59-b702bc15bd5b.content: {A supplementary principle of consent can address concerns about non-physical harm}, {If all parties involved in an activity consent to it, then non-physical harm does not justify limiting freedom}, {The appearance of non-physical harm justifying limits on freedom can be mitigated by ensuring informed consent}

9cbc7281-ba61-4902-85b4-e2ae3a2f9e5e.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others}, {Consent affects the justification for limiting freedom}, {A person is free to consent to activities that may harm them}

08c11980-e95e-4831-b632-9a830d552157.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others}, {Consent to self-harm is a valid exercise of freedom}, {Harm to others without consent justifies limiting freedom}

02317aef-baac-4a20-bac4-2deaa407a2ba.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others}, {Consent is a factor in determining permissible harm}, {Harm with consent does not justify limiting freedom}

9d6835f1-c4d1-489c-af0e-aaad953b842a.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others}, {Consent modifies the conditions under which harm justifies limiting freedom}, {Voluntary self-harm with consent is permissible}

de78b179-358a-4596-8e06-2a003d788d46.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others}, {Consent alters the justification for limiting freedom}, {Harm with informed consent is not a basis for limiting freedom}

e95e3087-58bf-480b-a238-9393360cb84d.summary: Distinguishing between harm and consensual risk
e95e3087-58bf-480b-a238-9393360cb84d.content: {There is a distinction between harm and consensual risk}, {The Harm Principle is concerned with preventing non-consensual harm rather than consensual risk}, {Consent transforms potential harm into a risk that is accepted by the individual}, {The intuition that consent should affect the justification for limiting freedom is consistent with the Harm Principle when harm is understood as non-consensual}

aa30b4da-eb3c-4801-863c-afcad7d10953.summary: Rejecting the necessity of consent in harm prevention
aa30b4da-eb3c-4801-863c-afcad7d10953.content: {It is false that consent always affects the justification for limiting freedom}, {The Harm Principle focuses on the prevention of harm to others, regardless of consent}, {Consent does not negate the potential for harm to others, which remains the primary concern of the Harm Principle}, {The principle that freedom is limited only by the prevention of harm to others does not require consideration of consent}

35383dd8-95bf-476d-904c-04f959ded8c4.summary: Incorporating a supplementary assumption about self-regarding actions
35383dd8-95bf-476d-904c-04f959ded8c4.content: {A supplementary assumption is that self-regarding actions, even if harmful, are not the concern of the Harm Principle}, {Consent is relevant in determining whether an action is self-regarding or other-regarding}, {The Harm Principle applies only to actions that harm others without their consent}, {The appearance of a challenge to the Harm Principle is resolved by recognizing the distinction between self-regarding and other-regarding actions}

e28ee021-c0cb-4b86-a3f1-0d1be4cc19b1.summary: Revised Harm Principle with Societal Norms
e28ee021-c0cb-4b86-a3f1-0d1be4cc19b1.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by societal norms that reflect collective moral judgments}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others and adhere to societal norms}

f86b5c74-9efc-45b1-9bc3-379a7acf4c57.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by moral considerations that do not necessarily involve direct harm}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others and respect moral considerations}

bddc3e24-55c1-47d6-bf9c-281ceff0e287.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by considerations of public decency}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others and maintain public decency}

ac71c798-73ee-4d7d-9bfd-7fdccd99dd14.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by community standards that reflect shared values}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others and adhere to community standards}

0784dcac-80d0-4a1a-82ea-1ff261ece539.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by cultural sensitivity and respect for cultural norms}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others and respect cultural norms}

768f0288-90c3-4b37-b52a-a369f9a0a502.content: {There is a distinction between harm and offense, where harm involves a setback to interests and offense involves discomfort or displeasure.}, {The Harm Principle is concerned with preventing harm, not offense.}, {Activities like public nudity may cause offense but do not necessarily cause harm.}, {The intuition that such activities should be restricted can be explained by conflating harm with offense.}

890d1c67-42b1-464b-a823-bea95441d5b3.summary: Rejecting societal norms as a basis for limiting freedom
890d1c67-42b1-464b-a823-bea95441d5b3.content: {It is false that societal norms alone can justify limiting freedom.}, {Societal norms are often subjective and vary across cultures and time periods.}, {The Harm Principle prioritizes objective harm over subjective societal norms.}, {The intuition that societal norms should limit freedom is mistaken if it conflicts with the prevention of harm.}

55a87335-741e-4f11-a74a-ee59fce8e009.summary: Supplementing with a principle of public decency
55a87335-741e-4f11-a74a-ee59fce8e009.content: {A supplementary principle of public decency can coexist with the Harm Principle.}, {Public decency involves maintaining a standard of behavior that respects community values without causing harm.}, {Activities like public nudity can be restricted under public decency without contradicting the Harm Principle.}, {The appearance of permissiveness in the Harm Principle is mitigated by incorporating public decency.}

25e910a1-cfc5-4573-811d-fa93f0c080d0.summary: Revised Harm Principle with Power Dynamics
25e910a1-cfc5-4573-811d-fa93f0c080d0.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the prevention of exploitation of power dynamics}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others or exploit power dynamics}

bbffd0b8-021e-4778-ad59-b33e5577f344.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the prevention of coercion}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others or coerce others}

1c494924-9a03-4053-80c1-3a45b0f0d777.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the need to maintain social justice}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others or violate principles of social justice}

27c2a6b8-b9de-4f24-96cb-c30d609a2086.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the protection of vulnerable individuals}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others or exploit vulnerable individuals}

9d6e19ff-b406-4b94-8fc4-64342b6b1b96.content: {Freedom is limited by the prevention of harm to others}, {Freedom is limited by the requirement of fairness}, {A person is free if they can act as they wish as long as they do not harm others or act unfairly}

f9622f8b-9958-4e2f-b0aa-1f2d0c68c0de.summary: Distinguishing between direct harm and indirect harm
f9622f8b-9958-4e2f-b0aa-1f2d0c68c0de.content: {There is a distinction between direct harm and indirect harm.}, {The Harm Principle is concerned with preventing direct harm to others.}, {Exploitation through power dynamics can be seen as indirect harm rather than direct harm.}, {The Harm Principle does not require addressing indirect harm, thus remaining intact.}

437a4960-72bd-48a4-8611-b3085a1a9482.summary: Rejecting the intuition that power dynamics inherently cause harm
437a4960-72bd-48a4-8611-b3085a1a9482.content: {It is false that power dynamics inherently cause harm.}, {Not all power dynamics result in harm to others.}, {The Harm Principle only restricts freedom when there is actual harm, not potential harm due to power dynamics.}

ca3d73ec-928b-440a-91b1-8d3773de80ef.summary: Supplementing with a principle of voluntary consent
ca3d73ec-928b-440a-91b1-8d3773de80ef.content: {Voluntary consent can mitigate concerns about power dynamics.}, {If an individual consents voluntarily, the power dynamic does not necessarily result in harm.}, {The Harm Principle can incorporate voluntary consent to address concerns about exploitation without altering its core.}

0c68f1c6-e9d1-407a-ad42-96cd79d3abee.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with rational principles}, {A person is free if they act according to principles they autonomously endorse}

aa7ca32a-35d7-4dae-af04-3c17779e1211.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with values one autonomously endorses}, {A person is free if they act according to values they have critically examined and accepted}

35a11c62-d175-4834-aa4a-f5df223d674f.content: {Freedom is acting in a way that expresses one's authentic self}, {A person is free if they act in accordance with their true desires and beliefs}

3fd9febb-cddd-4b42-95cc-cb3cc779b0b5.content: {Freedom is the ability to determine one's own actions}, {A person is free if they can choose their actions without external constraints}

1491f7fd-94d9-4e7a-a0d1-35c8ad92d034.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with one's own rational deliberation}, {A person is free if they act based on their own reasoned decisions}

0b9529d7-a054-4524-9a15-d4953d27b7e4.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with principles one has chosen}, {A person is free if they act according to principles they have personally selected}

929fcbc8-e41c-4691-b795-0be631d88fa1.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with principles one reflectively endorses}, {A person is free if they act according to principles they have critically reflected upon and accepted}

ffbb4bf0-6b28-4bd3-ba47-aeb205079334.content: {Freedom is acting in a way that maintains personal integrity}, {A person is free if they act in accordance with their own coherent set of beliefs and values}

e867f6b0-3567-440f-ab5f-b6910a6f8205.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with one's subjective preferences}, {A person is free if they act according to their own preferences and desires}

a5b22230-02f8-4746-b6b5-ad18cbd25f8b.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with one's own volition}, {A person is free if they act based on their own will and choices}

437bf37c-1510-4228-b365-a312fb7139dc.summary: Distinguishing between moral and non-moral freedom
437bf37c-1510-4228-b365-a312fb7139dc.content: {There is a distinction between moral freedom and non-moral freedom}, {Moral liberty is a theory about freedom in the moral sense, not in the non-moral sense}, {A person can be free in a non-moral sense while violating moral law}, {The intuition that someone is free while violating moral law can be explained as confusion between moral and non-moral freedom}

b8d24f27-dccb-4149-866e-33c81d6f7168.summary: Rejecting the intuition that freedom can exist without moral law
b8d24f27-dccb-4149-866e-33c81d6f7168.content: {It is false that a person is free if they violate moral law}, {Freedom, in the moral sense, inherently involves acting in accordance with moral principles}, {The appearance of freedom in scenarios where moral law is violated is a misunderstanding of moral liberty}

4b455a74-30f3-4298-ba60-165f444c5569.summary: Explaining freedom through the endorsement of moral principles
4b455a74-30f3-4298-ba60-165f444c5569.content: {Freedom involves the autonomous endorsement of moral principles}, {A person is free if they act according to principles they autonomously endorse, even if those principles align with moral law}, {The intuition that freedom can exist without moral law is explained by the focus on autonomy rather than the content of the principles}

a7b9e1c3-68a8-491e-8e24-4ac24ba6e422.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles that align with external constraints}

0e8a0f97-4333-4245-a59e-7b27fcfbf467.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles endorsed by a collective or community}

51b485cd-f22b-4b54-ae5d-c156d75f6d21.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they rationally endorse}

ca9b87d8-2b7f-4de4-bba8-ec478f978b80.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they would endorse under ideal conditions}

c822bc9c-60c6-407c-82a6-5675b9415067.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to objective moral principles}

d8ac68f2-996c-4e60-a00a-885c3fe5b9bd.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles derived from practical reason}

eff89cb8-e7ea-431e-9a6c-9986a4b59bbf.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they have been educated to understand and accept}

2e6066e3-3020-49dd-aa48-9954bbd186e1.summary: Moral Liberty with Role of Tradition
2e6066e3-3020-49dd-aa48-9954bbd186e1.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles rooted in tradition}

9f03574a-5638-4366-88c7-d7a94d25ef27.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles that promote social harmony}

1c9ddf55-2eb0-4922-88d0-3993461a01f9.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles that cultivate virtue}

f19dd9cf-0371-4863-b435-8ad642139b20.content: {There is a distinction between autonomy and freedom}, {Moral liberty is a theory about freedom in the context of moral law, not about autonomy in general}, {A person can be free in the moral sense even if they do not autonomously endorse the principles they follow}, {The intuition that autonomy is necessary for freedom can be explained as a confusion between different senses of freedom}

3e2fde6f-2da6-4d65-a024-97a89ae4f4bb.summary: Rejecting the necessity of autonomy for moral freedom
3e2fde6f-2da6-4d65-a024-97a89ae4f4bb.content: {It is false that autonomy is necessary for moral freedom}, {Moral liberty requires acting in accordance with moral law, not necessarily autonomously endorsing it}, {A person can act freely in the moral sense by following moral principles, regardless of their autonomous endorsement}

17a32049-a421-4724-ae36-4c16a72a1fe7.summary: Supplementing with the concept of moral alignment
17a32049-a421-4724-ae36-4c16a72a1fe7.content: {Moral alignment can occur without full autonomy}, {A person can be aligned with moral principles through education or habituation, not just autonomous endorsement}, {Freedom in the moral sense can be achieved through alignment with moral law, even if autonomy is not fully present}

2f9df631-480f-440e-92fc-b0af31682530.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {A person is free if they act after rational deliberation and understanding of moral principles}

3662ef7c-aa69-47b3-bea6-ce9e3b0c3508.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {A person is free if they act voluntarily, even if the action is immoral}

3fd784c4-5643-44cf-a763-02f404decc57.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {A person is free if they have an understanding of moral principles, regardless of their actions}

0540fc80-75b3-4b89-8c73-491ae49c7600.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {A person is free if their actions are internally coherent with their moral beliefs}

5e4ed034-e362-4545-a821-e0b3daf74d62.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {A person is free if they act with intentionality and awareness of moral implications}

fb1797ea-486b-483f-94a3-475dcdb9589c.summary: Distinguishing between moral and non-moral freedom
fb1797ea-486b-483f-94a3-475dcdb9589c.content: {There is a distinction between moral freedom and non-moral freedom}, {Moral liberty is concerned with freedom in the moral sense, which requires acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person can be non-morally free when acting immorally but lacks moral freedom}, {The intuition that voluntary immoral actions are free can be explained by confusion between moral and non-moral freedom}

2da9c148-2372-4fb8-b528-ae2b263afb31.summary: Rejecting the intuition that voluntary immoral actions are free
2da9c148-2372-4fb8-b528-ae2b263afb31.content: {It is mistaken to think that voluntary actions are necessarily free in the moral sense}, {Moral liberty requires alignment with moral principles, which is absent in immoral actions}, {The appearance of freedom in voluntary immoral actions is an illusion when considering moral liberty}

2e39fe7c-63d5-4f4a-b982-5e0efcb237e1.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of higher-order endorsement
2e39fe7c-63d5-4f4a-b982-5e0efcb237e1.content: {Moral liberty involves not just acting voluntarily but also endorsing one's actions at a higher-order level}, {A person acting immorally may not have higher-order endorsement of their actions}, {The lack of higher-order endorsement explains why immoral actions are not free in the moral sense}

698d41cc-9e84-44b2-987d-7614e5e33e5d.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Moral principles are internally generated by the individual}

17c5c58b-14f7-4807-91eb-6956d967412e.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Moral principles are those that a rational agent would endorse}

ada24112-84b9-4063-8446-4ed36d1dfec6.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Moral principles are those that align with the individual's volitional commitments}

7a00aff4-a5b3-44cd-8aa5-5af163007526.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Moral principles are those that survive reflective scrutiny by the individual}

5f7f87d3-30d9-4f7a-9725-28d52f21b69f.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Moral principles are constructed through a process of rational deliberation}

350c626f-51cc-477d-82bf-8eb5b3d88132.summary: Moral Liberty with Ideal Observer Endorsement
350c626f-51cc-477d-82bf-8eb5b3d88132.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Moral principles are those that an ideal observer would endorse}

c3bf12c3-6e7e-4ec5-bd18-2d5ca8135aa7.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Moral principles are context-dependent and vary with individual circumstances}

a6650595-459b-468a-be73-464699af0db7.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Moral principles are shaped by the individual's historical and cultural context}

61d41550-5bea-4a99-885b-f333467304a7.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Moral principles are pluralistic and allow for multiple valid interpretations}

5b88effa-a67d-4cdd-b91e-d29af1939f63.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Moral principles are developed through dialogue and interaction with others}

f8ab9fba-8378-47f0-baf3-e4458e10e638.summary: Distinguishing between moral and arbitrary constraints
f8ab9fba-8378-47f0-baf3-e4458e10e638.content: {There is a distinction between moral constraints and arbitrary constraints}, {Moral Liberty is concerned with freedom from arbitrary constraints, not moral ones}, {A person acting in accordance with moral law is not less free because moral constraints are self-imposed and autonomously endorsed}, {The intuition that moral law limits freedom arises from conflating moral constraints with external impositions}

f79797bc-761f-4ed1-aa5e-a2e566a0974f.summary: Rejecting the intuition that moral law limits freedom
f79797bc-761f-4ed1-aa5e-a2e566a0974f.content: {It is mistaken to think that moral law inherently limits freedom}, {Freedom is enhanced, not diminished, when one acts according to principles they autonomously endorse}, {The perception of reduced freedom under moral law is a misunderstanding of what it means to act freely}

e5c2c398-2c60-49c0-9738-64335b0e4b3a.summary: Supplementing with the concept of rational autonomy
e5c2c398-2c60-49c0-9738-64335b0e4b3a.content: {Rational autonomy involves acting according to principles one has rationally chosen}, {Moral Liberty includes the assumption that rational autonomy is a form of true freedom}, {The scenario where moral law restricts choices does not diminish freedom if those choices align with rational autonomy}

d7d3412e-c7cd-4af2-a339-574a0e43a404.summary: Moral Liberty with Absence of Coercion
d7d3412e-c7cd-4af2-a339-574a0e43a404.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {A person is free only if they are not coerced into acting against their endorsed moral principles}
