000de488-1d3f-433a-a18b-0d2445fac2df.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {A person is free only if they have both internal and external conditions that allow them to act on their endorsed moral principles}

e85f8e39-403c-4163-93d1-afddc446f52b.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {A person is free only if they have engaged in rational reflection on their moral principles}

1767f6a7-7533-4052-bb7c-5d3261000530.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {A person is free only if their actions are voluntary and not compelled by external forces}

1f62e097-e741-4f42-aa4b-ff1c558000b9.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {A person is free only if their endorsement of moral principles is authentic and not the result of manipulation}

8afd3d5b-b9fd-4f9d-a490-027861ada17e.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {A person is free only if they have comprehensive autonomy, which includes the ability to revise their moral principles}

a786ad1e-c95f-4649-9966-c28be14f36f2.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {A person is free only if their freedom is not contextually restricted by external circumstances}

8c2ebbaa-d5be-4c1d-8173-e4efa2395e17.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {A person is free only if their endorsement of moral principles is informed by adequate understanding and knowledge}

65414aae-639e-4114-86d5-dc7f701e4fc0.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {A person is free only if there is no interference from others in their ability to act on their endorsed moral principles}

1ea758bb-9a1d-4d24-b11c-483f42056474.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {A person is free only if they have the capacity for self-determination in choosing and acting on their moral principles}

d6226643-f8aa-4623-a2f6-245336a62815.summary: Distinguishing between internal and external freedom
d6226643-f8aa-4623-a2f6-245336a62815.content: {There is a distinction between internal freedom and external freedom}, {Moral liberty is a theory about internal freedom, which concerns acting in accordance with one's own moral principles}, {External freedom involves the absence of coercion or external constraints}, {A person can be internally free by endorsing moral principles, even if they are externally constrained}, {The intuition that someone coerced is not free can be explained as confusion between internal and external freedom}

f9bcff52-3f79-4186-8bec-14a8097567b8.summary: Rejecting the intuition that coercion negates moral liberty
f9bcff52-3f79-4186-8bec-14a8097567b8.content: {It is false that coercion necessarily negates moral liberty}, {Moral liberty is concerned with the alignment of actions with autonomously endorsed moral principles}, {A person can maintain moral liberty by internally endorsing moral principles, even if coerced externally}, {The presence of coercion does not affect the internal aspect of moral liberty}

fb141ffd-d328-4f94-bf6b-c71894f3b2f1.summary: Supplementing with a distinction between autonomy and freedom
fb141ffd-d328-4f94-bf6b-c71894f3b2f1.content: {Autonomy refers to the capacity to endorse and act upon one's own principles}, {Freedom involves the ability to act without external constraints}, {Moral liberty is primarily concerned with autonomy rather than freedom}, {A person can be autonomous by endorsing moral principles, even if they lack freedom due to coercion}, {The objection confuses autonomy with freedom}

1ac4228f-f3ac-4aef-95c6-05c95c6876f7.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Moral law can consist of multiple valid principles that can be autonomously endorsed}

736b832e-199a-41cf-bcf8-0fbd651b52a1.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Moral law is subjective and varies between individuals}

510e74c9-74d9-491a-8da3-cc5f4ed8ef8d.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Moral law is constructed through rational deliberation and consensus}

d973592b-9b24-47b0-acec-1ab9b1c97c54.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Moral law is context-dependent and can vary across different situations}

bd346936-ff7b-4104-bbf5-fad3f08c5721.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Moral law is determined through relationships and social interactions}

c8ba35fb-bfad-421c-adcd-b6ace3ffa116.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Moral law is determined by practical outcomes and consequences}

09f17d13-2e61-4bc9-8a06-36bac678f0a3.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Moral law is influenced by cultural norms and traditions}

5dac2416-ff62-4e46-a5ff-388cd6fc30cf.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Moral law evolves over time and is not fixed}

a4eae959-a38a-4dce-b957-8a4d578d31f9.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Moral law is developed through dialogue and exchange of ideas}

434cd64e-e4e8-488f-ad5e-f22b7113d57e.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Moral law is determined by individual reasoning and reflection}

4bb0def2-19ce-431d-88af-852e73f62c00.summary: Distinguishing between subjective and objective moral law
4bb0def2-19ce-431d-88af-852e73f62c00.content: {There is a distinction between subjective moral beliefs and objective moral law}, {Moral liberty is concerned with acting in accordance with objective moral law rather than subjective moral beliefs}, {Two people can disagree on what constitutes moral law, but only actions aligned with objective moral law are truly free}, {The intuition that freedom becomes subjective is a confusion between subjective beliefs and objective moral law}

2092a1b6-149e-4ee6-8f47-1ea847c79fc2.summary: Rejecting the intuition that freedom becomes arbitrary
2092a1b6-149e-4ee6-8f47-1ea847c79fc2.content: {It is mistaken to think that freedom becomes arbitrary if only one person is free in a moral disagreement}, {Freedom is not arbitrary because it is grounded in objective moral principles, not individual beliefs}, {The appearance of arbitrariness arises from misunderstanding the role of objective moral law in determining freedom}

2497faa0-3106-4b62-b3c3-e90e583a0783.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of moral epistemology
2497faa0-3106-4b62-b3c3-e90e583a0783.content: {Moral epistemology is the study of how we come to know moral truths}, {Disagreements about moral law can be resolved through better understanding and knowledge of moral truths}, {Freedom is maintained because it is based on acting in accordance with moral truths, which can be known through moral epistemology}

7c2cec52-3b00-48bd-8946-14911a3c11b9.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {A person can act freely even when they make moral errors}

9d01952e-9a89-4285-8fd7-25fb4c08044a.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Moral principles are those that a person autonomously endorses, even if they are in error}

8d45bdaa-d317-4e67-a919-6057ba3db570.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law as an ideal}, {A person is free if they strive to act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Moral errors do not negate freedom if the person aims to align with moral law}

407dc5b3-6dd3-464a-84b4-4c987bcf5428.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Freedom is conditional on the intention to follow moral law, not on the success of doing so}

5dce952a-f40a-4673-90c6-3693925c73c3.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Freedom involves the intention to align with moral law, allowing for moral errors}

bde2b2fc-e95a-4f6c-9e0a-6b4a0573d57e.summary: Distinguishing between moral law and personal moral principles
bde2b2fc-e95a-4f6c-9e0a-6b4a0573d57e.content: {There is a distinction between objective moral law and personal moral principles}, {Moral liberty is concerned with acting in accordance with personal moral principles rather than an objective moral law}, {A person can act freely even if their personal moral principles are in error with respect to an objective moral law}, {The objection loses force when considering that freedom is about autonomy in endorsing principles, not their objective correctness}

1d718a48-71e5-4c12-bc2f-780f07df7d88.summary: Rejecting the principle that freedom requires moral correctness
1d718a48-71e5-4c12-bc2f-780f07df7d88.content: {It is false that freedom requires acting in accordance with an objectively correct moral law}, {Freedom is about the autonomy of endorsing and acting upon one's own moral principles}, {A person can be free even if their actions are based on moral errors, as long as they autonomously endorse those principles}

ba325dc7-0b89-4a02-8d43-843bd00cb9e5.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of moral fallibility
ba325dc7-0b89-4a02-8d43-843bd00cb9e5.content: {People are morally fallible, meaning they can make mistakes in their moral judgments}, {Moral liberty allows for freedom even when individuals make moral errors, as long as they act according to principles they autonomously endorse}, {The objection loses force when considering that freedom is compatible with moral fallibility}

a6a3e794-bfa4-4691-ad68-bc17ce413894.summary: Moral Liberty with Emphasis on Rational Autonomy
a6a3e794-bfa4-4691-ad68-bc17ce413894.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {A person is free if they act according to principles they rationally endorse}, {Rational endorsement of principles is a form of autonomy}

279927e0-8c71-47a8-b41a-b4bc6d093e34.summary: Moral Liberty with Emphasis on Higher-Order Desires
279927e0-8c71-47a8-b41a-b4bc6d093e34.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {A person is free if they act according to their higher-order desires}, {Higher-order desires are desires about which desires to have}

ffe092ba-a53c-4b3e-8492-1aa79b96f2b6.summary: Moral Liberty with Emphasis on Reflective Endorsement
ffe092ba-a53c-4b3e-8492-1aa79b96f2b6.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {A person is free if they act according to principles they reflectively endorse}, {Reflective endorsement involves critical evaluation of one's principles}

5f95408d-4a74-4b08-b7d2-779f511e0ff6.summary: Moral Liberty with Emphasis on Authenticity
5f95408d-4a74-4b08-b7d2-779f511e0ff6.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {A person is free if they act authentically}, {Authenticity involves acting in alignment with one's true self}

a26014e4-cef9-4ac3-be5f-a8cf10416aac.summary: Moral Liberty with Emphasis on Self-Determination
a26014e4-cef9-4ac3-be5f-a8cf10416aac.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {A person is free if they determine their own actions}, {Self-determination involves making choices based on one's own values}

cd4615d8-785a-42dd-a7cf-622202cddeaa.summary: Distinguishing between moral and personal freedom
cd4615d8-785a-42dd-a7cf-622202cddeaa.content: {There is a distinction between moral freedom and personal freedom}, {Moral liberty is concerned with freedom in the sense of acting in accordance with moral law}, {Personal freedom is about acting according to one's desires, which may not align with moral principles}, {The intuition that personal freedom is undermined can be explained by the confusion between moral and personal freedom}

b49f3eef-0c18-42ed-8562-a40c4ee274c6.summary: Rejecting the intuition that moral law conflicts with freedom
b49f3eef-0c18-42ed-8562-a40c4ee274c6.content: {It is mistaken to think that adherence to moral law inherently conflicts with personal freedom}, {True freedom involves acting in accordance with principles that one autonomously endorses, even if they conflict with immediate desires}, {The intuition that freedom is undermined by moral law is based on a misunderstanding of what constitutes genuine freedom}

2b559902-902f-43a7-a102-f5c9112b5dcf.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of higher-order desires
2b559902-902f-43a7-a102-f5c9112b5dcf.content: {A person can have higher-order desires, which are desires about their own desires}, {Moral liberty involves aligning one's actions with higher-order desires that reflect moral principles}, {The conflict between moral law and personal desires can be resolved by prioritizing higher-order desires over immediate desires}, {With this assumption, adherence to moral law does not undermine personal freedom}

33b03469-336d-46a9-873c-abb3dde9fa0d.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to objective moral principles that are universally valid}

d676ee4e-2279-4212-911b-e75061cff06a.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles that are derived from rational deliberation}

dec8092d-1b82-4d26-a8a5-7113ea06f231.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles that are endorsed by a community of rational agents}

04388fa6-aab8-4928-bbbb-5b09b3ea820b.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles that lead to the best overall consequences}

cad28a98-cc59-4fd8-8d4c-fdbd8332d1e1.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles that cultivate virtues}

965a8ccc-3a2e-4535-9679-270fbd16acc7.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles that can be universally applied}

955e048b-cc08-4e61-aa80-4be389a9cb61.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles that harmonize with the well-being of others}

b1f74e7f-94bd-4a71-a23d-561d689abe33.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles that consider the perspectives and needs of others}

ea71d6be-dd51-42a2-978f-eb9e48a7ff1f.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles that are informed by cultural traditions and practices}

698df506-9419-45ce-9992-cb4ce310e48d.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles that are developed through dialogue with others}

2601788d-6873-47ad-90da-08424534e881.summary: Distinguishing between subjective and objective moral principles
2601788d-6873-47ad-90da-08424534e881.content: {There is a distinction between subjective endorsement of moral principles and objective moral principles}, {Moral liberty is concerned with acting in accordance with objective moral principles rather than merely subjective endorsement}, {A person's belief in their freedom is not sufficient if their principles are objectively harmful}, {The intuition that freedom is questionable in harmful scenarios is explained by the failure to align with objective moral principles}

a3c20bcc-34ae-480c-b1e3-223404da4d98.summary: Rejecting the intuition that subjective endorsement alone defines freedom
a3c20bcc-34ae-480c-b1e3-223404da4d98.content: {It is false that subjective endorsement of moral principles alone defines freedom}, {Freedom requires that the endorsed moral principles are not harmful to others}, {The appearance of freedom being questionable arises from the harm caused by the principles, not from the subjective endorsement itself}

2f601960-bc2a-4942-b1ed-e685f24df275.summary: Supplementing with a requirement for universalizability
2f601960-bc2a-4942-b1ed-e685f24df275.content: {Moral liberty includes a supplementary requirement that moral principles must be universalizable}, {A person is free only if their moral principles can be universally applied without contradiction}, {The intuition that freedom is questionable in harmful scenarios is addressed by the lack of universalizability of the harmful principles}

a039d82d-7072-442d-882a-5b41bc526203.summary: Moral Liberty with Internal Moral Sense
a039d82d-7072-442d-882a-5b41bc526203.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {A person has an internal moral sense that guides their actions even without explicit moral knowledge}

cbf20b58-a455-4e44-bf21-1485e11fafb0.summary: Moral Liberty with Implicit Moral Understanding
cbf20b58-a455-4e44-bf21-1485e11fafb0.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {A person can have an implicit understanding of moral principles without explicit knowledge}

7c3d278e-3cd3-4143-bb28-8e9f735af09c.summary: Moral Liberty with Innate Moral Intuition
7c3d278e-3cd3-4143-bb28-8e9f735af09c.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Moral intuition is innate and guides actions without the need for explicit moral knowledge}

84c47b0d-2aa8-427d-8a04-2633bd04e0b5.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Practical reason allows individuals to act freely by discerning moral principles without explicit knowledge}

d9fbda4d-326f-49e1-b3b7-45e559acc2c0.summary: Moral Liberty with Contextual Moral Awareness
d9fbda4d-326f-49e1-b3b7-45e559acc2c0.content: {Freedom is acting in accordance with moral law}, {A person is free if they act according to moral principles they autonomously endorse}, {Contextual awareness provides sufficient moral guidance for freedom without explicit moral knowledge}

b85d027a-d0a6-4c08-9b4d-fd585cbc8b5c.summary: Distinguishing between moral action and moral knowledge
b85d027a-d0a6-4c08-9b4d-fd585cbc8b5c.content: {There is a distinction between acting in accordance with moral law and having explicit knowledge of moral principles}, {Moral liberty is concerned with the alignment of actions with moral law, not necessarily with the explicit knowledge of those laws}, {A person can act freely by following moral principles they autonomously endorse, even if they lack explicit moral knowledge}, {The intuition that freedom requires moral knowledge can be explained by conflating moral action with moral knowledge}

3c8b54e3-163c-4515-9944-d3d4c6e3e8dd.summary: Rejecting the necessity of explicit moral knowledge for freedom
3c8b54e3-163c-4515-9944-d3d4c6e3e8dd.content: {It is false that explicit moral knowledge is necessary for freedom}, {A person can act in accordance with moral principles through intuition or implicit understanding}, {Freedom is determined by the alignment of actions with autonomously endorsed moral principles, not by the possession of explicit moral knowledge}, {The appearance that moral knowledge is necessary for freedom can be explained by the mistaken belief that explicit knowledge is required for moral action}

8956a310-303a-4438-93d7-b2de4a27492a.summary: Supplementing with the concept of implicit moral understanding
8956a310-303a-4438-93d7-b2de4a27492a.content: {Implicit moral understanding can guide actions in accordance with moral law}, {A person can be free if they act according to moral principles they implicitly understand and autonomously endorse}, {The objection loses its force when considering that moral liberty does not require explicit moral knowledge but can be based on implicit understanding}, {The intuition that freedom is limited by epistemic conditions can be addressed by recognizing the role of implicit moral understanding}

d4f1cadc-7864-4329-98a7-28fea93644a7.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their authentic desires}, {Authentic desires are those that are not the result of external manipulation}

0f3507a2-629c-477b-b2ba-51291e78bc31.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their higher-order desires}, {Higher-order desires are desires about which first-order desires to act upon}

94a65bfe-1891-40be-b667-d21c7c92f05b.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they can respond to reasons}, {Responding to reasons involves the ability to recognize and act upon rational considerations}

1d08e3f0-d5a0-4c95-9d55-fe03a69007be.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their values}, {Values are deeply held principles that guide a person's decisions}

72e1eecd-2b5c-47ff-8862-e353db5c4f91.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they reflectively endorse their desires}, {Reflective endorsement involves a critical evaluation and acceptance of one's desires}

3ba51b9b-766c-4aad-bf51-16a1f463c514.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their desires have a history of non-coercive development}, {Non-coercive development means desires are formed without undue external pressure}

55845896-6989-4f2f-857d-0429fec6e809.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they have the capacity for self-determination}, {Self-determination involves the ability to form intentions based on one's own deliberations}

a3b9bf0e-30bc-4594-8221-1d504db628a4.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they can be held morally responsible for their actions}, {Moral responsibility requires that actions are the result of one's own deliberative processes}

b74338fe-6f7a-4c89-85e1-612c5bc3fe7f.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they have rational control over their actions}, {Rational control involves the ability to act according to reasoned judgment}

a919dc76-e564-4003-b068-61a1cfda6b8f.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they act as an agent with intentionality}, {Intentionality involves acting with purpose and understanding of one's actions}

09cfa277-056b-4d06-bfba-0d5453158e05.summary: Distinguishing between determined desires and manipulated desires
09cfa277-056b-4d06-bfba-0d5453158e05.content: {There is a distinction between desires that are determined by natural causes and desires that are manipulated by external agents}, {Freedom as deterministic liberty is a theory about naturally determined desires rather than manipulated desires}, {A person whose desires are manipulated by external agents is not free in the relevant sense of naturally determined desires}, {The intuition that someone with manipulated desires is not free can be explained as confusion between naturally determined desires and manipulated desires}

0f610c7a-b5f6-4684-966c-70f7cea402ac.summary: Rejecting the principle that freedom requires the ability to have done otherwise
0f610c7a-b5f6-4684-966c-70f7cea402ac.content: {It is false that freedom requires the ability to have done otherwise}, {Freedom is about acting in accordance with one's desires, not about the ability to choose differently}, {The appearance that freedom requires alternative possibilities can be explained by the value we place on choice, not by the nature of freedom itself}

0d29470b-6bf9-461b-be96-caf972f30f56.content: {Freedom involves the ability to reflectively endorse one's desires, even if those desires are determined}, {A person is free if they can reflect on and endorse their desires as their own}, {The appearance that determined desires undermine freedom is explained by the lack of reflective endorsement, not by determinism itself}

9b4744bf-30bc-4c5c-a491-b95dcbf6c5c9.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires, even if those desires are determined}, {Moral responsibility is compatible with determinism}, {A person is morally responsible if they act according to their desires and understand the moral implications of their actions}

1d985ec7-df83-4319-ae13-8830a1e5524d.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their higher-order desires, even if those desires are determined}, {Moral responsibility is compatible with determinism}, {A person is morally responsible if their actions align with their higher-order desires and they understand the moral implications of their actions}

43416ba3-431d-4dad-bdd3-51f0862830a1.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions are responsive to reasons, even if those reasons are determined}, {Moral responsibility is compatible with determinism}, {A person is morally responsible if they act in a way that is responsive to moral reasons}

fdf1bbf6-f789-4c51-9f28-f26e29ee74b5.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they are the source of their actions, even if those actions are determined}, {Moral responsibility is compatible with determinism}, {A person is morally responsible if they are the source of their actions and understand the moral implications}

5aa40031-2fbd-46d0-a90e-12dc8e6bdae5.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions result from an integrated set of desires and beliefs, even if those are determined}, {Moral responsibility is compatible with determinism}, {A person is morally responsible if their actions result from an integrated set of desires and beliefs and they understand the moral implications}

e17eab54-6d6f-490b-828a-7c9625b52dd5.summary: Distinguishing between causal determination and moral responsibility
e17eab54-6d6f-490b-828a-7c9625b52dd5.content: {There is a distinction between causal determination and moral responsibility}, {Moral responsibility is concerned with the alignment of actions and desires, not the causal history of those desires}, {A person can be morally responsible if their actions reflect their desires, even if those desires are determined}, {The intuition that determinism undermines moral responsibility arises from conflating causal determination with moral evaluation}

ca0a39ef-1053-45f4-88e1-33a7e01b49c3.summary: Rejecting the intuition that determinism negates control
ca0a39ef-1053-45f4-88e1-33a7e01b49c3.content: {It is mistaken to think that determinism negates all forms of control}, {Control can be understood as the ability to act according to one's desires, regardless of their determined nature}, {Moral responsibility is based on the capacity to act in accordance with one's desires, not on the indeterminacy of those desires}, {The intuition that determinism negates control is based on a misunderstanding of what control entails}

b9c851c9-de9a-4155-8d5c-cba37817d710.summary: Supplementing with a compatibilist notion of responsibility
b9c851c9-de9a-4155-8d5c-cba37817d710.content: {Compatibilism holds that determinism and moral responsibility are compatible}, {Moral responsibility can be understood in terms of responsiveness to reasons, which is compatible with determinism}, {A person is morally responsible if they can respond to reasons, even if their desires are determined}, {The objection loses its force when moral responsibility is seen as reason-responsiveness rather than indeterminacy}

a4db6d00-4c8f-42ad-ad09-24e066669d4c.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they can act according to their own reasons and motivations}, {A person is free if they can reflect on and endorse their desires}

0cb92fd1-bcf1-4732-a385-75ef53442c9f.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they act in accordance with their higher-order desires}, {Higher-order desires are desires about which first-order desires to act upon}

48bccc0b-5aed-43fd-b35d-0248c07859a8.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they are responsive to reasons}, {A person is free if they can recognize and react to rational considerations}

658c5f2a-63cd-4981-b4b6-5e1497f784d1.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they are the source of their actions}, {A person is free if their actions originate from their own character and values}

b99114c8-589b-4967-8e96-02f3047307a9.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they can reflectively endorse their desires}, {Reflective endorsement involves critically evaluating and accepting one's desires}

6a26f61e-323d-4fb8-a988-4120a9982cd6.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they can be an agent-cause of their actions}, {Agent-causation involves the agent initiating actions independently of deterministic processes}

183ab0f5-0cfe-485d-90e8-ff9c8d0d17ed.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they can realize their values through their actions}, {Realizing values involves acting in ways that fulfill one's deeply held principles}

cc1a49ee-431d-4217-baaf-34d6595f7efe.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they can be held morally responsible for their actions}, {Moral responsibility requires that actions are attributable to the person's character}

517df949-2986-4b4d-9a7d-4ebc4b2e1462.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they have volitional control over their actions}, {Volitional control involves the ability to form intentions and act on them}

5e5f776b-723b-4816-8f39-779e30575974.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they can act according to practical rationality}, {Practical rationality involves making decisions based on coherent and consistent reasoning}

4ad97b65-638d-4003-85cd-e02da4fbe651.summary: Distinguishing between freedom and the feeling of freedom
4ad97b65-638d-4003-85cd-e02da4fbe651.content: {There is a distinction between actual freedom and the feeling of freedom}, {Deterministic Liberty is a theory about actual freedom, not the subjective feeling of freedom}, {A person can be genuinely free if their actions align with their desires, even if those desires are determined}, {The intuition that freedom is illusory under determinism can be explained as a confusion between actual freedom and the feeling of freedom}

66be4fa2-d31d-4119-981c-10006ca5a3b5.summary: Rejecting the intuition that determinism negates freedom
66be4fa2-d31d-4119-981c-10006ca5a3b5.content: {It is false that determinism negates genuine freedom}, {Freedom is defined as the alignment of actions with desires, regardless of whether those desires are determined}, {The feeling of freedom being illusory does not undermine the actual freedom defined by Deterministic Liberty}

d9bf71a5-553f-4774-98cd-b38d4c92dc3c.summary: Explaining freedom through the alignment of desires and actions
d9bf71a5-553f-4774-98cd-b38d4c92dc3c.content: {Freedom is about the alignment of actions with desires, not the absence of determination}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires, even if those desires are determined}, {The appearance of illusory freedom under determinism is explained by misunderstanding the nature of freedom as alignment rather than indeterminacy}

9b04558f-14c5-4329-9c26-53b8de465062.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires}, {Desires are autonomous if they are formed through a reflective process internal to the person}

3e80808d-3c45-4210-971a-a177f0b885c1.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires}, {Desires are autonomous if they are endorsed upon reflection by the person}

81c4098d-0611-4862-9213-55c5038a4faa.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires}, {Desires are autonomous if they align with higher-order desires of the person}

80bea041-2229-4463-81ed-84af7b6722be.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires}, {Desires are autonomous if they are authentic to the person's character}

4063ea94-b6df-4628-b386-a03f89c49215.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires}, {Desires are autonomous if they are governed by the person's rational deliberation}

e58aa4dd-e229-4b6e-96ee-848d4e22df8c.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires}, {Desires are autonomous if they have a history of being formed without manipulation}

98b78401-b45f-4428-8b05-5eb4c8e310f3.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires}, {Desires are autonomous if the person identifies with them as their own}

f2795a3e-683c-4c37-9a12-f84093328471.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires}, {Desires are autonomous if the person can be held morally responsible for them}

3d4d954d-322d-4a05-9080-b4151c6c76c1.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires}, {Desires are autonomous if they are integrated into the person's overall agency}

8085baa3-8d28-4aa5-93ab-80881f1842a0.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires}, {Desires are autonomous if they are consistent with the person's values}

b19c0797-d683-4b27-a684-85de76ae82db.summary: Distinguishing between internal and external determination
b19c0797-d683-4b27-a684-85de76ae82db.content: {There is a distinction between internal determination and external coercion}, {Freedom in the context of deterministic liberty refers to internal determination, where desires arise naturally from one's character and experiences}, {External coercion, such as brainwashing, is not compatible with freedom because it involves manipulation by external forces}, {The intuition that determined desires are not autonomous can be explained by confusing internal determination with external coercion}

b630d7b3-6dab-495a-b474-a2dc29224398.summary: Rejecting the necessity of independence for autonomy
b630d7b3-6dab-495a-b474-a2dc29224398.content: {It is false that autonomy requires the ability to form desires independently of all external influences}, {Autonomy can be understood as the alignment of desires with one's deeper values and character, even if those are shaped by external factors}, {The appearance of a lack of autonomy in determined desires can be explained by a misunderstanding of autonomy as requiring complete independence}

6fcee4f5-1092-4059-ab58-19ddb7e20c44.summary: Supplementing with the concept of reflective endorsement
6fcee4f5-1092-4059-ab58-19ddb7e20c44.content: {Reflective endorsement involves a person reflecting on and endorsing their desires as their own}, {A person can be free if they reflectively endorse their desires, even if those desires are determined}, {The intuition that determined desires are not autonomous can be addressed by recognizing the role of reflective endorsement in autonomy}

1556e215-ccde-4b24-8436-314b2a9e4a7d.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires}, {Moral growth is possible if a person's desires evolve over time through reflection and new experiences}

fb00ff1a-7033-4052-806d-b959a95b46b5.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires}, {Desires can be influenced by reflective self-assessment, allowing for moral growth}

5d3a0b6a-a02d-4c91-b825-e4957d1bff7f.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires}, {Desires are dynamic and can change in response to new information and experiences, enabling moral development}

93fce2d5-928d-422a-8721-761fd5959faf.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires}, {Desires can evolve through rational deliberation, allowing for moral growth}

20fcf837-9733-4048-9eeb-d75dc2608b2a.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires}, {Moral growth is possible through self-improvement, as desires can be shaped by conscious efforts and reflection}

cf283159-426b-4b57-9c1c-340940afa887.summary: Distinguishing between fixed desires and evolving desires
cf283159-426b-4b57-9c1c-340940afa887.content: {There is a distinction between fixed desires and evolving desires}, {Deterministic Liberty concerns actions aligning with current desires, not the immutability of desires over time}, {A person can have desires that evolve in response to new experiences, even if those experiences are determined}, {Moral growth is possible as desires can change in a determined yet evolving manner}

20535e8d-9f1e-43c6-8b98-b221085c62f4.summary: Rejecting the intuition that determinism negates moral growth
20535e8d-9f1e-43c6-8b98-b221085c62f4.content: {It is mistaken to think that determinism negates the possibility of moral growth}, {Moral growth can occur through the alignment of actions with evolving desires, even if those desires are determined}, {The intuition that fixed desires prevent moral growth overlooks the potential for desires to change within a deterministic framework}

504695c8-bda7-4421-827f-a9cf1daa62b2.summary: Supplementing with the concept of reflective endorsement
504695c8-bda7-4421-827f-a9cf1daa62b2.content: {Reflective endorsement involves a person critically evaluating and endorsing their desires}, {A person can reflectively endorse new desires that lead to moral growth, even if those desires are determined}, {Deterministic Liberty allows for moral growth through the process of reflective endorsement of evolving desires}

53feddbd-4866-4dfe-bb1c-22dd47ff5f53.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires}, {A person is free if their desires are formed through a process of rational reflection}

9d08c6fb-52d8-4bd0-b158-4a95b7eb3207.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires}, {A person is free if their desires align with their higher-order desires}

9772a760-fe36-45bb-8cc8-1ca8bcbf8506.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires}, {A person is free if they are responsive to reasons in forming their desires}

a9066bcd-8c62-4161-90da-1dc060b0315d.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires}, {A person is free if their desires are authentic and not the result of external manipulation}

cdcde756-e5de-4cd8-9901-8eabd4c665c4.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires}, {A person is free if they reflectively endorse their desires}

b7c18a50-05cd-46de-8f02-3e52bc2e9f41.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires}, {A person is free if their desires have a history that is free from manipulation}

0826c289-32fe-47f1-ab02-4041b8d1470f.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires}, {A person is free if their desires are consistent with their core values}

0aa4aed2-fd92-434e-bb51-8fb2ab96e026.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires}, {A person is free if they govern themselves according to their own principles}

ff9df433-c2ff-4acd-a419-41bfcd565cfe.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires}, {A person is free if they have rational control over the formation of their desires}

14ffa415-62a9-424e-a6b2-35017c96d695.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires}, {A person is free if their desires are not the result of coercion}

900a7f7b-9f66-4020-927d-5c9c2090ce86.summary: Distinguishing between internal and external manipulation
900a7f7b-9f66-4020-927d-5c9c2090ce86.content: {There is a distinction between internal and external manipulation of desires}, {Deterministic Liberty is concerned with internal alignment of actions and desires, not external manipulation}, {A person whose desires are manipulated externally is not free in the relevant internal sense}, {The intuition that manipulated desires undermine freedom can be explained by confusion between internal and external manipulation}

1f08eb63-d856-45f7-856e-0378227bffd7.summary: Rejecting the intuition that manipulated desires undermine freedom
1f08eb63-d856-45f7-856e-0378227bffd7.content: {It is false that manipulation of desires necessarily undermines freedom}, {Freedom is defined by the alignment of actions with desires, regardless of how those desires are formed}, {The appearance of a lack of freedom in manipulated scenarios can be explained by external moral judgments, not by a lack of freedom itself}

94d49b29-eb07-4ce8-bb19-c40b89f42a3b.summary: Supplementing with a condition of authenticity
94d49b29-eb07-4ce8-bb19-c40b89f42a3b.content: {Freedom requires that desires be authentic, meaning they are genuinely one's own}, {Authenticity can be understood as desires formed through a process of critical reflection}, {With the supplementary condition of authenticity, manipulated desires do not align with true freedom}

de3531e1-7360-4e29-b690-aef10aef2f61.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they act according to their own reasons and motivations, even if those reasons are determined}, {Personal agency is preserved when actions are the result of internal deliberation}

c663181b-a4af-480c-ad84-ba4555726741.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their higher-order desires align with their actions, even if those desires are determined}, {Personal agency is maintained when a person's actions reflect their reflective endorsement of those actions}

dd797165-a6fa-4e21-aaf9-4192b1832ee2.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they are responsive to reasons in their decision-making process, even if those reasons are determined}, {Personal agency is preserved when a person can recognize and react to rational considerations}

7b19d6e4-36c1-4181-92ee-0e1232a2da7d.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they are the source of their actions, even if those actions are determined}, {Personal agency is maintained when actions originate from the individual's own character and values}

45b521c5-f9dc-4bf7-847a-8dcaf9ad9fb8.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions are governed by their deep self, even if that self is determined}, {Personal agency is preserved when actions are consistent with the individual's core identity and values}

cf3e4f26-33e8-43c2-96a9-271275d5a7a0.summary: Distinguishing between different senses of agency
cf3e4f26-33e8-43c2-96a9-271275d5a7a0.content: {There is a distinction between causal agency and moral agency}, {Deterministic Liberty is concerned with causal agency, where actions align with desires regardless of determinism}, {The intuition that determinism undermines agency can be explained by confusing causal agency with moral agency}

1fd768c5-2cce-49b5-8699-4f6d6abbb90e.summary: Rejecting the intuition that determinism negates agency
1fd768c5-2cce-49b5-8699-4f6d6abbb90e.content: {It is mistaken to believe that determinism negates personal agency}, {Agency is about the alignment of actions with desires, not the absence of determination}, {The appearance of lacking agency under determinism is due to a misunderstanding of what agency entails}

98ba9af2-e2bc-4a5b-9f73-58368f71d7b8.summary: Supplementing with a compatibilist understanding of agency
98ba9af2-e2bc-4a5b-9f73-58368f71d7b8.content: {Compatibilism holds that free will and determinism are not mutually exclusive}, {A person can have genuine agency if their actions align with their desires, even if those desires are determined}, {The intuition that determinism conflicts with agency is addressed by adopting a compatibilist framework}

0c97f6d7-6334-4e55-9509-273515f6c363.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires and values, even if those desires and values are determined}, {Determinism does not require predictability of specific actions}

1f305c17-3549-4c68-885a-7cc237c81a9a.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires, even if those desires are determined}, {Unpredictability of behavior does not negate determinism}

ba3739f4-0ead-4d00-a960-e4d6e2dd183d.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their deeply held values, even if those values are determined}, {Determinism allows for unpredictability in behavior}

a09bd9ef-da99-4028-9edf-7a8c8e8713aa.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their rational deliberations, even if those deliberations are determined}, {Determinism does not imply predictability of specific outcomes}

ee6d45aa-0b83-4e9b-9697-29b922a9be52.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions are determined by their own internal states, such as desires and beliefs}, {Determinism is consistent with unpredictability in behavior}

6f913401-c6e3-4079-97af-e73ae9ca6dd3.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions are coherent with their internal psychological states, even if those states are determined}, {Determinism does not necessitate predictability of actions}

d5b4c014-de7a-4b51-b5bf-fac8a1e50b54.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions are determined by a holistic integration of desires, values, and beliefs}, {Determinism allows for unpredictability in specific behaviors}

3e8d0824-2fb9-4281-b9a2-e5179168b2e7.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with both their desires and values, even if those are determined}, {Determinism does not require predictability of behavior}

442d31e6-7f50-4153-b35d-281f221cc475.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions result from reflective endorsement of their desires, even if those desires are determined}, {Determinism is consistent with unpredictability}

1396863c-e6aa-4407-af2d-1b1e206980f9.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions are determined by their own self-conception and desires}, {Determinism does not imply predictability of specific actions}

e5a747df-1d4d-4b01-bcc5-f1fb11cbd8bf.content: {There is a distinction between determinism and predictability}, {Determinism refers to the idea that events are determined by prior causes, not that they are predictable}, {Unpredictability of human behavior does not imply a lack of determinism}, {The intuition that unpredictability suggests a lack of determinism is based on a misunderstanding of what determinism entails}

f58679b6-57fd-4574-b378-082a95ff501e.summary: Rejecting the principle that determinism implies predictability
f58679b6-57fd-4574-b378-082a95ff501e.content: {It is false that determinism necessarily implies predictability}, {Complex systems, like human behavior, can be determined yet remain unpredictable due to their complexity}, {The unpredictability of human behavior does not conflict with determinism}

3fe1943d-d0cc-460c-b552-781f46de5c10.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of epistemic limitations
3fe1943d-d0cc-460c-b552-781f46de5c10.content: {Human unpredictability can be explained by epistemic limitations, meaning limits to what we can know or predict}, {Determinism is a metaphysical claim about the nature of reality, not about our ability to predict outcomes}, {The unpredictability of human behavior is consistent with determinism when considering epistemic limitations}

07ee0ebc-c2fc-4bf8-8912-95e8f56f9125.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they act according to their own reasons and motivations}, {A person is free if they are not coerced or manipulated by external forces}

ea46edb4-5537-4602-a21b-783b14d5919d.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their higher-order desires align with their first-order desires}, {A person is free if they can reflect on and endorse their desires}

4296a2c4-e045-4254-8bbd-d716d40a1c5d.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they can respond to reasons}, {A person is free if they can recognize and act upon rational considerations}

78489423-4da3-4141-b2fa-f4be95fcebff.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is morally responsible if they can be held accountable for their actions}, {A person is morally responsible if they can understand and respond to moral reasons}

ae2974d0-4ea0-45b8-9423-ae7446ead6b5.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they would have acted differently had they chosen to do so}, {A person is free if their actions align with their hypothetical choices}

c1532547-09a7-447b-b11f-8e4197abac2b.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they can reflectively endorse their desires}, {A person is free if they can critically evaluate and accept their motivations}

f8235221-28b8-4154-9c16-ae2c255bf33c.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they have control over their volitions}, {A person is free if they can guide their actions according to their will}

392607d8-22d4-4200-84ab-4a3e6d29c945.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they can determine their own actions}, {A person is free if their actions are self-directed and not externally imposed}

97eaa73a-7188-4988-950f-08491f1f82b7.content: {There is a distinction between genuine choice and perceived choice}, {Deterministic Liberty is concerned with perceived choice, where actions align with desires}, {A person can have perceived choice even if their desires are determined}, {The intuition that determinism negates choice can be explained as a confusion between genuine choice and perceived choice}

6573aca7-4f11-473f-9671-c50ecb0a2af0.summary: Rejecting the intuition that determinism negates choice
6573aca7-4f11-473f-9671-c50ecb0a2af0.content: {It is false that determinism negates the concept of choice}, {Choice can be understood as the alignment of actions with desires, regardless of determinism}, {The appearance of negated choice under determinism is due to a misunderstanding of what constitutes choice}

c12d9414-966f-4404-95d1-cf44e40573d8.summary: Explaining choice through a supplementary understanding of desires
c12d9414-966f-4404-95d1-cf44e40573d8.content: {Desires can be understood as part of the causal chain in determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their determined desires}, {The concept of choice is preserved by understanding desires as integral to the deterministic process}

c029bf64-c735-4606-bb38-fd35734eca27.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their desires}, {A person is free if they could have acted otherwise in a hypothetical scenario where their desires were different}

f615bf2f-b68a-4ddc-ae3d-652ab29faa93.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their higher-order desires}, {Higher-order desires are desires about which first-order desires one wants to act upon}

138124f2-4953-4544-b94d-a9acb83e081a.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions are responsive to reasons}, {A person is free if they can recognize and react to rational considerations}

0ff444ff-6c06-4dfe-8076-8a13d921055f.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they are the source of their actions}, {A person is free if their actions originate from their own character and values}

985505ee-f808-4cde-9f1a-c625ec5e19a4.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they act according to their desires without external coercion}, {A person is free even if they could not have done otherwise, as long as they act on their own volition}

1e38529d-800d-434a-9ad9-74863312f314.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if their actions align with their values}, {A person is free if they act in accordance with what they consider important or worthwhile}

96f05df0-64e9-4647-b1e4-88af0956b2a5.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is morally responsible if they act according to their desires}, {Moral responsibility does not require the ability to have acted otherwise}

bae10875-2c8e-4f74-8d89-bb41cfdf7cee.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they act autonomously}, {Autonomy involves acting in accordance with one's own principles and self-governance}

724ad711-d1e2-4718-b283-a757abf0127f.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they are an agent-cause of their actions}, {Agent-causation involves the person being the originator of their actions}

d8aa4c50-3a18-45c8-b043-0b85bfd4c712.summary: Distinguishing between freedom and alternative possibilities
d8aa4c50-3a18-45c8-b043-0b85bfd4c712.content: {There is a distinction between freedom and the ability to have acted otherwise}, {Deterministic Liberty is a theory about freedom as acting in accordance with one's desires, not about alternative possibilities}, {The intuition that freedom requires alternative possibilities can be explained as a confusion between different senses of freedom}

442f06ab-fab0-4e01-b43a-69aedcb145d3.summary: Rejecting the necessity of alternative possibilities for freedom
442f06ab-fab0-4e01-b43a-69aedcb145d3.content: {It is false that freedom requires the ability to have acted otherwise}, {Freedom is about acting in alignment with one's desires, regardless of whether those desires are determined}, {The concept of freedom remains coherent under determinism if it is understood as acting according to one's determined desires}

98a61c9c-5209-4ce3-80e6-60204332b78d.summary: Supplementing with a compatibilist understanding of freedom
98a61c9c-5209-4ce3-80e6-60204332b78d.content: {Compatibilism is the view that freedom and determinism are compatible}, {Under compatibilism, freedom is defined as acting according to one's desires, even if those desires are determined}, {The objection loses its force when freedom is understood in a compatibilist sense, which does not require alternative possibilities}

efe739e3-4490-4371-ace8-d621bb7e6cb3.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to one's own will}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own goals without internal or external constraints}, {Freedom includes the capacity for self-mastery and self-realization}

b36e997d-7dfc-48e9-9639-f399a3cec072.content: {Freedom is the capacity for autonomous decision-making}, {A person is free if they can make choices based on their own values and reasoning}, {Freedom requires the absence of both external interference and internal constraints}

bcd1820a-7433-4147-8c97-abbc23a0351c.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue what they have reason to value}, {Freedom involves both the absence of interference and the presence of enabling conditions}

058283bf-8b84-407d-86a2-6df3c223c3cd.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self}, {A person is free if they can develop and express their authentic self}, {Freedom requires overcoming both external and internal barriers to self-expression}

04d837f8-aa11-4357-b523-f5b5f10076f3.content: {Freedom is the empowerment to make meaningful choices}, {A person is free if they have the resources and opportunities to pursue their goals}, {Freedom involves removing both external and internal obstacles to empowerment}

100cccd7-f741-4714-bdcb-28b948c1b13b.content: {Freedom is a holistic state of well-being}, {A person is free if they experience well-being in all aspects of life}, {Freedom requires addressing both external and internal factors that affect well-being}

57ccd15d-f731-4d8d-acf6-9168ca6b4ae8.content: {Freedom is the absence of both internal and external constraints}, {A person is free if they are not hindered by internal compulsions or external interference}, {Freedom involves the capacity to act in accordance with one's true desires}

bc295005-ef8e-4ece-af7e-e574d9850122.content: {Freedom is a comprehensive state of autonomy and capability}, {A person is free if they can act autonomously and have the capabilities to pursue their goals}, {Freedom requires addressing both internal and external limitations}

55a63721-7c32-4f56-b40c-0d55ea9554fc.content: {Freedom is an integrated state of personal and social conditions}, {A person is free if they have the personal and social conditions to pursue their aspirations}, {Freedom involves the removal of both internal and external barriers}

88678799-f69b-4517-a7dd-7a35f05fdf9b.content: {Freedom is the authenticity of one's actions and choices}, {A person is free if they can act in ways that are true to themselves}, {Freedom requires overcoming both external pressures and internal conflicts}

224c31f4-dbda-401a-8db7-6ccfe17d26cd.summary: Distinguishing between external and internal constraints
224c31f4-dbda-401a-8db7-6ccfe17d26cd.content: {There is a distinction between external and internal constraints on freedom}, {Non-interference liberty is concerned with external constraints, not internal ones}, {Internal constraints like addictions do not count as interference by others}, {Freedom as non-interference does not address internal psychological states}

7bd40bba-1f15-40fd-97a5-13eac37c2c26.summary: Rejecting the necessity of internal freedom for overall freedom
7bd40bba-1f15-40fd-97a5-13eac37c2c26.content: {It is false that freedom must include the absence of internal constraints}, {Freedom as non-interference is sufficient for a person to be considered free}, {The presence of internal constraints does not negate the absence of external interference}, {A person can be free in the relevant sense even with internal constraints}

b1ebd0a1-eae6-4396-91a0-c0a220a4407e.summary: Supplementing with a focus on external conditions
b1ebd0a1-eae6-4396-91a0-c0a220a4407e.content: {Freedom as non-interference focuses on the external conditions necessary for freedom}, {Internal constraints are separate from the conditions of non-interference}, {The theory assumes that addressing external interference is the primary concern for freedom}, {Internal constraints are a different issue not covered by non-interference liberty}

cffb0205-6f49-4ec9-b01e-e66987c5024c.content: {Freedom is the ability to pursue one's own goals}, {A person is free if they have the capacity to act on their own will}, {Freedom involves having meaningful and valuable options available}

94e858de-53de-477b-9f03-01e073e45129.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve well-being}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they value}, {Freedom involves having access to opportunities that are meaningful and valuable}

743c8de7-5d0b-43f8-902e-54bcc6e71991.content: {Freedom is the capacity for self-determination}, {A person is free if they can make choices based on their own values and reasons}, {Freedom involves having the ability to reflect on and choose among meaningful options}

9ff3402d-76ee-4d24-8867-ded4c1dadde9.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary power}, {Freedom involves having protection against interference and the assurance of meaningful choices}

df24bc00-1a48-4d73-b843-8a1ec3535dfd.content: {Freedom is the presence of valuable opportunities}, {A person is free if they have access to options that enhance their well-being}, {Freedom involves having choices that are both meaningful and valuable}

d46f88c2-7440-4933-bbd6-031c918f02ae.content: {There is a distinction between having choices and having meaningful choices}, {Non-interference liberty is concerned with the availability of choices, not their meaningfulness}, {The objection confuses the concept of freedom with the concept of value or meaningfulness of choices}, {A person is free if they have choices without interference, regardless of the perceived value of those choices}

5b51678c-6edc-40ed-9fed-b0c66f9867f8.summary: Rejecting the necessity of meaningful choices for freedom
5b51678c-6edc-40ed-9fed-b0c66f9867f8.content: {It is false that freedom requires the availability of meaningful or valuable options}, {Freedom as non-interference is solely about the absence of constraints on choices}, {The value or meaningfulness of choices is a separate issue from the concept of freedom}, {A person can be free even if their available choices are not considered meaningful or valuable}

59de9422-d073-4638-845c-fd1cff837994.summary: Supplementing with a value-neutral account of freedom
59de9422-d073-4638-845c-fd1cff837994.content: {Freedom can be understood in a value-neutral way, focusing on the absence of interference}, {The meaningfulness or value of choices is not a necessary component of freedom}, {A supplementary assumption is that freedom is a formal condition, not a substantive one}, {This formal condition is satisfied when there is no interference, regardless of the value of the options}

c150cdb9-9e59-4a0f-bc1d-cdd5d101bb08.content: {Freedom is the ability to act in accordance with one's true self}, {A person is free if they can pursue their rational interests}, {Freedom involves self-mastery and self-realization}

2e6cb3d8-e74b-424b-852b-971340e7d9a7.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to the arbitrary will of another}, {Freedom requires protection from potential interference}

61cdca9a-8380-4bfa-90a2-c60e3cda934e.content: {Freedom is the capacity for autonomous decision-making}, {A person is free if they can make choices based on their own values and reasoning}, {Freedom involves the ability to reflect on and endorse one's desires}

8d59f89e-15e2-4a3a-8271-adb4435f1284.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Freedom involves having the real opportunities to accomplish what one values}

af924c17-2d86-4e41-818f-49fa34415957.content: {Freedom is constituted by social relationships}, {A person is free if they are embedded in supportive and non-oppressive social networks}, {Freedom involves the quality of one's social interactions and connections}

136fb070-3442-4f1a-be56-f0ce9f15d509.content: {Freedom is the capacity for personal growth and development}, {A person is free if they can develop their talents and abilities}, {Freedom involves opportunities for self-improvement and learning}

1aedf106-06de-4487-a318-f36f09892b20.content: {Freedom is the alignment of individual actions with the common good}, {A person is free if their actions contribute to societal harmony}, {Freedom involves balancing personal interests with communal well-being}

2ed248f9-01f7-4093-9b0b-a63a7739b497.content: {There is a distinction between interference and manipulation}, {Freedom as non-interference is concerned with the absence of direct interference, not manipulation}, {Manipulation does not constitute interference if it does not involve direct constraints on actions}, {The intuition that manipulation undermines freedom can be explained by conflating interference with manipulation}

cafbeee3-a7d3-424d-a751-a8c21626bb18.summary: Rejecting the intuition that manipulation undermines freedom
cafbeee3-a7d3-424d-a751-a8c21626bb18.content: {It is mistaken to think that manipulation without interference undermines freedom}, {Freedom is defined by the absence of direct interference, not by the presence of manipulation}, {The concept of freedom as non-interference does not account for psychological manipulation as a constraint}

10ba1f37-5c3d-4fd4-b6f1-1d1e6dde82a6.summary: Supplementing with a distinction between external and internal constraints
10ba1f37-5c3d-4fd4-b6f1-1d1e6dde82a6.content: {Freedom as non-interference is about external constraints, not internal ones}, {Psychological manipulation is an internal constraint and does not affect external freedom}, {The objection loses its force when recognizing that manipulation affects internal states, not external freedom}

3600b103-23f5-4a64-b496-8b7ac985db8d.content: {Freedom is the ability to pursue one's own goals}, {A person is free if they have the capacity to act according to their own will}, {Freedom includes the presence of opportunities and resources to fulfill one's potential}

28b0b4e5-dbbd-4799-a1e5-cde135b4effe.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary power}, {Freedom requires a system of laws that prevent domination by others}

c6402580-c776-4092-999b-263a02f10dc1.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in social and political life}, {A person is free if they can engage in collective decision-making}, {Freedom involves having a voice in the institutions that govern one's life}

72107ea6-babb-42bf-97da-492669a15840.content: {Freedom is the capacity for self-determination}, {A person is free if they can make their own choices}, {Freedom requires the ability to reflect on and revise one's preferences}

92c3f78b-b782-48db-a155-66df350c8f9d.content: {Freedom is context-dependent and varies across situations}, {A person is free if they can navigate different social contexts effectively}, {Freedom involves understanding and adapting to the norms and expectations of various environments}

7f6fe183-a2b2-46ff-bcf2-58b523206b52.content: {Freedom is constructed through social practices}, {A person is free if they can engage in practices that shape their identity}, {Freedom involves participating in the creation and transformation of social norms}

a952f3c2-1539-411f-9e38-9b8d2bf6c7fb.content: {There is a distinction between interference and obligation}, {Freedom as non-interference is concerned with external constraints, not internal or social obligations}, {Social obligations do not constitute interference if they are voluntarily accepted}, {A person can be free while fulfilling social obligations if those obligations do not involve coercion or force}

eb0e51fe-974a-4188-9ec4-3b88b9acb7e1.summary: Rejecting the claim that obligations limit freedom
eb0e51fe-974a-4188-9ec4-3b88b9acb7e1.content: {It is false that social obligations inherently limit freedom}, {Obligations can be seen as self-imposed or chosen, rather than externally imposed}, {The presence of obligations does not equate to interference if they align with personal values or goals}

ac5ce26f-b010-48f6-9f9f-ea55b8df4ed4.summary: Supplementing with the concept of voluntary commitments
ac5ce26f-b010-48f6-9f9f-ea55b8df4ed4.content: {Voluntary commitments are a form of self-imposed obligation that do not interfere with freedom}, {Freedom can coexist with social obligations if those obligations are entered into voluntarily}, {The balance between liberty and responsibility is maintained when obligations are chosen rather than imposed}

992e8595-8f3b-4a96-b794-e9401ab21194.content: {Freedom is the ability to act on one's true desires}, {A person is free if they have the capacity to pursue their own goals}, {Freedom involves self-mastery and self-realization}

6e703370-fc7f-410f-a064-1a53e1b88065.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary power}, {Freedom requires institutional checks on power}

8a16d819-f8bf-409b-a3b2-d0b50248e0e7.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Freedom involves enhancing individual capabilities}

ab149e7a-ef31-46f2-b596-efeafa17c52c.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in social decision-making}, {A person is free if they have a voice in the structures that affect their lives}, {Freedom requires democratic participation}

003b1b76-bac4-47e6-8edd-2ef1e8367d12.content: {Freedom is determined by the context of choices}, {A person is free if their choices are not constrained by social structures}, {Freedom requires understanding the social context of action}

01012590-b7cc-4a52-811a-cf29a7710182.content: {Freedom is the absence of coercive influence}, {A person is free if they are not subject to coercive power}, {Freedom involves protecting individuals from coercion}

a6e402f3-6275-42ae-aaba-bca1d978a43d.summary: Distinguishing between interference and power dynamics
a6e402f3-6275-42ae-aaba-bca1d978a43d.content: {There is a distinction between interference and power dynamics}, {Non-interference liberty is concerned with the absence of direct interference, not power imbalances}, {Power imbalances do not constitute interference if they do not involve direct constraints on actions}, {The objection confuses the concept of freedom with broader social justice concerns}

cd71c2bf-40d2-4847-afda-a98754893835.summary: Rejecting the necessity of addressing power dynamics in freedom
cd71c2bf-40d2-4847-afda-a98754893835.content: {It is false that freedom must address power dynamics to be valid}, {Freedom as non-interference is a specific concept that does not require addressing all social inequalities}, {The presence of power imbalances does not negate the absence of interference}, {Freedom can be understood as a separate issue from power dynamics}

9447b9b9-b69e-411f-ae75-b3fb8537f4ec.summary: Supplementing with a focus on legal and institutional frameworks
9447b9b9-b69e-411f-ae75-b3fb8537f4ec.content: {Legal and institutional frameworks can mitigate power imbalances without altering the concept of non-interference liberty}, {Non-interference liberty can coexist with efforts to address power imbalances through laws and policies}, {The objection loses force when considering that freedom can be protected by institutions that do not interfere directly}, {The focus on non-interference does not preclude addressing power dynamics through other means}

4fa0a650-7c12-423d-9fed-531d5819fc0a.content: {Freedom is the ability to act upon one's true desires}, {A person is free if they can pursue self-realization}, {Freedom includes access to necessary information for informed decision-making}

9a044c1d-bc6b-46f3-889c-c8a5ee2a0167.content: {Freedom is the ability to make informed choices}, {A person is free if they have access to relevant information}, {Freedom includes the absence of interference and the presence of necessary information}

aa7a8f03-775c-43cb-83d5-013234212bd6.content: {There is a distinction between interference and lack of information}, {Non-interference liberty is concerned with the absence of external constraints, not informational access}, {A person can be free in the sense of non-interference even if they lack information}, {The objection confuses the concept of freedom with the concept of informed decision-making}

e86ab780-7ccf-4b27-a4ad-196ffc6a8d1b.content: {It is false that freedom requires access to all relevant information}, {Freedom as non-interference is about the absence of constraints, not the presence of information}, {A person can be free even if they are unaware of certain options}, {The intuition that freedom requires information is mistaken}

4813bda1-e366-4d53-8a7d-7eb3aa69b222.content: {Freedom and autonomy are distinct concepts}, {Freedom as non-interference does not entail autonomy, which involves informed decision-making}, {A person can be free in the sense of non-interference without being autonomous}, {The objection conflates freedom with autonomy}

50dfe82f-dbb5-4c38-8eb7-13ee3098066a.content: {Freedom involves empowerment to make choices}, {A person is free if they have the power to influence their circumstances}, {Autonomy requires the ability to enact one's decisions}

1d0c3ec6-6bc2-49e3-98ae-a1ab9f0c6eb2.content: {Freedom is context-dependent}, {A person is free if their specific social and personal context supports autonomy}, {Autonomy requires an understanding of individual circumstances}

22d4f4a2-da06-4510-85de-a8674fa3558d.content: {There are different types of freedom, such as non-interference freedom and freedom from coercion}, {Non-interference liberty specifically addresses freedom from direct interference}, {Freedom from coercion is a separate issue that does not affect non-interference liberty}

1ebc52ce-6268-4ac1-be64-31df4c636cbd.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capabilities to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Freedom involves having the real opportunities to achieve one's goals}

ab1f6832-786c-4dd8-a3a8-4ac4154952e3.content: {Negative liberty is defined as freedom from interference}, {Positive liberty involves the capacity to act upon one's free will and pursue goals}, {Non-interference liberty is a theory about negative liberty, not positive liberty}, {The objection mistakenly applies criteria of positive liberty to a theory of negative liberty}

90abc173-0abb-49c7-9cdc-e17547a8cd94.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve self-mastery}, {A person is free if they can control their own desires and impulses}, {Freedom involves the capacity to realize one's true self}

ff75d570-88bc-4753-ae48-9d4ea3e7eb73.content: {Freedom is the capacity for autonomous decision-making}, {A person is free if they can make choices based on their own values and reasons}, {Freedom involves the ability to act according to one's own will}

1a80861f-d147-41ae-8744-de13699b4bfe.content: {Freedom is the process of personal development}, {A person is free if they can grow and evolve over time}, {Freedom involves the capacity for continuous self-improvement}

71efbaa5-c170-4996-ac54-f2b8e93cee31.content: {Freedom is the state of flourishing}, {A person is free if they can lead a fulfilling and meaningful life}, {Freedom involves achieving well-being and happiness}

ef8caec8-b3e1-43d3-8f88-fd398ace3eac.summary: Distinguishing between negative and positive liberty
ef8caec8-b3e1-43d3-8f88-fd398ace3eac.content: {There is a distinction between negative liberty and positive liberty}, {Non-interference liberty is a theory about negative liberty, which is the absence of interference}, {Positive liberty, which involves the capacity to achieve one's potential, is a separate concept from negative liberty}, {The objection confuses the concept of negative liberty with positive liberty}

fb67a4e1-c70a-49f0-ad85-afdb6814cf1e.content: {There is a distinction between external interference and internal constraints such as fear}, {Non-interference liberty is concerned with external interference, not internal states like fear}, {A person is free in the sense of non-interference if others do not actively prevent their actions, regardless of their internal fears}, {The presence of fear does not constitute interference in the relevant sense for non-interference liberty}

acd78de9-58bc-4c9d-ada6-6e985033f16a.summary: Rejecting the necessity of fearlessness for freedom
acd78de9-58bc-4c9d-ada6-6e985033f16a.content: {It is false that freedom requires the absence of fear}, {Freedom as non-interference is defined solely by the absence of external constraints}, {Fear is an internal state and does not impact the external conditions of freedom}, {The intuition that fear limits freedom is mistaken when considering non-interference liberty}

553a3dc7-83b1-4851-b7ba-9b1bbbda6885.summary: Supplementing with a focus on external conditions
553a3dc7-83b1-4851-b7ba-9b1bbbda6885.content: {Freedom as non-interference focuses on external conditions, not internal states}, {A supplementary assumption is that fear is a separate issue from interference}, {Addressing fear requires different social or psychological interventions, not changes to the concept of non-interference liberty}, {The objection loses force when recognizing that fear and interference are distinct issues}

a76c3fde-033f-4309-9846-53e871c9764c.content: {Freedom includes the capacity for self-mastery}, {A person is free if they have the ability to pursue their own goals}, {Freedom involves not just the absence of interference but also the presence of enabling conditions}
