7f62e307-8624-4586-9c06-44053709451a.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capability to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Freedom requires both the absence of interference and the presence of opportunities for personal development}

8f0e048a-1355-4e7c-94d2-93aca50b467a.content: {Freedom is the capacity for autonomous decision-making}, {A person is free if they can make choices based on their own values and reasoning}, {Freedom involves both non-interference and the development of personal autonomy}

b85cfff7-1005-492f-9626-f008abca6690.content: {Freedom includes the potential for personal growth}, {A person is free if they have opportunities for self-improvement}, {Freedom requires conditions that support personal development alongside non-interference}

36e36048-2a53-46d6-a864-f5de96f0ef35.content: {Freedom is the empowerment to act on one's own behalf}, {A person is free if they have the resources and skills to pursue their goals}, {Freedom involves both the absence of interference and the empowerment to achieve personal aims}

bb117659-5166-49b6-a5dd-c0ad0983e7ae.content: {Freedom is defined in the context of social relationships}, {A person is free if they can engage in meaningful social interactions without coercion}, {Freedom involves both non-interference and the capacity for fulfilling social relationships}

3091582d-e4c3-4c7e-9b84-36157c0c49fb.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true potential}, {A person is free if they can develop their talents and abilities}, {Freedom involves both the absence of interference and the pursuit of self-realization}

eb4a4024-ccf5-419a-b39c-09768223006f.content: {Freedom is having substantive opportunities to choose}, {A person is free if they have real options to pursue different life paths}, {Freedom requires both non-interference and the availability of genuine choices}

acb8bf2d-3bd1-4426-a2fa-e31a22797950.content: {Freedom is linked to the well-being of individuals}, {A person is free if their actions contribute to their overall well-being}, {Freedom involves both the absence of interference and the enhancement of personal well-being}

21b75097-5e40-46e1-80ef-c989441694c5.content: {Freedom encompasses both negative and positive aspects}, {A person is free if they are not interfered with and have the means to pursue their goals}, {Freedom requires both non-interference and the provision of supportive conditions for personal development}

68ce9f91-30c6-410a-85ff-57dac9ffbab7.summary: Distinguishing between negative and positive liberty
68ce9f91-30c6-410a-85ff-57dac9ffbab7.content: {There is a distinction between negative liberty and positive liberty}, {Non-interference liberty is a theory about negative liberty, which is the absence of interference}, {Personal development is a concern of positive liberty, which involves the capacity to achieve self-improvement}, {The objection confuses negative liberty with positive liberty, which are distinct concepts}

191ad260-ac69-4881-89b2-188859cbaa78.summary: Rejecting the necessity of personal development for freedom
191ad260-ac69-4881-89b2-188859cbaa78.content: {It is false that freedom necessarily includes the capacity for personal development}, {Freedom as non-interference is sufficient for a person to be considered free}, {Personal development is a separate value that does not need to be included in the definition of freedom}

daea9bc8-e621-45af-828f-78aae71c4b9c.summary: Supplementing with the concept of enabling conditions
daea9bc8-e621-45af-828f-78aae71c4b9c.content: {Freedom as non-interference can be supplemented with enabling conditions for personal development}, {Enabling conditions are factors that facilitate personal growth without being part of the definition of freedom}, {The absence of interference allows for the creation of enabling conditions, which support personal development}

510f56c9-055b-4b69-8d5d-51d6d7ae32ec.content: {Freedom is the ability to act on one's true desires}, {A person is free if they can pursue their own goals without internal or external constraints}, {Freedom involves self-mastery and self-realization}

596c5ad5-0bc1-4055-8f5b-a6ca5b806863.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary power}, {Freedom requires a system of checks and balances to prevent domination}

b0553712-274f-4bd9-b13b-3002a94de582.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the capability to pursue a life they have reason to value}, {Freedom involves expanding the range of choices and opportunities available to individuals}

92535324-4058-4610-bd00-227085b31d73.content: {Freedom is the capacity for autonomous decision-making}, {A person is free if they can make informed and independent choices}, {Freedom requires the development of critical thinking and self-reflection}

7fc304dc-6af5-468a-b032-2541db2c25dd.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in social and political life}, {A person is free if they can engage in collective decision-making processes}, {Freedom involves the removal of social barriers to participation}

d9e9e8a2-6278-4f7d-af4b-dceaff50fdc2.summary: Distinguishing between external and internal constraints
d9e9e8a2-6278-4f7d-af4b-dceaff50fdc2.content: {There is a distinction between external interference and internal cultural constraints}, {Non-interference liberty is concerned with external interference, not internal cultural constraints}, {Cultural constraints do not constitute interference in the relevant sense of non-interference liberty}, {The objection confuses cultural constraints with the type of interference that non-interference liberty addresses}

05901ac9-2d58-467e-a30b-31713de30e92.summary: Rejecting the necessity of addressing cultural constraints
05901ac9-2d58-467e-a30b-31713de30e92.content: {It is not necessary for a theory of non-interference liberty to address cultural constraints}, {Non-interference liberty is a theory specifically about the absence of external interference}, {Cultural constraints are outside the scope of non-interference liberty and do not undermine its validity}, {The objection mistakenly assumes that all constraints must be addressed by non-interference liberty}

a87e5b95-efac-4510-83f2-9eab4c58c89d.summary: Supplementing with a focus on personal autonomy
a87e5b95-efac-4510-83f2-9eab4c58c89d.content: {Non-interference liberty can be supplemented with a focus on personal autonomy to address cultural constraints}, {Personal autonomy involves the capacity to make one's own choices independently of cultural constraints}, {By supplementing non-interference liberty with personal autonomy, the impact of cultural constraints can be addressed}, {This supplementary assumption allows non-interference liberty to remain intact while considering cultural influences}

feab81fc-690c-44d4-8a80-d51255cd65c7.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have implicitly consented to}, {Implicit consent can be given by participating in the society}

ff578dd9-c955-443d-9ddc-e916a8d0fc50.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they would consent to under ideal conditions}, {Ideal conditions include being fully informed and rational}

817eb35d-13bc-4159-beac-b48f120674f2.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have tacitly consented to}, {Tacit consent is given by enjoying the benefits of the society}

271b44a9-5791-4359-805f-08a2c6df776f.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws that cannot be reasonably rejected}, {Reasonable rejection is determined by fair terms of cooperation}

6e8d7e54-7dbd-46ae-82ca-f0323732a893.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws constructed through a fair decision-making process}, {A fair decision-making process respects all individuals' interests}

a9dcd103-857e-4e32-8322-b8fb1a3ed2ab.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws created by a legitimate procedure}, {A legitimate procedure includes representation and participation}

1097fdbe-9588-45ab-a166-7e4e13ed05c6.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws justified by public reason}, {Public reason requires that laws be justifiable to all citizens}

0a29020e-afb0-4354-a963-99978c5b4764.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws that are part of a fair system of cooperation}, {A fair system of cooperation distributes benefits and burdens equitably}

8ee292de-4b5d-4fee-99da-0a3e193b75ac.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they would agree to as rational agents}, {Rational agents seek to maximize their interests under fair conditions}

a8ee7d80-82a8-4ac6-9e2d-e758d67ed90d.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws that align with moral principles}, {Moral principles are determined by a shared ethical framework}

e91b8654-8212-47f9-b362-0ac84bc8c5a1.summary: Distinguishing between explicit and implicit consent
e91b8654-8212-47f9-b362-0ac84bc8c5a1.content: {There is a distinction between explicit consent and implicit consent}, {Social Contract Liberty can be based on implicit consent, not just explicit consent}, {Living in a society and participating in its benefits can be seen as a form of implicit consent to its laws}, {The intuition that freedom requires explicit consent can be explained by misunderstanding the role of implicit consent}

3fb3c7ad-a9b4-4b08-95e9-b5589978e5cb.summary: Rejecting the necessity of explicit consent for freedom
3fb3c7ad-a9b4-4b08-95e9-b5589978e5cb.content: {It is false that explicit consent is necessary for freedom under Social Contract Liberty}, {Freedom can be derived from a general acceptance of social norms and laws without explicit agreement}, {The intuition that freedom requires explicit consent is mistaken because it overlooks the role of tacit acceptance in social contracts}

3b86ae4a-ef1e-4739-a1b0-8039fa9732af.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of hypothetical consent
3b86ae4a-ef1e-4739-a1b0-8039fa9732af.content: {Hypothetical consent is a form of consent where individuals would agree to laws under ideal conditions}, {Social Contract Liberty can incorporate hypothetical consent as a basis for freedom}, {The objection loses its force because freedom can be understood as living under laws one would consent to under fair conditions}

5bb08003-d13c-42ce-943c-54f3554d56e7.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have explicitly consented to}

2d6da209-bfb8-4807-9826-7d3517a061c1.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they have the opportunity to participate in the creation of the laws they live under}

bd197bfa-7836-4ac8-bb23-45596b476eea.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they can revise or reject through a fair process}

dd68bdc2-6c17-4c2d-9b9a-0174ae51e994.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to with full understanding of the implications}

54b62930-ada1-499e-96b1-9b5907dd5aa3.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws that have been consented to by a majority of the society}

b3809971-dd46-4d51-a67f-313793db5d14.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have conditionally consented to, with the option to withdraw consent}

ab6320c0-9fff-492e-9d9f-b7d771bfdbf8.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have repeatedly consented to over time}

046431c5-84c6-4c01-a440-39cf37979da4.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws formed through a process of public deliberation and debate}

6e0b664a-4c4f-4309-a176-5692d205ee5c.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws that have been agreed upon by consensus}

ed598a8c-c244-4baf-9ae6-566a3103145e.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they have the option to opt out of the laws they do not consent to}

e3803648-8f54-4c20-9c89-4eb782a9b67e.summary: Distinguishing between explicit and tacit consent
e3803648-8f54-4c20-9c89-4eb782a9b67e.content: {There is a distinction between explicit consent and tacit consent}, {Social Contract Liberty is concerned with the legitimacy of laws through any form of consent, including tacit consent}, {Tacit consent can be sufficient for freedom if it is informed and voluntary}, {Participation in society can imply tacit consent if individuals have the option to dissent or exit}, {The intuition that tacit consent is insufficient can be explained by misunderstanding the conditions under which tacit consent is given}

5f9d61de-ce76-49fc-9802-2bb44dbfaed1.summary: Rejecting the necessity of explicit consent for freedom
5f9d61de-ce76-49fc-9802-2bb44dbfaed1.content: {It is false that explicit consent is necessary for genuine freedom}, {Freedom can be maintained through tacit consent if individuals have the opportunity to influence or change the laws}, {The presence of mechanisms for participation and dissent ensures that tacit consent is meaningful}, {The objection that tacit consent is insufficient overlooks the role of democratic processes in legitimizing laws}

0f69da6b-4733-437a-8717-fe45c72773f4.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of reasonable alternatives
0f69da6b-4733-437a-8717-fe45c72773f4.content: {A supplementary assumption is that individuals have reasonable alternatives to participation}, {Tacit consent is meaningful if individuals can choose to leave or change their society}, {The availability of alternatives ensures that participation is a form of consent}, {The objection loses its force if individuals are not coerced into participation and have genuine options}

48b496cc-cebc-41d9-8bcf-673f30d4cacd.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have genuinely consented to}, {Genuine consent requires the absence of coercion or manipulation}

9491cd15-36f5-4b02-9755-b5d1bc769451.content: {Freedom is derived from individual autonomy}, {A person is free if they can make decisions without external coercion}, {Autonomy requires informed and voluntary decision-making}

c2ac8262-0166-4f06-b002-42e4d201fc27.content: {Freedom is derived from rational agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have rationally consented to}, {Rational consent requires understanding and voluntary agreement}

cdc30760-a315-4123-acab-75ddd6909f66.content: {Freedom is derived from voluntary agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have voluntarily consented to}, {Voluntary consent requires the absence of external pressure}

166d5922-485c-4edf-8657-27254f8b659d.content: {Freedom is derived from authentic agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have authentically consented to}, {Authentic consent requires freedom from manipulation}

bf439cff-6859-4830-8ffe-ecb968ee2c51.content: {Freedom is derived from informed agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have informedly consented to}, {Informed consent requires knowledge and understanding of the laws}

9da3ae2e-602d-47c0-b08d-0aabdbf9f6c1.content: {Freedom is derived from non-coercive agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have non-coercively consented to}, {Non-coercive consent requires the absence of force or threat}

badd6e4a-6087-49d4-8c63-36925e59b8a0.content: {Freedom is derived from mutual agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have mutually consented to}, {Mutual consent requires agreement without manipulation}

7b52fc33-0e79-4d01-95b0-9cfb36383278.content: {Freedom is derived from legitimate agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have legitimately consented to}, {Legitimate consent requires a fair and open process}

4e881af8-22bb-414a-a428-f3ec2c60f746.content: {Freedom is derived from uncoerced agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have uncoercedly consented to}, {Uncoerced consent requires the absence of undue influence}

337d3591-591d-41e4-aace-bcb31a34dda5.summary: Distinguishing between genuine and coerced consent
337d3591-591d-41e4-aace-bcb31a34dda5.content: {There is a distinction between genuine consent and coerced or manipulated consent}, {Social Contract Liberty is a theory about freedom derived from genuine consent}, {Consent given under duress or manipulation does not qualify as genuine consent}, {A person is not truly free if their consent is coerced or manipulated, as this does not meet the criteria of genuine consent}

6e259fc8-5b4a-4eb4-af2d-65ab3eb6e0c5.summary: Rejecting the intuition that coerced consent undermines freedom
6e259fc8-5b4a-4eb4-af2d-65ab3eb6e0c5.content: {It is mistaken to assume that coerced consent necessarily undermines freedom}, {Freedom under Social Contract Liberty is defined by the presence of consent, regardless of its conditions}, {The intuition that coerced consent negates freedom can be rejected if freedom is strictly defined by the act of consenting}

4eec0bb1-2c9c-4fb2-9795-7ec630c51411.summary: Supplementing with a condition of voluntary consent
4eec0bb1-2c9c-4fb2-9795-7ec630c51411.content: {A supplementary assumption is that consent must be voluntary to confer freedom}, {Social Contract Liberty can incorporate the condition that only voluntary consent results in true freedom}, {With this assumption, coerced or manipulated consent does not fulfill the criteria for freedom}

7410e473-0e74-4c96-b71e-52ee52dcd901.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Laws must be just for consent to confer freedom}

f0d5187b-bf38-49ed-aec6-2ff8482dd3ef.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent is valid only if the laws are just}

8efecb70-13f4-4c60-9845-ed22a79ddc1b.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Social agreements must be based on moral principles to confer freedom}

cb0b6012-7de2-419a-bcd4-e4d1de87096e.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Ethical constraints are necessary for social agreements to confer freedom}

c2adf457-138e-4ddd-9f28-4db5c7342c3e.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent must be informed and given under just conditions}

6e56e563-300e-47fc-8b46-f6f746704d6d.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Social contracts must be just to confer freedom}

4c7f54f8-4849-4e8a-9383-6c560cf84712.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Social agreements must be fair to confer freedom}

ed2352aa-687a-49b8-b0ca-fed4a50577fb.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Freedom is ensured only if the laws are just}

73d28f94-4c38-4e8c-98c7-aede102c804d.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Moral legitimacy is required for social agreements to confer freedom}

6115070e-bcf0-4245-b3a1-3194e59b25af.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Ethical validity is necessary for social agreements to confer freedom}

9966713d-4a1a-41b7-9dc3-63c2a60d5583.summary: Distinguishing between consent and informed consent
9966713d-4a1a-41b7-9dc3-63c2a60d5583.content: {There is a distinction between mere consent and informed consent}, {Social Contract Liberty requires informed consent for laws to confer freedom}, {Consent to unjust laws is not informed consent if individuals lack full understanding of the laws' implications}, {Freedom is not derived from consent to unjust laws if the consent is not informed}

7545c9cc-d454-4add-8c4a-53dcf0bfca08.summary: Rejecting the intuition that consent to unjust laws confers freedom
7545c9cc-d454-4add-8c4a-53dcf0bfca08.content: {It is false that consent to unjust laws automatically confers freedom}, {Freedom requires that the laws consented to are just and equitable}, {The intuition that individuals are free under unjust laws is mistaken if the laws violate fundamental rights}

2103c49b-125c-4260-945e-611ddbc695f1.summary: Supplementing with a principle of justice
2103c49b-125c-4260-945e-611ddbc695f1.content: {Social Contract Liberty includes a supplementary principle that laws must be just to confer freedom}, {Consent to laws is only valid if the laws meet a basic standard of justice}, {Freedom is derived from social agreements that are both consented to and just}

9b243923-90d0-47a0-9146-551cea35ec46.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {A person is free if they have a reasonable opportunity to influence the laws under which they live}

286aa045-e877-4321-83d7-5eaa9f4c1ab4.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {A person is free if the process of law-making is fair and inclusive}

17d298ae-fed7-4546-be5b-b32949f0cf2d.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {A person is free if they have the opportunity to participate in public deliberation about the laws}

701ebdaf-6a03-4943-b335-d73f51e6b584.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {A person is free if they would consent to the laws under ideal conditions of rational deliberation}

3e7a9c55-43b6-4685-b32e-e8f1c333bc7b.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {A person is free if the laws are the result of a consensus-building process}

aa9e8ec5-6890-4d81-8aef-d4edd3b79cf9.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {A person is free if there are mechanisms to protect minority rights within the legal framework}

167469e2-58f3-4b89-80e7-b5f3d22808fc.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {A person is free if the legal system accommodates diverse perspectives and values}

5558058a-dab6-4747-a544-80ff9e758a42.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {A person is free if the legal system is adaptable to changing social agreements}

277462de-85cc-4e47-a009-e388759917d0.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {A person is free if they have the right to participate in the formation of social agreements}

98b57c8e-4030-441b-a014-876436daff9e.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {A person is free if the social agreements are equitable and just}

d3879ef7-867b-432b-89de-7373c210a925.summary: Distinguishing between collective and individual consent
d3879ef7-867b-432b-89de-7373c210a925.content: {There is a distinction between collective consent and individual consent}, {Social Contract Liberty is concerned with collective consent rather than individual consent}, {A person is considered free under Social Contract Liberty if they are part of a society that collectively consents to laws, even if they individually dissent}, {The intuition that individual dissent implies lack of freedom can be explained by misunderstanding the focus on collective consent}

295d5506-06e6-4adb-abdc-5669a1c1cb9a.summary: Rejecting the intuition that individual dissent negates freedom
295d5506-06e6-4adb-abdc-5669a1c1cb9a.content: {It is mistaken to think that individual dissent automatically negates freedom under Social Contract Liberty}, {Freedom in this context is about participation in a collective decision-making process, not individual agreement with every outcome}, {The presence of a fair process for law-making is what ensures freedom, not unanimous individual consent}

bec0294d-95d2-4d44-8ae7-b4cf9d9ac269.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of procedural fairness
bec0294d-95d2-4d44-8ae7-b4cf9d9ac269.content: {The assumption of procedural fairness is necessary for Social Contract Liberty to ensure freedom}, {Procedural fairness means that all individuals have an equal opportunity to participate in the decision-making process}, {With procedural fairness, even those in the minority are considered free because they had a fair chance to influence the laws}

e3b9ebd1-280a-4422-bcc9-fde167e6b376.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have informed consented to}, {Informed consent requires understanding the implications of the laws}

ef5a6f3d-221f-4883-80e6-22099afa1e73.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have rationally deliberated and consented to}, {Rational deliberation involves critically assessing the implications of the laws}

1a9a83b4-83ee-4ce7-a33e-ba619f138067.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have explicitly consented to}, {Explicit consent requires a clear and direct agreement to the laws}

bdc9e206-a4ca-4888-bb7b-51ef17917422.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to through reflective equilibrium}, {Reflective equilibrium involves balancing principles and judgments to reach a coherent agreement}

cf47c736-dbfb-4922-beff-76e3c71c11d8.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have autonomously consented to}, {Autonomous consent requires the ability to make independent and self-directed choices}

3e284c79-4783-4c0b-8ddd-c6317dd35ad4.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have participated in creating}, {Participation in law-making involves active engagement in democratic processes}

91276851-ef57-4751-a2ee-920d99d1c85e.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws that are transparently governed}, {Transparent governance requires open and clear communication of laws and their implications}

e8aa0aed-a38d-48fc-9985-e11d79cd21fc.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have voluntarily associated with}, {Voluntary association involves freely choosing to be part of a community with specific laws}

6454197b-ca2e-4fd0-ad56-7b7c5e7d8ebb.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have deliberatively consented to}, {Deliberative consent involves engaging in reasoned discussion and debate about the laws}

22110475-ef81-4685-b775-b3991f08e770.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws that involve mutual recognition of consent}, {Mutual recognition requires acknowledging and respecting each other's consent to the laws}

a8599196-8c8a-4c26-864c-64147ce5ca40.summary: Distinguishing between explicit and implicit consent
a8599196-8c8a-4c26-864c-64147ce5ca40.content: {There is a distinction between explicit consent and implicit consent}, {Social Contract Liberty is concerned with implicit consent as a form of agreement}, {A person can be considered free if they implicitly consent to laws by participating in a society}, {The intuition that a person is not free under unknowingly consented laws can be explained by misunderstanding the nature of implicit consent}

c73c103b-575c-4342-84d9-02d2da246573.summary: Rejecting the intuition that understanding is necessary for consent
c73c103b-575c-4342-84d9-02d2da246573.content: {It is false that understanding all implications is necessary for valid consent}, {Consent can be valid even if a person does not fully understand the implications of the laws}, {The appearance of a lack of freedom is due to a mistaken intuition about the necessity of understanding for consent}

3ef3d595-f0be-488d-af64-06416aa49dc6.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of rational endorsement
3ef3d595-f0be-488d-af64-06416aa49dc6.content: {Assume that individuals would rationally endorse laws if they understood them}, {Social Contract Liberty can include the assumption that rational endorsement is a form of consent}, {The objection loses its force if we consider that rational endorsement implies consent even without full understanding}

55617637-faa7-4200-b175-419a52d6b046.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Individuals are free if they have the opportunity to participate in the process of law-making}

eda48fa0-99fb-417d-9573-15119e7f8da3.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent is considered ongoing and can be expressed through regular democratic processes}

a60e0b00-31a8-47fd-b268-54320aba8797.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Freedom is maintained if laws are created through fair and transparent procedures}

af11ee03-51fd-48ec-98ac-e414ef65a05d.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Living in a society implies consent to its laws if there is a fair exit option}

d9f28a1e-1969-4dfe-ba20-61cab0d19685.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent is given through majority rule in a democratic system}

7074aae7-42d5-45d9-9163-6f4232b402b7.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Freedom is preserved if individuals have equal opportunity to influence law-making}

1e7f8b33-3cd4-4618-b155-dadc5c43a204.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent to laws is provisional and subject to periodic review}

838ab8ad-4c89-49cd-9a5f-d3ad9ea862eb.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Freedom is ensured if laws are the result of open and reasoned public deliberation}

12281a0c-4274-49aa-9259-a4d493afee7d.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Laws must be responsive to the changing will of the people to maintain freedom}

8831aa80-ee65-4396-a9b0-af67c326bf09.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent is conditional on the laws reflecting core societal values}

2b0d12a2-c2dc-43e0-923a-7df9c32f9e1c.summary: Distinguishing between initial and ongoing consent
2b0d12a2-c2dc-43e0-923a-7df9c32f9e1c.content: {There is a distinction between initial consent to a social contract and ongoing consent to specific laws}, {Social Contract Liberty is concerned with initial consent to the framework of law-making rather than consent to each individual law}, {A person is considered free if they have consented to the process by which laws are made, even if they do not consent to every specific law}, {The objection confuses the requirement for consent to the law-making process with consent to each law}

945fc70b-7c01-410e-9214-8d3a628db2e6.summary: Rejecting the necessity of individual consent for each law
945fc70b-7c01-410e-9214-8d3a628db2e6.content: {It is false that individuals must consent to each new law to remain free}, {Freedom under Social Contract Liberty is maintained through consent to the overarching legal framework}, {The legitimacy of laws is derived from the agreed-upon process of law-making, not from individual consent to each law}, {The objection mistakenly assumes that freedom requires consent to every specific law rather than to the process}

08e9fa14-78fe-4a80-a5e2-61eff29c64c9.summary: Supplementing with the concept of tacit consent
08e9fa14-78fe-4a80-a5e2-61eff29c64c9.content: {Tacit consent is the idea that by participating in a society, individuals implicitly agree to its laws}, {Social Contract Liberty can incorporate tacit consent as a form of agreement to changing laws}, {A person is considered to have consented to new laws by continuing to live and participate in the society}, {The objection overlooks the role of tacit consent in maintaining freedom under changing laws}

1ffe17f2-e0d2-4c63-8f12-34b12f9a1901.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {A person is free if they have the opportunity to dissent from the laws}

f6369360-2010-4edc-a6ea-80e03150c6df.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Freedom requires the possibility of dissent from the laws}

205a0437-d717-4380-9f0d-164073e3f3b6.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Social agreements must allow for revision and dissent}

5c0a3c80-a0ad-4e10-86f7-d7e21d20c1e1.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Freedom includes active participation in the creation and revision of laws}

63e11be1-a6c1-4b59-877c-d3ebc67c064a.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Social agreements must evolve to incorporate dissenting views}

9674f947-d97b-46f4-9c6b-645a13595558.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Freedom requires the inclusion of diverse perspectives and dissent}

ca5baa35-aafd-4e50-b997-c48ba76c49b9.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Social agreements must be responsive to dissent and change}

23cf1452-57a4-4711-90e4-387bf0c43f66.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Freedom requires the inclusion of mechanisms for dissent}

fc3ed7ca-c460-4c2f-b5d7-a8558ca0bd48.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Social agreements must adapt to allow for dissent}

6bb70b87-cff2-4be6-af4a-4003d3402e2e.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Freedom requires deliberation and the possibility of dissent}

5f73d45b-936c-4603-b6e0-58566eadc6b9.content: {There is a distinction between consenting to laws and the ability to dissent from them}, {Social Contract Liberty is concerned with initial consent to laws rather than ongoing dissent}, {A person can be considered free if they have consented to the laws at some point, even if they cannot currently dissent}, {The intuition that freedom requires dissent can be explained by conflating initial consent with ongoing dissent}

0b8ab625-933e-4da7-8f09-2e5feda1fedc.summary: Rejecting the necessity of dissent for freedom
0b8ab625-933e-4da7-8f09-2e5feda1fedc.content: {It is false that the ability to dissent is necessary for freedom under Social Contract Liberty}, {Freedom is derived from the initial consent to laws, not the ongoing ability to dissent}, {The inability to dissent does not negate the freedom granted by prior consent to the social contract}

fa9fe229-29a7-4db0-87aa-71aa4ec81159.summary: Supplementing with a concept of implicit consent
fa9fe229-29a7-4db0-87aa-71aa4ec81159.content: {Implicit consent can be assumed when individuals continue to live under and benefit from the laws}, {Social Contract Liberty can include implicit consent as a form of ongoing agreement}, {The lack of explicit dissent does not undermine freedom if implicit consent is present}

038ed4d4-8cab-4601-852f-b8cead593b96.content: {Freedom is derived from explicit social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have explicitly consented to}

fdc1b3c8-179c-4ca3-a1be-bc69228f0c46.content: {Freedom is derived from participation in democratic processes}, {A person is free if they have the opportunity to participate in the creation of laws}

4c6f58a3-b3db-4c53-82d6-131e73376adf.content: {Freedom is derived from rational deliberation among citizens}, {A person is free if they live under laws that result from collective rational deliberation}

f522c3a8-8197-42d7-acf6-223e36849ea9.content: {Freedom is derived from majority consent}, {A person is free if they live under laws that have been consented to by the majority}

41ac9790-d6d9-49cf-98bb-a4c606d3f562.content: {Freedom is derived from laws justified by public reason}, {A person is free if they live under laws that can be justified to all citizens through public reason}

e66d0fe5-426a-4f3e-98e8-de294fec1181.content: {Freedom is derived from adherence to a constitutional framework}, {A person is free if they live under laws that adhere to a constitution they have consented to}

551bb05c-64b7-434c-ba22-e8be39073ad8.content: {Freedom is derived from deliberative democratic processes}, {A person is free if they live under laws formed through deliberative democracy}

6f51dd54-d592-487f-9aca-4f66876cc6f7.content: {Freedom is derived from collective agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws formed by collective agreement of society}

47e6f24e-c96e-4207-832f-f24de7798f97.content: {Freedom is derived from transparent governance}, {A person is free if they live under laws created through transparent and open governance}

6a77a95a-2eb8-44ba-a566-4cd4e355717c.content: {Freedom is derived from participatory governance}, {A person is free if they have the opportunity to participate in governance}

070486b7-6cc1-4136-b9cf-7d5163772452.content: {There is a distinction between explicit consent and implicit consent.}, {Social Contract Liberty can be based on implicit consent as well as explicit consent.}, {Implicit consent can be understood as agreement through participation in societal practices.}, {A person can be considered to have consented to laws by choosing to remain in a society and benefit from its structures.}

f9a774da-803f-46c9-89b3-d6f4f9bafe99.summary: Rejecting the necessity of explicit acknowledgment
f9a774da-803f-46c9-89b3-d6f4f9bafe99.content: {It is false that freedom requires explicit acknowledgment of social contracts.}, {Social agreements can be valid even if not explicitly acknowledged by every individual.}, {The stability and functionality of a society can depend on implicit agreements.}, {Freedom can be derived from the benefits and protections provided by these implicit agreements.}

b4c5e5f5-ce48-4dcf-995e-26148f976253.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of tacit consent
b4c5e5f5-ce48-4dcf-995e-26148f976253.content: {Tacit consent is a form of agreement that is not expressed verbally but is inferred from actions.}, {Living within a society and enjoying its benefits can be seen as tacit consent to its social contract.}, {Freedom can be derived from tacit consent to social agreements.}, {The objection loses its force when tacit consent is considered a valid form of agreement.}

fa76c33d-7315-4668-8be6-31da429fcf71.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent must be informed and voluntary for freedom to be genuine}

22509926-4e59-46c9-9c04-523bb4cd6d51.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Laws must respect individual autonomy to be legitimate}

43ae36ef-255b-436a-936e-0759425e6a0c.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent must be continuously renewable to ensure freedom}

03a6f675-fd33-4cce-a148-8883e52a3348.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Laws must impose minimal restrictions on personal autonomy}

e0ac2516-de71-466d-80b0-bf1de1993d07.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Laws must actively promote personal autonomy}

3211ffb4-fa0e-497b-9fa4-8a2888ac5191.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent must be contextually appropriate to ensure freedom}

20404720-e876-4b89-a5c0-098d5b5a99af.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Laws must provide mutual benefits to all consenting parties}

7f7101d0-cc89-4f77-9687-a278d8b6f908.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent must be achieved through reflective equilibrium}

c94de654-6cd3-40cf-a9ff-d88700c5c23a.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent must be rational and well-reasoned}

c9529e26-d697-480d-aa7e-851c04ddb1b7.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Laws must be fair and just to ensure genuine freedom}

4ce7bc40-edeb-4a57-9ebd-2c9aaba522a2.content: {There is a distinction between consent and autonomy}, {Social Contract Liberty is a theory about freedom derived from consent, not autonomy}, {A person can be considered free under Social Contract Liberty if they have consented to the laws, even if those laws restrict autonomy}, {The intuition that individuals are not truly free under restrictive laws can be explained by confusing autonomy with consent}

dfd2b325-49d7-4baa-ada3-98c85ce0324e.summary: Rejecting the intuition that consented restrictions negate freedom
dfd2b325-49d7-4baa-ada3-98c85ce0324e.content: {It is mistaken to think that consented restrictions inherently negate freedom}, {Freedom under Social Contract Liberty is defined by the presence of consent, not the absence of restrictions}, {The intuition that individuals are not free under restrictive laws they consented to is based on a misunderstanding of the nature of freedom in this context}

e6d88c04-70e6-4c99-9821-48cbcf1c6902.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of rational consent
e6d88c04-70e6-4c99-9821-48cbcf1c6902.content: {Assume that consent is rational and informed}, {Rational and informed consent to laws implies an understanding and acceptance of the restrictions}, {With rational consent, the objection that individuals are not truly free loses its force, as freedom is maintained through the rational agreement}

7a3ea6f3-5ced-462a-a5e5-47dec0acedb8.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent must be informed to be valid}

8a337ca0-8fd9-4ce7-b56a-2becaf230ab2.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent must result from rational deliberation}

4eee3d39-6f2f-4954-bdff-631000c823be.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent must be based on true beliefs}

32f45651-783f-4e1c-a966-98c8b6ad5652.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent must be based on transparent and accessible information}

63674199-fe48-4438-a342-b2a0a65aa9ad.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent must be autonomous and free from coercion}

721f027e-82bc-46c4-bf8a-2f8636952257.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent must be based on public reason and common knowledge}

2582b463-278d-4031-bd65-212dc461cdf1.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent must be achieved through deliberative democratic processes}

3e20a847-ca3e-44b8-bf0e-95cfe8efd2e7.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent must be reached through reflective equilibrium}

6dd0628f-9317-426c-b5d5-b5cda8cfbacd.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent must be authentic and reflect true preferences}

80ad434d-3bce-46f7-9479-3ad0a04ca24e.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent must be informed and result from deliberation}

654fa7eb-14f8-4198-b3b4-55bacec66231.summary: Distinguishing between informed and uninformed consent
654fa7eb-14f8-4198-b3b4-55bacec66231.content: {There is a distinction between informed consent and uninformed consent}, {Social Contract Liberty is a theory about freedom derived from informed consent}, {Consent based on misinformation does not meet the criteria for informed consent}, {A person is not truly free if their consent is based on false or misleading information}, {The objection loses its force when considering only informed consent as relevant to freedom}

19e6e49e-529e-4fcd-a4e4-9fa8e39156bc.summary: Rejecting the necessity of fully informed consent for freedom
19e6e49e-529e-4fcd-a4e4-9fa8e39156bc.content: {It is false that fully informed consent is necessary for freedom}, {Freedom can exist even if consent is based on partial or imperfect information}, {The social contract is about the general will and collective agreements, not individual knowledge of all details}, {The objection assumes an unrealistic standard of information for consent}

ec17a860-213f-4c18-b0ed-e98f7d4ba17e.summary: Supplementing with a requirement for reasonable access to information
ec17a860-213f-4c18-b0ed-e98f7d4ba17e.content: {Freedom requires reasonable access to information, not perfect information}, {Social Contract Liberty can include a supplementary assumption that individuals have reasonable access to relevant information}, {If individuals have reasonable access to information, their consent can be considered valid}, {The objection loses its force when considering reasonable access to information as sufficient for informed consent}

bf21b841-8240-4330-abdc-1f9e7acd1197.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have initially consented to}, {A person remains free if they have the opportunity to revise their consent periodically}

ed1975f8-e74e-4fef-b84f-3f0ce71b9cf7.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {A person is free if they can withdraw consent at any time}

de23fe96-16b6-4713-8421-8ad8ef59bbd2.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {A person is free if they have a role in the ongoing creation and revision of laws}

2d96314c-4cf4-42dc-9bc7-85b5200ef580.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {A person is free if their consent is conditional on certain terms being met}

0f5ff582-fe73-4417-8219-7c4160a312b5.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {A person is free if they regularly reaffirm their consent through established processes}

a4b7de24-d424-47fa-9f64-464158fbd184.summary: Distinguishing between initial and ongoing consent
a4b7de24-d424-47fa-9f64-464158fbd184.content: {There is a distinction between initial consent and ongoing consent}, {Social Contract Liberty is concerned with initial consent as the basis for legitimate laws}, {A person is free if they have initially consented to the laws, even if they later change their mind}, {The intuition that ongoing consent is necessary can be explained by a misunderstanding of the role of initial consent in establishing freedom}

aea05310-5d40-4b95-be28-18c699fdc907.summary: Rejecting the necessity of ongoing consent for freedom
aea05310-5d40-4b95-be28-18c699fdc907.content: {It is false that ongoing consent is necessary for a person to be free under Social Contract Liberty}, {Freedom is maintained as long as the laws were initially consented to, regardless of later changes in preference}, {The change of mind does not undermine the legitimacy of the laws or the freedom derived from them}

bba96dec-862f-4b90-95da-9e21c821a870.summary: Supplementing with the concept of tacit consent
bba96dec-862f-4b90-95da-9e21c821a870.content: {Tacit consent is a form of implicit agreement to laws by continued participation in a society}, {A person who remains in a society and benefits from its laws is giving tacit consent to those laws}, {The appearance of needing ongoing explicit consent is addressed by recognizing the role of tacit consent in maintaining freedom}

ad8f3000-dd47-4699-8f28-028114d4307a.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent to laws must be informed and voluntary}, {Laws must not fundamentally undermine essential freedoms such as freedom of expression}

526a2557-5390-4403-929a-f3b49661185a.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Essential freedoms, including freedom of expression, must be preserved in any social contract}

97a0b96a-0528-453c-b695-18fdcc200d9c.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent to laws is valid only if it does not result in the loss of essential freedoms}

26996e1d-ca6b-4365-b921-5bdb166e4bfb.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Laws must balance individual freedoms with social order}, {Freedom of expression is a fundamental component of individual freedom}

287c3998-6ea3-4eca-9626-895020c1bec5.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent must be informed and include understanding of the implications for personal freedoms}

9e33552b-6bb2-4ced-b59d-2a7fc21f7715.content: {There is a distinction between consent and autonomy.}, {Social Contract Liberty is concerned with consent rather than autonomy.}, {A person can consent to laws that limit certain freedoms while still being considered free under the social contract.}, {The intuition that freedom of expression is necessary for freedom can be explained by a focus on autonomy rather than consent.}

9d02a25a-41ad-4656-9b80-c4b6acb19034.summary: Rejecting the necessity of unrestricted expression for freedom
9d02a25a-41ad-4656-9b80-c4b6acb19034.content: {It is false that unrestricted freedom of expression is necessary for freedom.}, {Freedom under the social contract is defined by consent to laws, not by the absence of restrictions.}, {Individuals can be free if they have consented to laws that include reasonable restrictions on expression.}

9f9e6405-9e57-4e76-b190-4445e837b292.summary: Supplementing with the concept of rational consent
9f9e6405-9e57-4e76-b190-4445e837b292.content: {Rational consent involves agreeing to laws that promote overall societal well-being.}, {Individuals can rationally consent to laws that limit expression if they believe it serves a greater good.}, {Freedom is maintained if individuals consent to laws based on rational deliberation and societal benefits.}

ba30a86b-7d59-4239-aff5-1607ff926971.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent is genuine only if it is given under conditions of equal power dynamics}

ff0de2f0-3f2b-421b-bcbc-af03a06b80ba.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent is genuine if it would be given by an ideal observer under conditions of equal power}

ba7bba06-770f-457f-b474-6999d1b7b2a7.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent is genuine if it is given from behind a veil of ignorance, where individuals do not know their position in society}

21d8bcc7-31b9-490e-8769-a788a21d1dde.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent is genuine if it results from rational deliberation among equals}

4c78707e-86c9-4823-a1df-ae896530103e.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent is genuine if it results in mutual advantage for all parties involved}

31b06786-bdef-48da-befc-16ab42310130.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent is genuine if it would be given under hypothetical conditions of equality}

703425b8-e43d-4ce5-8d6b-58be28fe8c94.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent is genuine if it is the outcome of a deliberative democratic process}

245cf3ff-25f1-4b3b-88a2-480e5b52a8a5.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent is genuine if it is the result of a fair bargain among parties with equal bargaining power}

a1efac7a-c2de-45a5-951c-6e12aa7b07ea.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent is genuine if the principles of the agreement can be universalized without contradiction}

7ebaa9cc-8007-48b5-92c4-6effa4b2a270.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent is genuine if it is based on reciprocal agreements that respect the autonomy of all parties}

8d8dd8a3-70aa-4d6a-b545-3bdbb4085216.content: {There is a distinction between genuine consent and coerced consent}, {Social Contract Liberty is a theory about freedom derived from genuine consent}, {Consent given under unequal power dynamics is not genuine consent}, {A person is not truly free if their consent is coerced, even if they appear to agree to the laws}

86192d7c-d47b-4c3b-a80e-d3489e5345b8.summary: Rejecting the intuition that consent under inequality is always compromised
86192d7c-d47b-4c3b-a80e-d3489e5345b8.content: {It is false that consent under unequal power dynamics is always compromised}, {Individuals can still exercise genuine consent even in scenarios of unequal power}, {The presence of unequal power dynamics does not necessarily invalidate the freedom derived from social agreements}

2a4dd06e-de96-4631-bdb4-56a94504279e.summary: Supplementing with a requirement for fair conditions
2a4dd06e-de96-4631-bdb4-56a94504279e.content: {Freedom derived from social agreements requires fair conditions for consent}, {A supplementary assumption is that social agreements must be made under conditions of fairness}, {If laws are consented to under fair conditions, then freedom is not compromised even if power dynamics are unequal}

4163dee1-3d2e-474e-83dd-4289a63c9bb8.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {A person is free if they can revoke their consent to the laws}

7f4b9371-4922-431e-a52a-b2fe3adadb1c.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent to laws must be continuously reaffirmed for a person to remain free}

6b43db4a-b61d-4a55-a5e0-3fd8483411e4.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {A person is free if they have regular opportunities to withdraw or modify their consent}

519ef3a7-3a8f-4d99-be02-4a352d7ad25e.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent to laws is valid only if conditions for revocation are clearly defined and accessible}

612a2dfd-9bb6-447b-a899-db76003a32aa.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent to laws is provisional and subject to periodic review}

66fc2573-ff9c-48c2-a7df-4f51c7d674f1.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {A person is free if they can revoke their consent at any time without penalty}

4229841c-326c-4940-a6af-6aa5acb55fc0.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Social agreements must adapt to changes in individual consent to ensure freedom}

3fba38a5-4ff3-40a4-865e-d7053cf0fb14.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {A person is free if the legal system is responsive to changes in individual consent}

6bfebd44-cab2-4fa9-875f-2ddabd759ddc.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent to laws evolves with societal changes and individual preferences}

01de809d-2ac0-4271-a78c-1689ab52249f.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {A person is free if they can adjust their consent to laws as circumstances change}

41c2f5b0-31f8-47d0-90e9-7f6a9c0625a6.summary: Distinguishing between initial and ongoing consent
41c2f5b0-31f8-47d0-90e9-7f6a9c0625a6.content: {There is a distinction between initial consent and ongoing consent}, {Social Contract Liberty is primarily concerned with initial consent to social agreements}, {The inability to revoke consent does not negate the initial freedom granted by consenting to the social contract}, {The intuition that freedom requires the ability to revoke consent can be explained by conflating initial and ongoing consent}

477699d8-0706-4310-bf4f-138519edb49b.summary: Rejecting the necessity of revocable consent for freedom
477699d8-0706-4310-bf4f-138519edb49b.content: {It is false that freedom requires the ability to revoke consent}, {Freedom is maintained as long as the laws reflect the initial consent given by the individual}, {The inability to revoke consent does not inherently imply a lack of freedom if the laws continue to align with the original agreement}

fde43478-82ca-4d98-8ccc-a2d187297e6f.summary: Supplementing with a mechanism for periodic reassessment
fde43478-82ca-4d98-8ccc-a2d187297e6f.content: {A supplementary assumption is that social contracts include mechanisms for periodic reassessment of consent}, {These mechanisms allow individuals to express their consent or dissent at regular intervals}, {The presence of such mechanisms ensures that freedom is preserved even if consent cannot be revoked at any moment}

f41e85fa-5cb0-4352-9813-a66205aa9526.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Laws must be comprehensible to those who consent to them}

dfaa27c1-19a4-43a9-bb3b-9856d7dcf2f7.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent requires rational understanding of the laws}

23cc6b05-a74c-49b6-88c6-dd196eeacc5f.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Laws must be transparent and accessible to all individuals}

7931ff5c-28f5-449c-9aa5-2173ab60fad5.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Individuals must have the opportunity to participate in the creation and revision of laws}

5c21a379-8d3d-43f5-b60e-43f5fb7afd3f.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Society must ensure individuals are educated about the laws they consent to}

948d41e3-5fd6-4ee7-bc7f-58d59ef606b4.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent is valid only if laws are simplified for understanding}

d4168c3a-c5d3-4343-ae78-dd5c26d02cbc.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Consent requires individuals to be informed about the implications of the laws}

b118b86a-14c6-416b-a442-8c1c58cbd0ca.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {The legal framework must be accessible and understandable to all citizens}

484b8d8b-787c-487b-baab-c95d55414e0c.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Laws must be within the cognitive capacity of individuals to understand}

9ae3d5e9-cdf2-4447-bf1f-0537a78f8268.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {Individuals must have interactive means to engage with and understand laws}

df4caec6-8e89-44e6-a70d-ff71c58d8691.summary: Distinguishing between explicit and implicit consent
df4caec6-8e89-44e6-a70d-ff71c58d8691.content: {There is a distinction between explicit consent and implicit consent to laws}, {Social Contract Liberty can be based on implicit consent when explicit understanding is not feasible}, {Complex laws can still be consented to implicitly if they are part of a legitimate legal system}, {The intuition that individuals are not free due to complexity can be explained by misunderstanding the nature of implicit consent}

01da1b87-5c87-43e5-8cad-11d96ef3d637.summary: Rejecting the necessity of full comprehension for consent
01da1b87-5c87-43e5-8cad-11d96ef3d637.content: {It is false that full comprehension of laws is necessary for consent}, {Consent can be given to a legal system as a whole without understanding every detail}, {The appearance of lack of freedom due to complexity is a mistaken intuition about the nature of consent}

7b0d4ba4-9e88-43b7-b39c-a09f444edcb0.summary: Supplementing with the role of representatives
7b0d4ba4-9e88-43b7-b39c-a09f444edcb0.content: {Social Contract Liberty can include the role of representatives who understand and consent to laws on behalf of individuals}, {Representatives can act as intermediaries to ensure that laws reflect the consent of the governed}, {The complexity of laws does not undermine freedom if representatives are trusted and accountable}

81288f9e-59c6-41b7-9bc3-8a7d9a405bcc.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to without coercion}, {Consent must be given in the absence of social pressure for it to be genuine}

d9e80f1b-3939-4018-b04e-12405e8d0535.content: {Freedom is derived from individual autonomy}, {A person is free if they act according to their own rational will}, {Consent is genuine if it aligns with the individual's autonomous decision-making}

0bca3d22-d0ff-44b2-83ce-e129eac30af0.content: {Freedom is derived from rational consent}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have rationally consented to}, {Consent is genuine if it is based on informed and rational deliberation}

8d2f7612-31fd-4ec3-a1ff-11f73669e4e7.content: {Freedom is derived from voluntary agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have voluntarily agreed to}, {Consent is genuine if it is given without external compulsion or undue influence}

d4a9ea02-e4aa-4c2e-9004-6694624a07bd.content: {Freedom is derived from democratic deliberation}, {A person is free if they live under laws resulting from collective deliberation}, {Consent is genuine if it emerges from a fair and open deliberative process}

f26f50ea-2b41-4861-8aba-5c735ee779ee.content: {Freedom is derived from authentic consent}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have authentically consented to}, {Consent is genuine if it reflects the individual's true preferences and values}

d30661a0-d41c-47fd-9636-8537880ef581.content: {Freedom is derived from informed consent}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to with full information}, {Consent is genuine if it is based on comprehensive understanding of the laws}

3bd99f22-4ad2-4b1e-8251-5b56732f6671.content: {Freedom is derived from non-coercive consent}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to without coercion}, {Consent is genuine if it is free from coercive social influences}

65818406-50db-4af5-b2cd-503c0b1ddad0.content: {Freedom is derived from reflective equilibrium}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to after reflective consideration}, {Consent is genuine if it results from a process of reflective equilibrium}

ece9da19-9049-4183-b4d2-62d153a994d7.content: {Freedom is derived from moral autonomy}, {A person is free if they act according to self-imposed moral laws}, {Consent is genuine if it aligns with the individual's moral autonomy}

ce400fac-e68e-4714-93d4-32b6bf7ed2ee.summary: Distinguishing between genuine and coerced consent
ce400fac-e68e-4714-93d4-32b6bf7ed2ee.content: {There is a distinction between genuine consent and coerced consent}, {Social Contract Liberty is a theory about freedom derived from genuine consent rather than coerced consent}, {Consent given under social pressure does not qualify as genuine consent}, {A person is not truly free if their consent is coerced by social norms}, {The objection loses its force when considering only genuine consent as relevant to freedom}

5ac60dcc-9e2e-41d4-aa6a-60f4af3a7474.summary: Rejecting the intuition that social pressure negates freedom
5ac60dcc-9e2e-41d4-aa6a-60f4af3a7474.content: {It is mistaken to assume that social pressure necessarily negates freedom}, {Social pressure can coexist with genuine consent if individuals have the capacity to resist it}, {Freedom is maintained as long as individuals have the ability to reflect and choose despite social norms}, {The intuition that social pressure always undermines freedom is incorrect}

84f0f910-d749-4728-9bec-92e89f1d45b1.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of reflective endorsement
84f0f910-d749-4728-9bec-92e89f1d45b1.content: {Reflective endorsement is the process of critically evaluating and affirming one's own choices}, {Social Contract Liberty can include the assumption that freedom requires reflective endorsement of consent}, {Consent under social pressure is compatible with freedom if individuals reflectively endorse the laws}, {The objection loses its force when reflective endorsement is considered a part of genuine consent}

4ffcd8aa-01e9-48fe-ab2b-72c02e7c00e0.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to or have the opportunity to consent to}, {A person is free if they can participate in the process of revising laws}

8693e73e-5866-4c45-af6f-a2308d1fd1a1.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they have the opportunity to express consent or dissent to current laws}, {A person is free if they can influence the creation of new laws}

78440e67-bb97-4817-9042-9ba3e8985978.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they have the right to participate in democratic processes}, {A person is free if they can vote on laws that govern them}

2d285736-cabe-43b4-ae4f-bde8006ef8a2.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws that are subject to regular review and revision}, {A person is free if they can engage in the process of law-making}

a8a8bf66-c17f-4d71-a582-8b0b94a43d97.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they are represented by individuals they have elected}, {A person is free if their representatives have the power to change laws}

d09c1168-97ec-4d4a-9a9e-d0aea57b2264.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws created through fair procedures}, {A person is free if they can challenge laws through established legal processes}

82fe6890-4fd9-450d-81c5-48523fa5b263.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they can continuously express consent or dissent to laws}, {A person is free if they can initiate changes to laws}

7810688a-9983-40b6-ac88-ba33e5890827.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if laws adapt to changing societal values}, {A person is free if they can participate in the adaptation of laws}

6c5b44c1-d724-404d-a49f-4f4dad42b74c.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if laws are legitimate through active participation}, {A person is free if they can engage in public discourse about laws}

117b95e7-5ff0-493b-8c3d-7c6b6af888cb.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if laws respond to the needs and values of the society}, {A person is free if they can influence the responsiveness of laws}

e876a801-c8ba-41bd-900f-962411f0734a.summary: Distinguishing between historical and current consent
e876a801-c8ba-41bd-900f-962411f0734a.content: {There is a distinction between historical consent and current consent}, {Social Contract Liberty is concerned with the idea of consent in principle, not necessarily with historical consent}, {A person is free if they have the opportunity to consent to or dissent from the laws under which they live}, {The intuition that individuals are not free under historical agreements can be explained by the lack of opportunity for current consent}

8d025734-6fc3-40f0-b3c5-798700a0544e.summary: Rejecting the necessity of individual consent for freedom
8d025734-6fc3-40f0-b3c5-798700a0544e.content: {It is false that individual consent to each law is necessary for freedom}, {Freedom can be derived from a system where individuals have the ability to influence and change laws over time}, {The presence of democratic processes allows for the expression of consent even if not every individual has explicitly agreed to every law}

1a37317e-6968-4257-a4f4-ae1b3b78808f.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of tacit consent
1a37317e-6968-4257-a4f4-ae1b3b78808f.content: {Tacit consent is the idea that by participating in a society, individuals implicitly agree to its laws}, {Social Contract Liberty can include the notion of tacit consent as a form of agreement}, {The objection loses its force if we assume that living within a society implies a form of consent to its laws}

3d99da50-9568-42d8-ac7b-ad3460fb9b1e.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {A person is free if they have the opportunity to influence future laws}

7bb426fd-465d-4703-bab3-c2a0cb95ad8a.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {A person is free if they can withdraw consent from existing laws}

ab57ce80-d1f3-4b05-a3d9-fe3e333a3dc4.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {A person is free if they can participate in the creation of laws}

bf63f9aa-b9b2-49e1-aa22-c27c249905e4.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {A person is free if they can periodically reaffirm or withdraw consent}

0c83ff7b-36ba-4ad3-a797-4a7430251276.content: {Freedom is derived from social agreements}, {A person is free if they live under laws they have consented to}, {A person is free if multiple legal frameworks are available for consent}

0fa62512-a380-4467-ba42-9f797f07d9b2.content: {There is a distinction between consenting to laws and having alternative choices.}, {Social Contract Liberty is concerned with consent to laws, not the availability of alternative choices.}, {A person can be considered free if they have consented to the laws, even if no alternative choices are available.}, {The intuition that freedom requires alternative choices can be explained as a misunderstanding of the role of consent in Social Contract Liberty.}

21f18904-1d9e-4c7b-8bb9-75fe6428495f.summary: Rejecting the necessity of alternative choices for freedom
21f18904-1d9e-4c7b-8bb9-75fe6428495f.content: {It is false that freedom necessarily requires the possibility of alternative choices.}, {Freedom, according to Social Contract Liberty, is about living under laws one has consented to, not about having multiple options.}, {The absence of alternative choices does not undermine freedom if the existing laws are consented to.}

888cc3cf-2560-46d3-95b7-11949307d5ab.summary: Supplementing with the concept of hypothetical consent
888cc3cf-2560-46d3-95b7-11949307d5ab.content: {Hypothetical consent refers to the idea that individuals would consent to laws under ideal conditions.}, {Social Contract Liberty can incorporate hypothetical consent to address the lack of alternative choices.}, {Even if no alternative choices are available, individuals can be considered free if they would hypothetically consent to the laws.}

6af34e2e-eb7e-4165-b8b5-6b4361d672d2.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they act according to their desires}, {Desires can be shaped by rational deliberation or impulsive inclinations}

ec27ebc4-3536-4bf4-8772-c59b5cb1e1c8.content: {Freedom involves acting on higher-order desires}, {A person is free if their actions align with their reflective endorsement of their desires}, {Reflective endorsement can occur with or without rational deliberation}

5f20df2e-a86e-4f47-ae47-f26e1369891b.content: {Freedom is the expression of one's authentic self}, {A person is free if their actions express their true character}, {True character can be expressed through both rational and impulsive actions}

934d9442-7177-47b2-b63c-0e7425201f0e.content: {Autonomy involves self-governance}, {A person is autonomous if they govern their actions according to their own principles}, {Self-governance can be achieved through rational deliberation or spontaneous decision-making}

258554de-4542-45c9-9724-ce6e344a4c7d.content: {Freedom requires the ability to do otherwise}, {A person is free if they have genuine alternative possibilities for action}, {Alternative possibilities can exist regardless of rational deliberation}

56a5ae0a-0fe5-4808-b30c-ee018c4774a2.content: {Freedom involves agents causing their actions}, {A person is free if they are the originator of their actions}, {Origination of actions can occur with or without rational deliberation}

c37c1b5f-8006-443d-9466-4eb9bd1e8412.content: {Freedom is a practical concept}, {A person is free if they can pursue their goals effectively}, {Pursuit of goals can be guided by rational deliberation or practical intuition}

5c8dd008-9dd5-4b9d-8de5-d6aed5f393e3.content: {Freedom is a lived experience}, {A person is free if they experience their actions as uncoerced}, {Uncoerced experience can arise from rational or non-rational sources}

8a8dd499-2789-4110-b585-f43cd40febf8.content: {Freedom is context-dependent}, {A person is free if their actions fit the context of their life}, {Contextual fit can be achieved through rational planning or spontaneous adaptation}

50321a0d-dd84-464f-b87d-efe5f5b74f2f.content: {Freedom is about creating one's essence}, {A person is free if they define themselves through their actions}, {Self-definition can occur through deliberate choice or impulsive acts}

2524ec51-8403-4771-aef3-3d840933c0d5.content: {There is a distinction between freedom as rational autonomy and freedom as spontaneity}, {Rational Will Liberty is a theory about freedom as rational autonomy rather than spontaneity}, {A person acting impulsively may be free in the sense of spontaneity but not in the sense of rational autonomy}, {The intuition that impulsive actions can be free is explained by the distinction between these two types of freedom}

f97a01c6-5a59-40a9-ba09-cf32b471817b.summary: Rejecting the intuition that impulsive actions are free
f97a01c6-5a59-40a9-ba09-cf32b471817b.content: {It is mistaken to intuitively judge that impulsive actions are free}, {True freedom involves acting in accordance with rational deliberations, not mere impulses}, {The appearance of freedom in impulsive actions is an illusion and does not constitute genuine freedom}

3eee11fb-d26f-4ac0-ac80-c7674462c4f6.summary: Supplementing with the concept of rational potential
3eee11fb-d26f-4ac0-ac80-c7674462c4f6.content: {A person has the potential for rational deliberation even when acting impulsively}, {Freedom is preserved as long as the capacity for rational deliberation exists, even if not exercised in every action}, {The scenario of impulsive action does not undermine Rational Will Liberty because the potential for rationality remains}

d6c66c44-3155-4869-b87f-9d11304400e3.content: {Freedom is acting according to rational will}, {A person is free if they act in accordance with their rational deliberations}, {Freedom is compatible with external coercion if the person's rational will aligns with the coerced action}
