3f61fa3c-7b41-4c9b-bf20-2efa0d2cbd1a.content: {Freedom is acting according to rational will}, {A person is free if they act in accordance with their rational deliberations}, {A person is free if their higher-order desires align with their actions, even under coercion}

c8a6179c-3c18-47e1-be50-e65505f69751.content: {Freedom is acting according to rational will}, {A person is free if they act in accordance with their rational deliberations}, {A person is free if they reflectively endorse their coerced actions as aligning with their rational will}

4f49a8a7-374b-4e5f-a695-e4857e2216ef.content: {Freedom is acting according to rational will}, {A person is free if they act in accordance with their rational deliberations}, {A person is free if their actions under coercion are authentic expressions of their rational self}

5f1a445d-ed2a-4fd8-99e1-39ebb376b783.summary: Rational Will Liberty with Moral Responsibility
5f1a445d-ed2a-4fd8-99e1-39ebb376b783.content: {Freedom is acting according to rational will}, {A person is free if they act in accordance with their rational deliberations}, {A person is free if they are morally responsible for their actions, even under coercion}

759de301-57c3-49af-a9ea-57b02d07569b.summary: Distinguishing between internal and external freedom
759de301-57c3-49af-a9ea-57b02d07569b.content: {There is a distinction between internal freedom and external freedom}, {Rational Will Liberty is a theory about internal freedom rather than external freedom}, {A person can be internally free if they act according to their rational deliberations, even if they are externally coerced}, {The intuition that a coerced person is not free can be explained as confusion between internal and external freedom}

3846eb2a-0ae5-4ace-8ca0-836c0481a357.summary: Rejecting the intuition that coercion negates rational will
3846eb2a-0ae5-4ace-8ca0-836c0481a357.content: {It is false that coercion necessarily negates the exercise of rational will}, {A person can still act according to their rational deliberations even when coerced}, {The presence of coercion does not automatically imply the absence of freedom if rational deliberation is intact}

436ef9a8-29b1-4f43-9e11-daa9f092a8a8.summary: Supplementing with the concept of degrees of freedom
436ef9a8-29b1-4f43-9e11-daa9f092a8a8.content: {Freedom can be understood in terms of degrees rather than an all-or-nothing concept}, {A person can have a degree of freedom if they act according to their rational deliberations, even under coercion}, {The intuition that a coerced person is not free can be explained by recognizing that their degree of freedom is diminished, not absent}

ee0f8c0f-3f40-4477-a7c8-18b1a56e65be.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {A person is free if they act according to their desires}, {Desires can be shaped by rational deliberations or instincts}

81622ec9-59e5-466a-bc22-02e06b3ff2ee.content: {Freedom involves acting according to higher-order desires}, {Higher-order desires are desires about desires}, {A person is free if their actions align with their higher-order desires}

10fa4121-eff1-47d0-b678-f1ca2dddaf44.content: {Freedom involves agents causing actions}, {Agents can cause actions independently of deterministic laws}, {A person is free if they are the originator of their actions}

73c085c0-e4ff-40fd-9300-b1b24a388b18.content: {Freedom requires indeterminism}, {A person is free if they can do otherwise}, {Freedom involves genuine choice between alternatives}

03def891-bbb3-4e0c-881c-391d3528b31c.content: {Freedom is the expression of one's character}, {Character can be shaped by rational deliberations or instincts}, {A person is free if their actions express their character}

3e8c1960-3344-4cff-8c0e-3dde2ddde4a9.content: {Freedom is acting in harmony with one's environment}, {Non-rational beings can be free by acting in accordance with their ecological niche}, {A person is free if they act in a way that sustains their environment}

d1468d12-fd0e-4267-aace-751e3fc4534d.content: {Freedom is defined by the function of actions}, {Actions serve functions that can be rational or instinctual}, {A person is free if their actions fulfill their intended function}

ab58bc63-809c-4a8c-b400-53a0a35c5701.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve goals}, {Goals can be set by rational deliberations or instincts}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their goals}

169cb933-1c74-4505-8ca2-9d9162ec6d7b.content: {Freedom is defined by social relationships}, {Social relationships can be influenced by rational deliberations or instincts}, {A person is free if they can navigate and influence their social context}

2b0fe417-0005-4dd0-9f7f-760fa1a76054.content: {Freedom is a natural phenomenon}, {Non-rational beings can exhibit freedom through natural behaviors}, {A person is free if their actions are part of natural processes}

b2361761-7742-4dca-a87b-1ab618853c73.content: {There is a distinction between rational freedom and instinctual freedom}, {Rational Will Liberty is a theory about rational freedom rather than instinctual freedom}, {An animal acting according to its instincts can exhibit instinctual freedom, which is different from rational freedom}, {The intuition that non-rational beings can be free is explained by recognizing different types of freedom}

3996a06e-9f6f-44d7-bdf6-0814e7e55849.summary: Rejecting the intuition that non-rational freedom is equivalent to rational freedom

066ae510-9a70-4feb-ad78-a4a7ddfd0f4f.content: {There is a distinction between having the ability to achieve goals and having the opportunity to pursue them}, {Pragmatic Liberty is concerned with the ability to achieve goals, not the availability of resources}, {A person can be considered free in terms of ability even if they lack resources, as ability does not entail opportunity}

de7a7bbf-ec9c-47e0-98a1-ee7089b50b3b.content: {It is mistaken to claim that lacking resources necessarily means a lack of freedom}, {Freedom as the ability to achieve goals does not require the immediate presence of resources}, {The intuition that resources are necessary for freedom confuses practical ability with current circumstances}

e66435cc-6f1b-4342-bf19-43c3b745f0f4.summary: Supplementing with a focus on potential resource acquisition
e66435cc-6f1b-4342-bf19-43c3b745f0f4.content: {Pragmatic Liberty can include the potential to acquire resources as part of the ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they have the potential to gain the resources needed to pursue their objectives}, {The objection loses its force if freedom includes the capacity to change one's resource situation}

ce94049d-a8e7-44f7-8b73-613c213444c9.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is not free if they are coerced into pursuing objectives they do not choose}

3cb3fd2a-2a4d-46e6-96d8-234eeab59e9d.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free only if they autonomously choose their objectives}

27186ebb-f6f3-42ad-8296-0f552976ce9a.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they are not subject to coercion in their choice of objectives}

78175f45-a096-43f3-a90d-2ae20de56649.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if their pursuit of objectives is based on autonomous decision-making}

1eb34e81-c71f-4343-86c4-799eea39efb4.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if their objectives align with their volitional desires}

e24768c8-96f0-4b14-89a7-c12809c24c4a.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they consent to the objectives they pursue}

3f1da9ad-01e2-4e13-91c8-c6434cef0465.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they are not coerced into pursuing specific objectives}

011866d2-0cfd-4e9f-8cbd-ce4618bbb346.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if their choice of objectives is authentic and self-determined}

00c7a3a1-dca8-440b-9cec-b64489e3e6d7.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if their pursuit of objectives is voluntary and uncoerced}

e18edb17-911e-4a22-83cc-e41cfb485b87.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if their goals are self-directed and not imposed by others}

4a38793b-5ecd-4326-bd43-d31f00a3da69.summary: Distinguishing between coercion and practical ability
4a38793b-5ecd-4326-bd43-d31f00a3da69.content: {There is a distinction between coercion and practical ability to achieve goals}, {Pragmatic Liberty is concerned with the practical ability to achieve goals, not the freedom of choice in selecting those goals}, {Coercion affects the freedom of choice but does not necessarily impact the practical ability to achieve objectives}, {A person can be practically free even if their choice of objectives is influenced by coercion}

d060d8d4-9ff8-445e-a555-b4c987f65c32.summary: Rejecting the intuition that coercion negates practical freedom
d060d8d4-9ff8-445e-a555-b4c987f65c32.content: {It is mistaken to believe that coercion negates a person's practical ability to achieve goals}, {Pragmatic Liberty focuses on the effectiveness in pursuing objectives, regardless of how those objectives are chosen}, {The intuition that coercion undermines freedom is based on a misunderstanding of what constitutes practical ability}

ec9d9225-58bc-43a7-b60e-6c097d8dfdc1.summary: Supplementing with a distinction between internal and external freedom
ec9d9225-58bc-43a7-b60e-6c097d8dfdc1.content: {Pragmatic Liberty can be supplemented with a distinction between internal and external freedom}, {Internal freedom refers to the ability to choose objectives without coercion}, {External freedom refers to the practical ability to achieve chosen objectives}, {Coercion affects internal freedom but not necessarily external freedom}

0c31e027-1019-4328-978f-6787b93674ab.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free only if they are aware of their true objectives}

3d4bb847-b14c-4ba3-ba67-57a2b2acdba7.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free only if they have reflected on and endorsed their objectives}

7309ce0c-5819-4656-b370-9d9502e81816.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free only if they have access to relevant information about their objectives}

35af87f3-3979-413e-b2c1-15e07b116aed.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free only if they consciously choose their objectives}

9c5c47be-e294-497d-ad02-b2e4cf433266.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free only if they determine their own objectives}

22c1d1fb-5799-431f-9ace-d82b4d3963b6.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free only if their objectives align with their authentic self}

4c2fb2d9-6026-4b71-9d66-68b611751d36.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free only if they are aware of their goals}

221f9fb6-bccc-4aea-8b67-d42f48a48b3b.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free only if their objectives are rationally chosen}

8993c793-1dc6-4c59-b6fb-f45fef15ef5b.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free only if they have a clear purpose in their objectives}

69604f29-325b-416f-9243-d271581b2826.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free only if they intentionally set their objectives}

724606a8-7eca-4225-a1a1-2be1a4cb7df0.summary: Distinguishing between awareness and practical ability
724606a8-7eca-4225-a1a1-2be1a4cb7df0.content: {There is a distinction between awareness of objectives and the practical ability to achieve them}, {Pragmatic Liberty is a theory about practical ability rather than awareness of objectives}, {A person can be considered free in the pragmatic sense if they have the ability to achieve goals, regardless of their awareness of those goals}, {The intuition that unawareness compromises freedom can be explained as a confusion between awareness and practical ability}

6d0656b7-5765-4dcd-b17f-94457645b1b7.summary: Rejecting the intuition that awareness is necessary for freedom
6d0656b7-5765-4dcd-b17f-94457645b1b7.content: {It is false that awareness of objectives is necessary for freedom in the pragmatic sense}, {Freedom as the practical ability to achieve goals does not require awareness of those goals}, {The appearance that unawareness compromises freedom can be explained by a mistaken intuition that awareness is a component of pragmatic liberty}

bef73aae-4a83-471f-8872-3fc54e38b673.summary: Explaining the intuition through potential for discovery
bef73aae-4a83-471f-8872-3fc54e38b673.content: {A person may be unaware of their true objectives but still possess the potential to discover them}, {Pragmatic Liberty includes the capacity to pursue objectives once they are discovered}, {The intuition that unawareness compromises freedom is explained by the potential for discovery and subsequent pursuit of objectives}

4a522086-080c-4eee-a2e1-b9d05d5c5c78.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if their choice of objectives is not manipulated by external forces}

b2318b6a-ffb7-48f2-be16-27eaf9cc37a3.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if their objectives align with their authentic desires}

43684b08-cebd-4ef6-97a2-0b5665755e06.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they have full information about their objectives and the means to achieve them}

a22d1e62-92c5-4dcb-8d8d-7993607c6430.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they have reflected on and endorsed their objectives}

932c2cac-98a8-4acf-a209-cc1ba8674896.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if their choice of objectives is not coerced by others}

091a6143-d19a-4a74-973a-df2b94300a11.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if their objectives are chosen through their own volition}

62183b2d-9a16-43f1-8a29-300bd14abd7f.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they determine their own objectives without undue influence}

4a4d5f52-76ac-4b13-8036-7dee23dd04cc.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if their objectives are chosen through rational deliberation}

a5a489db-6127-4a5d-9c73-622e41fb85b7.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if their objectives are consistent with their core values}

26258e52-d782-4f6b-9e64-1a4350d4379c.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if their objectives are not the result of manipulation}

f948fa7c-6fdb-47c7-b62a-a4cd87f15329.summary: Distinguishing between internal and external constraints
f948fa7c-6fdb-47c7-b62a-a4cd87f15329.content: {There is a distinction between internal and external constraints on freedom}, {Pragmatic Liberty is concerned with external constraints, not internal ones like manipulation}, {Manipulation affects internal decision-making processes, not the external ability to achieve goals}, {A person manipulated into choosing objectives can still be free in the sense of having the practical ability to achieve those objectives}

fbe0b4f9-2ef9-45b5-bcd8-58c2d608e5cc.summary: Rejecting the intuition that manipulation negates freedom
fbe0b4f9-2ef9-45b5-bcd8-58c2d608e5cc.content: {It is false that manipulation necessarily negates freedom}, {Freedom as the practical ability to achieve goals remains intact even if objectives are influenced by manipulation}, {The intuition that manipulation negates freedom can be explained by conflating freedom with autonomy}

5bac9855-b4fd-435b-b962-5cca19ad5173.summary: Supplementing with a distinction between autonomy and freedom
5bac9855-b4fd-435b-b962-5cca19ad5173.content: {Autonomy and freedom are distinct concepts}, {Pragmatic Liberty focuses on freedom as the ability to achieve goals, not on autonomy}, {A person can be free in the pragmatic sense even if their autonomy is compromised by manipulation}, {The objection loses force when recognizing that autonomy is not a requirement for pragmatic freedom}

f787ca74-574d-49eb-9e26-f371ea5066de.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue a coherent set of objectives}, {A coherent set of objectives is one where objectives do not conflict with each other}

222d2b1b-5264-4f65-bc51-13a56d7ec16d.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives without internal conflict}, {Internal conflict is defined as having objectives that cannot be pursued simultaneously}

42fba749-28b1-4257-bca5-daa3b6e5e3f2.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue integrated objectives}, {Integrated objectives are those that align and support each other}

29cc199e-1334-4eac-ae12-81e1d5ee3b1e.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue consistent objectives}, {Consistent objectives are those that do not contradict each other}

a4b5fa54-9fc3-4a12-8254-a406b7bb98b7.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue a unified set of objectives}, {A unified set of objectives is one where all objectives are compatible}

8725b657-6f6b-4b74-a07a-9f1097c10d9e.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue non-conflicting objectives}, {Non-conflicting objectives are those that can be pursued without hindrance from each other}

c85b9e61-4148-463e-97f2-bff7ac679703.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue aligned objectives}, {Aligned objectives are those that work together towards a common purpose}

e58d38d5-6597-4ad0-9456-c4d23996fc16.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue coherent objectives}, {Coherent objectives are those that fit together logically}

8ba27a5d-fda4-4829-8c98-0c155ba50e48.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue synergistic objectives}, {Synergistic objectives are those that enhance each other when pursued together}

3f7afb95-1c1b-41c4-bfbc-124ae9fb6786.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue compatible objectives}, {Compatible objectives are those that do not interfere with each other}

97de9988-8ef1-456d-a59e-797a2edd65de.summary: Distinguishing between freedom and coherence of objectives
97de9988-8ef1-456d-a59e-797a2edd65de.content: {There is a distinction between having freedom and having coherent objectives}, {Pragmatic Liberty is a theory about the ability to achieve goals, not about the coherence of those goals}, {Conflicting objectives do not negate a person's freedom if they still have the ability to pursue any of their goals}, {The intuition that conflicting objectives undermine freedom can be explained by confusion between freedom and coherence}

649d1338-b949-444c-aadc-5b7ab3c06e1f.summary: Rejecting the intuition that conflicting objectives negate freedom
649d1338-b949-444c-aadc-5b7ab3c06e1f.content: {It is false that conflicting objectives inherently negate a person's freedom}, {Freedom is about the ability to pursue goals, not the absence of conflict among those goals}, {A person can be free even if they have conflicting objectives, as long as they can pursue any of them effectively}

446df11f-0d6a-4c3b-b088-183ccd0d4116.summary: Supplementing with a focus on prioritization
446df11f-0d6a-4c3b-b088-183ccd0d4116.content: {Freedom includes the ability to prioritize among conflicting objectives}, {Pragmatic Liberty can accommodate conflicting objectives by emphasizing the ability to choose which goals to pursue}, {The presence of conflicting objectives does not undermine freedom if the person can effectively prioritize and pursue selected goals}

7a3374c9-1146-4f2f-8700-90e70e9c5313.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free only if they can pursue non-trivial objectives}

b0b9cd0f-fbb1-4529-89d1-0e578bb285cf.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if their objectives are significant and meaningful}

2e3959a3-b858-45b0-9ab5-532c684ebc90.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they can pursue a hierarchy of objectives, including significant ones}

8881a006-eb5d-4997-a8a1-2e7f8d244ab4.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they can pursue objectives that contribute to their well-being}

6fbf3f03-c5ae-4ab7-930f-e8c3f34ec772.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if their objectives align with their values and aspirations}

dd6b37a6-4fa3-4dfe-8aab-ec628995a131.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they can pursue a comprehensive range of objectives, including significant ones}

437182a0-0253-4b79-a834-b2fe3186fb24.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if their objectives serve a purposeful and meaningful end}

416f65c2-8a92-4a71-976f-c9a66bebdcfb.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if their objectives are meaningful within their social and personal context}

c4387662-1e97-40ed-a4f1-1a3c1e7c638d.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they can balance trivial and significant objectives}

8db074d8-d6b0-4539-b80f-0348af987c30.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they can pursue objectives that have personal or societal significance}

fe95b8a9-76c4-4f83-b473-f9dfa7dd1f81.summary: Distinguishing between trivial and significant objectives
fe95b8a9-76c4-4f83-b473-f9dfa7dd1f81.content: {There is a distinction between trivial and significant objectives}, {Pragmatic Liberty is concerned with the ability to pursue significant objectives rather than trivial ones}, {A person is free in the sense of Pragmatic Liberty if they can pursue significant objectives, even if they can also pursue trivial ones}, {The intuition that pursuing only trivial objectives limits freedom can be explained by misunderstanding the focus on significant objectives}

a2a5eb40-f944-4377-a951-43d261c1c0b6.summary: Rejecting the intuition that trivial objectives limit freedom
a2a5eb40-f944-4377-a951-43d261c1c0b6.content: {It is mistaken to claim that pursuing only trivial objectives means a person is not free}, {Freedom in the sense of Pragmatic Liberty is about the ability to achieve any objectives, regardless of their perceived significance}, {The perception of an objective as trivial does not inherently limit a person's freedom}

7b549eb5-70c7-4f68-9461-897e866f538e.content: {Freedom involves the ability to pursue objectives that are valued by the individual}, {The significance of an objective is determined by the individual's values and goals}, {A person is free if they can pursue objectives that they personally value, even if others see them as trivial}

c1f39bee-32ae-45c4-92de-9924535454ca.content: {Freedom is the ability to act in accordance with one's true self}, {A person is free if they can pursue their rational and authentic desires}, {External constraints do not diminish freedom if they align with rational self-governance}

a50514a1-ba3e-4507-89ef-663cb786db67.content: {Freedom is the capability to achieve valuable functionings}, {A person is free if they have the genuine opportunity to achieve what they value}, {External constraints are relevant if they limit the capability to achieve valuable outcomes}

e8e0fd52-3091-4ae8-b7c5-0010f884d98b.content: {Freedom is the capacity for autonomous decision-making}, {A person is free if they can make decisions based on their own values and reasoning}, {External constraints affect freedom if they undermine autonomous decision-making}

52c873fa-037e-4015-9e44-33dc12f06293.content: {Freedom is having a range of valuable options to choose from}, {A person is free if they have access to a variety of meaningful choices}, {External constraints reduce freedom if they limit the range of valuable options}

bab56cc5-9e41-4c1c-be21-b4e0f3867c26.content: {Freedom is defined by social and relational contexts}, {A person is free if their social relationships support their ability to pursue goals}, {External constraints are significant if they arise from oppressive social structures}

dcf131d9-45b8-4a64-8ca4-e81af4f9675b.content: {Freedom is context-dependent and varies with circumstances}, {A person is free if their context allows for effective goal pursuit}, {External constraints are relevant if they alter the context in a way that hinders goal achievement}

5e22de9f-0a6f-4042-b165-7949e981c994.content: {Freedom is a means to achieve well-being}, {A person is free if their freedom contributes to their overall well-being}, {External constraints matter if they negatively impact well-being through restricted freedom}

26f0763f-d7ba-4fe2-b997-f815d8d55113.content: {Freedom is the ability to realize one's potential}, {A person is free if they can develop and express their inherent capabilities}, {External constraints are relevant if they prevent self-realization}

839ac784-bbf1-4679-a722-7a61c0cda6d9.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {A person is free if they are not subject to arbitrary interference}, {External constraints are significant if they result from domination}

5160ac70-f755-435b-a36e-c478426bf6e4.content: {Freedom is the ability to act in accordance with moral principles}, {A person is free if they can pursue morally justified goals}, {External constraints affect freedom if they prevent moral action}

dfa6eff1-c9af-4ac1-b7ac-3808f5d60585.summary: Distinguishing between practical ability and external constraints
dfa6eff1-c9af-4ac1-b7ac-3808f5d60585.content: {There is a distinction between practical ability and the presence of external constraints}, {Pragmatic Liberty is a theory about practical ability rather than the absence of external constraints}, {A person can be considered free in the sense of having practical ability even if external constraints exist}, {The intuition that external constraints limit freedom can be explained as a confusion between practical ability and the absence of constraints}

5cca4561-5400-4b2f-b8a7-fee225cd22dc.summary: Rejecting the intuition that external constraints negate freedom
5cca4561-5400-4b2f-b8a7-fee225cd22dc.content: {It is false that external constraints necessarily negate a person's freedom}, {Freedom as pragmatic liberty focuses on the ability to achieve goals despite constraints}, {The presence of external constraints does not inherently prevent the effective pursuit of objectives}

68b26f5e-9ed5-4846-b97b-70ddec4421ad.summary: Supplementing with a focus on goal achievement
68b26f5e-9ed5-4846-b97b-70ddec4421ad.content: {Freedom involves the ability to achieve goals despite external constraints}, {Pragmatic Liberty can include the assumption that freedom is about overcoming constraints}, {The presence of external constraints does not preclude freedom if goals can still be achieved}

7cabeecb-a50e-451b-973b-840b2c8b4ef8.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they can change their objectives}

c630e937-f9b0-4d4c-9d68-dc03a1648329.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they can revise their objectives over time}

c9ecb7b2-8082-4e77-981b-beb74290a46c.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they can adapt their objectives to new information}

baaf1ec2-c2f8-4ff8-885c-570ebdfe48d7.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they can reflect on and alter their objectives}

d5abe75d-ecc2-4dd9-8b6f-73b897024557.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they have the volition to change their objectives}

5e6fb890-9c99-4088-ab58-4ec252a3cc90.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they have autonomy over their objectives}

a31876b0-6660-4a22-9ecc-95ff6d439bf8.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they can self-determine their objectives}

8ac100c6-1ea9-4667-ae10-3f9883f045fc.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they have flexibility in choosing their objectives}

deeb121b-07d6-4b40-82b2-7792e3a017c7.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they can transform their objectives}

e21a7329-6eb3-4f86-ab0f-479cb387bf1d.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they can revise their goals}

3a6da418-9b11-46e2-be0e-b12245f3d3a2.content: {There is a distinction between freedom to achieve goals and freedom to change goals}, {Pragmatic Liberty is concerned with the freedom to achieve goals, not the freedom to change them}, {A person can be free in the sense of achieving goals even if they cannot change their objectives}, {The intuition that inability to change objectives undermines freedom can be explained by conflating different types of freedom}

df88bd78-bc1d-45ec-837d-52382cb303e1.summary: Rejecting the intuition that freedom requires changing objectives
df88bd78-bc1d-45ec-837d-52382cb303e1.content: {It is mistaken to think that freedom necessarily includes the ability to change objectives}, {Freedom as the ability to achieve goals is a meaningful and sufficient form of freedom}, {The inability to change objectives does not negate the practical ability to pursue and achieve existing goals}

57e2edba-556f-4d59-aec1-a416048294b7.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of internal motivation
57e2edba-556f-4d59-aec1-a416048294b7.content: {Assume that internal motivation aligns with current objectives}, {A person is free if their internal motivations support their ability to achieve their goals}, {The inability to change objectives does not affect freedom if internal motivations are aligned with those objectives}

1b0840b4-24a7-4e1d-aca2-d61d3d6e9b6e.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they can reflect on their objectives}

10582a81-ea54-42d2-ad8d-94b804829335.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they have autonomy over their objectives}

5ccd997e-b0c8-4a9f-abec-b0236dc5b480.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they can rationally evaluate their objectives}

a081e80f-3d01-4e8e-b8c6-9f6836c06447.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they are conscious of their objectives}

e9d70ea6-634e-408b-918f-256418ea9a5c.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they can deliberate about their objectives}

ecb779ac-4213-4f2d-a542-8a84f6bf1125.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they are self-aware of their objectives}

e6457459-63ec-466c-b64a-8968782a1fca.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they can form intentions regarding their objectives}

d55441c2-e5f1-4a06-b0ad-ebfb6cf75908.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they can evaluate the worth of their objectives}

1d5feb68-170a-44e3-bcf4-19a82565df74.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they are cognitively engaged with their objectives}

5389bd29-22c3-49df-9074-37f878c94bfc.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they can reflect on the nature of their goals}

42fbe44a-6434-4957-9c03-a5d0d43e59bf.summary: Distinguishing between practical and reflective freedom
42fbe44a-6434-4957-9c03-a5d0d43e59bf.content: {There is a distinction between practical freedom and reflective freedom}, {Pragmatic Liberty is a theory about practical freedom rather than reflective freedom}, {A person who can achieve their goals has practical freedom even if they lack reflective freedom}, {The intuition that someone is not free without reflection can be explained as a confusion between practical and reflective freedom}

e2a10b38-f89f-41db-ae64-0d8259f296e6.summary: Rejecting the necessity of reflection for freedom
e2a10b38-f89f-41db-ae64-0d8259f296e6.content: {It is false that the ability to reflect on objectives is necessary for freedom}, {Freedom is determined by the ability to achieve goals, not by the ability to reflect on them}, {The intuition that reflection is necessary for freedom is mistaken}

90f7bf92-c955-4bde-95a8-2ddc7253cf63.summary: Supplementing with a capacity for minimal reflection
90f7bf92-c955-4bde-95a8-2ddc7253cf63.content: {A supplementary assumption is that minimal reflection is sufficient for freedom}, {Pragmatic Liberty can include a basic capacity for reflection as part of the ability to achieve goals}, {With this assumption, the objection loses its force as the person retains freedom}

fbee7b7a-372f-4315-9abe-4dd38ebe3402.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they have the rational capacity to control their impulses}

cf09892a-9833-4a23-8010-cee3eec592ab.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if their desires and actions are aligned with their long-term goals}

9892fb85-6ea4-4164-a9a6-a4ba93fa1e93.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they possess self-regulation to manage their impulses}

3c440497-eaea-472c-b7ef-1adfc1f0d18e.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they can set and follow through on their own goals}

e704491a-7e79-41fb-9a2b-b0d3c46cf2d8.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they can reflect on and endorse their motivations}

708fe93b-2ea9-422b-a370-8307a80da261.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they can deliberate and choose among different courses of action}

13581892-e1b8-4f61-8286-864f00fa6635.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they have control over their volitions and impulses}

c1c0fb13-5f47-41ae-9e9b-8301b23a2d7b.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if their intentions are harmonized with their actions}

dffe5c0e-4e99-44d1-a052-d3128a40fcea.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they can act in accordance with a self-determined purpose}

3381f897-a3d5-413c-92c3-29829a7ed2ff.content: {Freedom is the practical ability to achieve goals}, {A person is free if they can effectively pursue their objectives}, {A person is free if they can determine their own actions and decisions}

41d4582e-3526-405b-9c5c-f67e20d1d3cf.summary: Distinguishing between practical ability and self-control
41d4582e-3526-405b-9c5c-f67e20d1d3cf.content: {There is a distinction between practical ability and self-control}, {Pragmatic Liberty is a theory about practical ability rather than self-control}, {A lack of self-control does not negate the presence of practical ability}, {The intuition that someone lacking self-control is unfree can be explained as a confusion between practical ability and self-control}

9537e64b-d6e4-48d0-a8a9-6b60bac3eaa6.summary: Rejecting the intuition that self-control is necessary for freedom
9537e64b-d6e4-48d0-a8a9-6b60bac3eaa6.content: {It is false that a lack of self-control negates freedom in the context of Pragmatic Liberty}, {Freedom is defined by the ability to achieve goals, not by the presence of self-control}, {The appearance of lacking freedom due to self-control issues is a misunderstanding of the concept of freedom as practical ability}

490a4282-ba1c-4462-91ef-9a057ca3de87.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of internal constraints
490a4282-ba1c-4462-91ef-9a057ca3de87.content: {Internal constraints such as self-control are separate from external practical abilities}, {Pragmatic Liberty focuses on external practical abilities, not internal constraints}, {The objection loses its force when considering that internal constraints do not affect the external practical ability to achieve goals}

cfa60d19-baec-4364-b0f4-c4e4ba4302fd.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if all individual members are free from coercion and oppression}

5fbed891-a2c4-441c-9fa5-0e8922f935ba.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free if the majority of its members consent to the political and social structures}

b343f965-2578-4fc4-841c-4b7dd72dc467.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if individual members have autonomy in personal decisions}

bbb727bd-9755-436a-bad3-3a5b4e4f5205.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if all members have equal opportunity to participate in decision-making}

60994677-b101-4f55-92f1-56c3f619a554.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if no member is dominated by others within the group}

c7dc1147-f1ba-4fc4-a1c5-8a2cf502510e.summary: Collective Liberty with Individual Rights Protection
c7dc1147-f1ba-4fc4-a1c5-8a2cf502510e.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if individual rights are protected within the group}

c05a9474-d008-4d1d-abbe-3fb72a917668.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if it is governed democratically by its members}

1805eca8-f590-403f-91d4-2966fcaff424.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if there are safeguards to protect minority interests within the group}

fc417c27-f36d-4edd-a891-c31329fa02a2.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if decision-making processes are transparent and open to scrutiny}

40da1420-cd8a-474d-b872-e862661b202e.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if membership in the group is voluntary}

035383f3-41a4-482e-b784-bcfdbbb3e8b9.summary: Distinguishing between group and individual freedom
035383f3-41a4-482e-b784-bcfdbbb3e8b9.content: {There is a distinction between group freedom and individual freedom}, {Collective liberty is concerned with the freedom of the group as a whole, not the freedom of individual members}, {A group can be free in determining its structures even if some individuals within it are not free}, {The intuition that a group cannot be free if individuals are not free is a confusion between collective and individual freedom}

d7db33aa-dc78-4f3e-a089-403493f067bf.summary: Rejecting the necessity of individual freedom for collective freedom
d7db33aa-dc78-4f3e-a089-403493f067bf.content: {It is false that individual freedom is necessary for collective freedom}, {Collective liberty is achieved when a group can self-determine its structures, regardless of individual member freedom}, {The presence of coercion or oppression of some members does not negate the group's ability to self-determine}

e9148ab0-4f1e-4d9f-8ebb-10491126a243.summary: Supplementing with the concept of representative freedom
e9148ab0-4f1e-4d9f-8ebb-10491126a243.content: {Collective liberty can be understood through the concept of representative freedom}, {A group is free if its decision-making processes represent the will of the majority or its legitimate representatives}, {Individual freedom is not required for collective freedom if the group's decisions reflect the collective will}

c15d1c66-8df5-43a1-b254-fef2d9759ca3.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if all members have an equal opportunity to participate in decision-making}

e18a594e-21d0-46b1-8a6d-051c5ad8648f.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if decision-making processes are based on open and rational deliberation among all members}

3e607153-f741-4d1c-b74f-b326ac36e3cf.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if decisions are made by consensus, ensuring all voices are heard}

27509636-6e6b-4f86-84ef-c9781dfbacf3.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if it ensures equal representation of all subgroups in decision-making}

b025d6d1-641d-4529-8a3f-15d7c876d547.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if it maximizes participation from all members in decision-making processes}

78a2bce1-76f4-4d58-a7de-b56c3d9c2ea4.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if it actively includes minority voices in decision-making}

61be5493-9fbe-4698-8d6e-27f1bf575f7d.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if it operates under democratic principles that protect minority rights}

272119fe-b26b-4950-b4ed-2fb2c29920a2.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if it balances majority rule with protections for minority participation}

9a691594-28e8-4967-85f4-09d3ef6f0bee.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if decision-making processes are fair and transparent to all members}

987371e1-a8fc-40e5-a70c-1fd08ef44814.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if it ensures equitable participation and influence for all members}

aeab7342-ee6c-4b10-83c4-301616eadc4b.summary: Distinguishing between collective and individual freedom
aeab7342-ee6c-4b10-83c4-301616eadc4b.content: {There is a distinction between collective freedom and individual freedom}, {Collective liberty focuses on the freedom of the group as a whole, not necessarily on the freedom of each individual member}, {A group can be collectively free even if some individuals within the group are not free}, {The exclusion of minority voices does not negate the collective self-determination of the group as a whole}

b32772f0-82ae-43fd-8891-855547d72f81.summary: Rejecting the intuition that exclusion negates freedom
b32772f0-82ae-43fd-8891-855547d72f81.content: {It is mistaken to assume that the exclusion of minority voices inherently negates the freedom of the group}, {Collective self-determination is about the process and outcome of group decision-making, not the inclusion of every individual voice}, {The intuition that exclusion negates freedom is based on a misunderstanding of collective liberty}

9c056990-c357-4a12-b0db-9568432151f6.summary: Supplementing with a principle of procedural fairness
9c056990-c357-4a12-b0db-9568432151f6.content: {A supplementary assumption is that collective self-determination requires a fair decision-making process}, {A fair process can include mechanisms to ensure minority voices are heard without requiring unanimous agreement}, {With procedural fairness, the objection that exclusion negates freedom loses its force}

deeaf6e8-7039-4a89-9ab9-7457eff14435.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures without external manipulation}, {External manipulation includes propaganda and economic pressure}

ea221ee2-31c5-4cbe-ae83-4fb51cee84be.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures autonomously}, {Autonomy requires the absence of significant external influence}

d02c79ff-1871-4978-a663-b58278360a9d.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free if it has mechanisms to resist external manipulation}

01eea99d-42ac-49f9-9c4c-9f0f9fcd0918.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free if its decisions reflect authentic preferences uninfluenced by external forces}

f65102ff-cd9c-4691-8647-5d6d6d5ddea5.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures independently}, {Independence requires freedom from external coercion and manipulation}

3d5d35c1-ddeb-417e-9c45-f44dac227018.content: {There is a distinction between genuine self-determination and decision-making under manipulation}, {Collective liberty concerns genuine self-determination, not decisions made under manipulation}, {A group is not truly determining its own structures if its decisions are the result of manipulation}, {The intuition that a manipulated group is not free aligns with the distinction between genuine and manipulated decision-making}

de210af3-6ea0-470b-a05d-201d4bcd51c6.summary: Rejecting the intuition that external influence negates freedom
de210af3-6ea0-470b-a05d-201d4bcd51c6.content: {It is mistaken to claim that any external influence negates a group's freedom}, {A group can still be free if it has the capacity to critically assess and resist external influences}, {The presence of external influences does not automatically undermine a group's ability to self-determine}

c085e91c-3e90-49c6-a30a-e1862e6dec44.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of critical awareness
c085e91c-3e90-49c6-a30a-e1862e6dec44.content: {A group is assumed to have critical awareness of external influences}, {With critical awareness, a group can identify and resist manipulation}, {The assumption of critical awareness allows a group to maintain freedom despite external pressures}

d27ef40a-54aa-4226-866f-b6637b494146.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {Individual autonomy is a necessary condition for the collective self-determination of a group}

88485610-7b43-4b35-b823-d55083b0b572.summary: Collective Liberty with Majority Rule and Individual Rights
88485610-7b43-4b35-b823-d55083b0b572.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {The determination of political and social structures must respect individual rights}

e47a6ab7-9257-499d-80b2-e31f398eb078.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {Participatory democracy is necessary for the collective self-determination of a group}

acd304b1-debb-4f1c-8ef6-b8e2e29e35be.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {Consensus decision-making is necessary for the collective self-determination of a group}

c3c14449-2139-4413-9392-9885857b3ae3.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {Deliberative democracy is necessary for the collective self-determination of a group}

bff00825-0ee0-4015-b8be-5161a16531dd.summary: Distinguishing between collective and individual freedom
bff00825-0ee0-4015-b8be-5161a16531dd.content: {There is a distinction between collective freedom and individual freedom}, {Collective liberty is concerned with the self-determination of the group as a whole, not individual autonomy}, {A group can be free in the collective sense even if individual autonomy is not fully realized}, {The objection confuses the concept of collective liberty with individual freedom}

9516b224-c964-4f73-9be2-cc89cdf240e3.summary: Rejecting the necessity of individual autonomy for collective freedom
9516b224-c964-4f73-9be2-cc89cdf240e3.content: {It is false that individual autonomy is necessary for collective freedom}, {Collective liberty can exist independently of the level of individual autonomy within the group}, {The ability of a group to determine its own structures does not require that each member has autonomous choice}

9f770794-73fa-45f8-814d-a6d7c0144a2f.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of democratic processes
9f770794-73fa-45f8-814d-a6d7c0144a2f.content: {Democratic processes can ensure that collective decisions reflect the will of the group}, {The presence of democratic processes can mitigate concerns about individual autonomy}, {With democratic processes, the group’s self-determination aligns with the collective will, even if individual autonomy is limited}

6bdfc24d-fe7c-42fe-a19f-c7394c21d429.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if it has a significant level of internal consensus}

461cc770-e5f2-4b29-8c3f-1ec28eb1d4bb.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free if decisions are made by majority rule, even if there is some internal disagreement}

5b9e60b9-29e6-4e73-af61-01b22a271b2e.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free if it engages in deliberative democratic processes to reach decisions}

dec7dc1a-690b-4109-bf98-b111551fefd3.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free if it uses proportional representation to ensure diverse views are included in decision-making}

de054735-64be-46b1-a741-db704e648b99.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free if it actively engages in consensus-building efforts to address internal disagreements}

59ca4cf0-06a6-422a-9fa6-cbdbcbd42af7.summary: Distinguishing between collective and individual freedom
59ca4cf0-06a6-422a-9fa6-cbdbcbd42af7.content: {There is a distinction between collective freedom and individual freedom}, {Collective liberty concerns the ability of a group to make decisions as a whole, regardless of internal disagreements}, {A group can be free in the collective sense even if individual members disagree with the decisions made}, {The intuition that a group is not free due to internal division confuses collective freedom with individual freedom}

e78a730f-b739-4692-9a10-c390f79a1e82.summary: Rejecting the intuition that consensus is necessary for freedom
e78a730f-b739-4692-9a10-c390f79a1e82.content: {It is false that a group must have internal consensus to be free}, {Freedom as collective self-determination does not require unanimity among members}, {A group can be free if it has mechanisms to make decisions and implement them, even in the presence of disagreement}, {The presence of disagreement does not inherently undermine the group's ability to determine its own structures}

3f5c012e-f280-46f3-ba24-06511c6b4ffa.summary: Supplementing with a procedural account of freedom
3f5c012e-f280-46f3-ba24-06511c6b4ffa.content: {Freedom can be understood in terms of fair and inclusive decision-making processes}, {A group is free if it has established procedures that allow for participation and representation of its members}, {Internal disagreement does not negate freedom if the group has legitimate processes for resolving conflicts}, {The appearance of a lack of freedom due to division is mitigated by the presence of fair decision-making procedures}

344a71a8-53e0-4a65-b3c7-84317edaa672.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if there is equality among its members in terms of participation in decision-making}

a176c8ea-fe0c-4c4d-ad6c-7b24ab6e41cd.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if all members have equal opportunity to participate in decision-making processes}

e4867388-4d92-4299-b6ec-1b14a0ea4aaf.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if all members have equal influence over the determination of political and social structures}

540574a1-fe72-4300-89a6-1e4a217d755d.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if all members are fairly represented in decision-making processes}

d27e0835-8a6a-493a-bf4a-5ea1665af5aa.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if decision-making processes are inclusive of all members}

a1349219-ae45-4e4f-853c-4ab237d2d705.summary: Collective Liberty with Equal Access to Resources
a1349219-ae45-4e4f-853c-4ab237d2d705.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if all members have equal access to resources necessary for participation in decision-making}

eb9672ac-6ee6-42cb-a276-23117d38a872.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if democratic equality is maintained among its members}

16acff03-d921-4355-b857-67d3f5ec8587.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if no member is dominated by others in decision-making processes}

fac6e35d-f344-4843-ae1b-6bc1a4d5c111.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if each member has an equal voice in decision-making}

c74b31e1-9423-4c9c-91ac-85b586da823d.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if participatory parity is ensured among all members}

e07d4873-6cee-4d92-a987-ab7fb76c8216.summary: Distinguishing between collective liberty and individual equality
e07d4873-6cee-4d92-a987-ab7fb76c8216.content: {There is a distinction between collective liberty and individual equality.}, {Collective liberty pertains to the group's ability to self-determine its structures, not the equality of its members.}, {A group can be collectively free even if individual members experience inequality.}, {The intuition that inequality undermines freedom confuses individual freedom with collective liberty.}

7ab1b7a6-2f61-4296-9b50-05c9c6126f60.summary: Rejecting the intuition that inequality undermines collective liberty
7ab1b7a6-2f61-4296-9b50-05c9c6126f60.content: {It is mistaken to think that inequality among members necessarily undermines collective liberty.}, {Collective liberty is about the group's self-determination, not the internal distribution of power or resources.}, {The presence of inequality does not inherently prevent a group from determining its own structures.}

cf8c007c-6446-4d72-bdb4-0791753d76e9.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of procedural fairness
cf8c007c-6446-4d72-bdb4-0791753d76e9.content: {Procedural fairness can ensure that all members have a voice in the group's self-determination.}, {Collective liberty can be maintained if decision-making processes are fair, even if outcomes are unequal.}, {The appearance of inequality undermining freedom can be addressed by ensuring fair procedures in collective decision-making.}

f231cbc5-7f72-4100-b20e-06c076598a56.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if it is aware of its true interests}

03e5aba3-39f8-4162-a196-8d0054303d63.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if it uses rational deliberation to identify its interests}

7ba64337-b9a1-4d75-b93c-5be3a42855c3.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if it has access to reliable information about its interests}

604658ab-08bd-42f8-9849-e8c108d1e022.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if its decisions reflect its authentic interests}

25d48991-64e3-41d5-89c8-9a989c256bd1.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if it engages in reflective consideration of its interests}

8f218f60-a330-4eae-b45a-dbe24e893d4f.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if it engages in open and inclusive deliberation about its interests}

c50c858e-ddd5-449e-bd29-7212ee2329a4.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if its decision-making processes are transparent and informed}

58b3bc53-bb9e-4caf-bc4b-a805ef8f7d9d.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if all members can participate in identifying and pursuing their interests}

06bd1bd9-ee92-4c77-904b-fdb3c44e420e.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if it critically examines the sources of its beliefs about its interests}

9d1bc75f-3046-4cdf-8844-c7704634e847.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if it has the power to act on its true interests}

055c9e3f-eb46-4b8d-bde6-2de28d7c479e.summary: Distinguishing between self-determination and awareness of interests
055c9e3f-eb46-4b8d-bde6-2de28d7c479e.content: {There is a distinction between self-determination and awareness of interests}, {Collective liberty concerns the ability of a group to determine its structures, not its awareness of interests}, {A group can be free in determining its structures even if it lacks awareness of its true interests}, {The intuition that a group is not free without awareness can be explained by conflating self-determination with interest awareness}

86aeaa6c-46b6-4bd2-b242-8b07b1ced2b5.summary: Rejecting the necessity of interest awareness for freedom
86aeaa6c-46b6-4bd2-b242-8b07b1ced2b5.content: {It is false that awareness of true interests is necessary for a group to be free}, {Freedom as collective self-determination does not require accurate knowledge of interests}, {A group can exercise freedom by choosing its structures, regardless of its awareness of interests}

94176b16-9af9-4489-8f49-c0673f467f80.summary: Supplementing with a procedural account of freedom
94176b16-9af9-4489-8f49-c0673f467f80.content: {Freedom can be understood as a procedural concept, focusing on the process of decision-making}, {A group is free if it follows fair and inclusive decision-making procedures, regardless of awareness of interests}, {The objection loses force if freedom is seen as procedural rather than substantive}

26807712-0425-4584-bc7e-9f4ce0ee33ab.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if it does not employ coercive practices to maintain order or achieve goals}

02dbcdb0-825e-40c8-b04b-bc907c59da77.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if all members have equal participation in decision-making processes}

76bc1a32-0c89-48b4-a4f1-a3010669a37f.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if compliance with rules and structures is voluntary}

386f1520-7385-41eb-97d4-d1ca27a5fee8.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if decisions are made through consensus rather than coercion}

f54b810b-3aa4-4d0a-9271-d6e6c8a5a759.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if no member or subgroup dominates others}

fac9e2af-ad02-4e2c-ba4b-27b8493a934a.summary: Collective Liberty with Respect for Individual Autonomy
fac9e2af-ad02-4e2c-ba4b-27b8493a934a.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if it respects the autonomy of individual members}

a8e6a83f-c6d5-41f2-9cc9-c4bfb7818ec4.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if its governance structures are transparent and accountable}

c4693a73-6acf-4182-b5d6-065d31d2cc2e.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if all members have equal opportunity to influence decisions}

6cd76479-fa49-4fea-b920-f6e9caa7f3d9.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if it protects the rights of all its members}

c8296913-b49d-4422-b9f3-273238dbc97c.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free only if it accommodates diverse perspectives and practices}

87b83514-ad43-40aa-acfa-43151cd3db05.summary: Distinguishing between internal and external freedom
87b83514-ad43-40aa-acfa-43151cd3db05.content: {There is a distinction between internal freedom and external freedom}, {Collective liberty concerns external freedom, which is about a group's ability to determine its own structures without external interference}, {Internal freedom, which involves the absence of coercion within the group, is a separate issue from collective liberty}, {A group can be externally free even if it employs coercive practices internally}

3f148d48-7cf2-4b92-be76-2e1bdfad7c54.summary: Rejecting the intuition that coercion negates freedom
3f148d48-7cf2-4b92-be76-2e1bdfad7c54.content: {It is mistaken to assume that coercion within a group necessarily negates its freedom}, {A group's freedom is defined by its ability to self-determine its structures, not by the absence of internal coercion}, {The presence of coercion does not inherently undermine the group's collective liberty as long as the group as a whole can self-determine}

0cedb4ce-931e-46ef-996a-593252b9f6d4.summary: Supplementing with a principle of collective consent
0cedb4ce-931e-46ef-996a-593252b9f6d4.content: {Collective liberty can be supplemented with the principle of collective consent}, {A group is free if its members collectively consent to the political and social structures, even if coercion is used to maintain order}, {The use of coercion is compatible with freedom if it is part of a collectively agreed-upon system}

1c4f5e68-f6b6-462e-a9ea-f4cace1bf09e.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free if it is recognized as legitimate by other groups or institutions}

0ca3a273-fb74-4294-9f92-0abaf9b44472.summary: Collective Liberty with Internal and External Legitimacy
0ca3a273-fb74-4294-9f92-0abaf9b44472.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free if it is recognized as legitimate by its own members and by other groups or institutions}

609509e8-461a-4ba0-a94b-3cded49c34db.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free if it recognizes other groups and is recognized by them in return}

efb8419c-4657-4271-a1a7-42edf658c218.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free if it is endorsed by established institutions}

3d332f05-e1dc-45ae-863f-6a26225fde6c.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group is free if it is acknowledged by the global community}

9c87df65-4fd6-4e71-966f-edaea145a34c.summary: Distinguishing between internal and external recognition
9c87df65-4fd6-4e71-966f-edaea145a34c.content: {There is a distinction between internal and external recognition of a group's freedom}, {Collective liberty is concerned with internal self-determination rather than external recognition}, {A group's freedom is not diminished by lack of external recognition if it can still determine its own structures internally}, {The intuition that a group is unfree without external recognition can be explained as a confusion between internal and external aspects of freedom}

42f6609e-03a2-40d7-93a0-324ba42ea2a3.summary: Rejecting the necessity of external recognition for freedom
42f6609e-03a2-40d7-93a0-324ba42ea2a3.content: {It is false that a group must be recognized by others to be free}, {Freedom as collective self-determination does not require external validation}, {A group's ability to determine its own structures is sufficient for its freedom, regardless of external recognition}

082bd028-1262-47c5-a0cb-1ea075dad1fe.summary: Supplementing with the concept of moral autonomy
082bd028-1262-47c5-a0cb-1ea075dad1fe.content: {Moral autonomy is the capacity to govern oneself according to one's own principles}, {A group can possess moral autonomy even without external recognition}, {The lack of external recognition does not undermine a group's moral autonomy and thus does not negate its freedom}

bf0e4104-7887-47df-bb30-b83922cc014d.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group requires a shared purpose to exercise collective self-determination}

281cec0f-c9ff-47a7-8edf-6ed537208e10.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group requires procedural consensus among its members to exercise collective self-determination}

1452939a-78e3-4833-8d0e-ab04826c99c0.summary: Collective Liberty with Minimal Shared Values
1452939a-78e3-4833-8d0e-ab04826c99c0.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group requires minimal shared values to exercise collective self-determination}

c59d8900-eb8f-47ae-9c73-ab98874abf18.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group can have a dynamic identity that evolves over time to exercise collective self-determination}

927de9cf-dc28-4855-b2a9-c8f764c443b4.content: {Freedom is the collective self-determination of a group}, {A group is free if it can determine its own political and social structures}, {A group requires deliberative democratic processes to exercise collective self-determination}

96a72413-c567-4872-9c7c-374540716366.summary: Distinguishing between collective decision-making and shared identity
96a72413-c567-4872-9c7c-374540716366.content: {There is a distinction between collective decision-making and having a shared identity}, {Collective liberty is concerned with the ability of a group to make decisions, not with whether the group has a shared identity}, {A group can exercise collective self-determination without a unifying identity or purpose}, {The intuition that a group is not free without a shared identity can be explained by conflating decision-making capacity with identity}

c280fa71-1f9c-4e84-b465-30599876128c.summary: Rejecting the necessity of shared identity for collective liberty
c280fa71-1f9c-4e84-b465-30599876128c.content: {It is false that a shared identity is necessary for a group to exercise collective liberty}, {Collective liberty is about the process of self-determination, not the presence of a shared identity}, {A group can determine its political and social structures through democratic processes without a common identity}

e6113a5e-4038-426b-89bd-9a45efbca3d8.summary: Supplementing with the concept of procedural unity
e6113a5e-4038-426b-89bd-9a45efbca3d8.content: {Procedural unity refers to the agreement on decision-making processes rather than shared identity}, {Collective liberty can be achieved through procedural unity, where members agree on how decisions are made}, {The lack of a shared identity does not undermine collective liberty if procedural unity is present}

52df54ac-22f6-4f56-9dfc-b5a2e4c6821a.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self}, {A person is free if they can develop and express their authentic self}, {Freedom requires the absence of external constraints that prevent self-realization}

6d6ed441-7e4e-46df-8504-37e1b0fb53b8.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self}, {A person is free if they can develop and express their authentic self}, {Freedom involves the absence of external constraints that significantly hinder self-realization}

8ebf4fb6-195f-46db-a270-df19683499ee.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self}, {A person is free if they can develop and express their authentic self}, {Freedom is conditional on the absence of significant external constraints}

cf41042c-e347-4d31-ba29-e550a5c89f94.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self}, {A person is free if they can develop and express their authentic self}, {Freedom includes the absence of external constraints that impede self-expression}

3b1f91bd-3d52-4fe1-b821-cdf8e9a93322.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self}, {A person is free if they can develop and express their authentic self}, {Freedom requires awareness and mitigation of external constraints}

9facb9ec-c888-40ad-bb46-06d97acaeaf6.summary: Distinguishing between internal and external freedom
9facb9ec-c888-40ad-bb46-06d97acaeaf6.content: {There is a distinction between internal freedom and external freedom}, {Self-realization liberty is a theory about internal freedom rather than external freedom}, {External constraints are relevant to external freedom but not to internal freedom}, {A person can be internally free by realizing their true self even if external constraints exist}, {The objection confuses internal freedom with external freedom}

7f3a179f-d6a5-4cbc-a10e-02bea2f07437.summary: Rejecting the irrelevance of external constraints
