7f3a179f-d6a5-4cbc-a10e-02bea2f07437.content: {It is false that external constraints are irrelevant to freedom}, {Self-realization liberty includes the idea that external constraints can hinder the development of one's true self}, {Freedom as self-realization acknowledges that external conditions can impact one's ability to express their authentic self}, {The objection misinterprets the role of external constraints in self-realization liberty}

e34b2d7e-5ea9-4bf8-8d59-bedebe527939.summary: Supplementing with the concept of enabling conditions
e34b2d7e-5ea9-4bf8-8d59-bedebe527939.content: {Freedom as self-realization requires certain enabling conditions}, {Enabling conditions include the absence of significant external constraints}, {External constraints are relevant insofar as they affect the enabling conditions for self-realization}, {The objection overlooks the role of enabling conditions in the theory of self-realization liberty}

b686c2e7-cdf5-4e8b-9d8b-47d1b4c5de08.content: {Freedom is the capacity for self-direction}, {A person is free if they can make autonomous choices}, {Autonomy requires the ability to reflect on and revise one's desires}

a3c7345a-1f85-4e36-a416-e305120abdcb.content: {Freedom is the expression of one's values}, {A person is free if they can act in accordance with their deeply held values}, {Values must be critically examined and chosen}

9fefeadd-e218-4850-a77d-44a58c334dcf.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's rational self}, {A person is free if they can develop and express their rational capacities}, {Rational capacities include critical thinking and self-reflection}

92390828-97f5-4be7-96a8-926af4bffcd8.content: {Freedom is the alignment of authenticity and autonomy}, {A person is free if they can express their authentic self while maintaining autonomy}, {Authenticity requires self-awareness and self-acceptance}

e7c4228e-ed5b-47e2-9f2b-d10b44a46a1f.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's reflective self}, {A person is free if they can develop and express their reflective capacities}, {Reflective capacities involve the ability to question and understand one's desires}

4af3f379-5645-4196-9bcd-fc397e11b1b2.content: {Freedom is the integration of one's desires and rational capacities}, {A person is free if they can harmonize their desires with rational reflection}, {Integration requires coherence between desires and rational deliberation}

51935c21-8224-46ee-9901-5418e179caa7.content: {Freedom is the capacity for self-determination}, {A person is free if they can determine their own path in life}, {Self-determination involves the ability to set and pursue personal goals}

a9224c78-07da-45a5-b4fc-db318c6e77d7.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's critically examined self}, {A person is free if they can develop and express their critically examined desires}, {Critical examination requires questioning and evaluating one's desires}

c4e0cbf0-1da5-4466-b29d-9176e8d0f630.content: {Freedom is the pursuit of a self-chosen purpose}, {A person is free if they can pursue a purpose they have chosen for themselves}, {Purpose must be chosen through reflection and deliberation}

cc4cc488-97a5-464d-825b-263bd86cb613.content: {Freedom is the ability to express oneself}, {A person is free if they can express their thoughts, feelings, and desires}, {Self-expression requires the opportunity to communicate and act on one's desires}

cf3d958a-a0cb-4480-af89-2af238b2b1df.content: {There is a distinction between self-realization and autonomy}, {Self-realization liberty is a theory about expressing one's authentic self, not necessarily about autonomy}, {A person who desires to be controlled may realize their true self without being autonomous}, {The intuition that such a person is not free can be explained by confusing self-realization with autonomy}

8dc68c02-8b24-4982-9d7d-78c894ca8fbb.summary: Rejecting the intuition that self-realization must lead to autonomy
8dc68c02-8b24-4982-9d7d-78c894ca8fbb.content: {It is false that self-realization always leads to autonomy}, {A person can realize their true self as someone who desires external control without being autonomous}, {The appearance of a lack of freedom in such cases does not undermine the concept of self-realization liberty}

4259b75c-f0f7-4de9-b9f2-c4b968e141a8.summary: Supplementing with a distinction between internal and external freedom
4259b75c-f0f7-4de9-b9f2-c4b968e141a8.content: {There is a distinction between internal freedom and external freedom}, {Self-realization liberty concerns internal freedom, which is about expressing one's authentic self}, {A person who desires to be controlled may lack external freedom but can still possess internal freedom}, {The objection loses its force when considering that self-realization liberty is about internal freedom}

b94043d8-e81e-4ebf-9262-978cbd8728b5.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's authentic selves}, {A person is free if they can develop and express their multiple authentic selves}

87514432-1b26-41e0-b164-e1f69715ddad.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's evolving self}, {A person is free if they can develop and express their self as it changes over time}

8420fc2d-c252-42c6-9252-006597771813.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's context-dependent self}, {A person is free if they can develop and express their self in different contexts}

7c92721e-d036-4ede-aed7-00b24a1f1657.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's narrative self}, {A person is free if they can develop and express their self through their life story}

aea8ee41-8ef7-4fe1-9b95-75fc4aa64f24.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's relational self}, {A person is free if they can develop and express their self through relationships with others}

8d36d64a-9c45-48c5-a78d-aad72351d459.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's practical self}, {A person is free if they can develop and express their self through practical engagements with the world}

94b9f399-c7b5-4f66-9d32-1588bd95f907.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's experiential self}, {A person is free if they can develop and express their self through diverse experiences}

c2e6d1a1-b52a-4abc-9426-9affec5a2e3f.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's integrated self}, {A person is free if they can develop and express a coherent integration of their multiple selves}

6d4820e4-f261-48f4-8a8a-d20e069498d1.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's adaptive self}, {A person is free if they can develop and express their self by adapting to new circumstances}

d614fe5a-1e90-4269-9a39-942ffdbe1128.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's constructed self}, {A person is free if they can develop and express their self as they construct it over time}

aced542d-62e1-443d-9b50-c47980e3ddc0.summary: Distinguishing between core and peripheral aspects of self
aced542d-62e1-443d-9b50-c47980e3ddc0.content: {There is a distinction between core and peripheral aspects of an individual's identity.}, {The concept of a "true self" refers to the core aspects of identity that are most central and enduring.}, {Conflicting desires and identities can exist at the peripheral level without undermining the coherence of a core true self.}, {The intuition that multiple true selves exist can be explained by confusion between core and peripheral aspects of identity.}

24155499-ce13-4055-863f-5aa061a39814.summary: Rejecting the necessity of a single coherent self
24155499-ce13-4055-863f-5aa061a39814.content: {It is false that a coherent "true self" must be singular and unified.}, {A person can have a coherent true self that is complex and multifaceted.}, {The presence of conflicting desires does not imply the absence of a true self but rather reflects the complexity of human identity.}, {The idea of self-realization can accommodate a multifaceted true self without losing its meaning.}

8a76abee-97eb-44f1-90a4-d0ab4c17750c.summary: Supplementing with a dynamic view of self
8a76abee-97eb-44f1-90a4-d0ab4c17750c.content: {The self is dynamic and evolves over time, rather than being a fixed entity.}, {A true self can be understood as an evolving set of authentic traits and values.}, {Conflicting desires and identities are part of the process of self-development and do not negate the existence of a true self.}, {The concept of self-realization involves the ongoing development and expression of one's evolving true self.}

546f8fde-e3af-48ad-a852-0772273c2361.content: {Freedom is the ability to choose one's own path}, {A person is free if they can make autonomous decisions}, {Autonomy requires the absence of coercion by societal norms}

ea9a95d5-4525-46db-b2ab-9b41d8299af5.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self}, {A person is free if they can develop and express their authentic self}, {Authentic self-realization can take multiple forms not dictated by societal norms}

9ffd1401-ffc2-4c6a-a77e-c59c0a39b052.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self}, {A person is free if they can develop and express their authentic self}, {The context of self-realization must allow for individual choice and diversity}

9218e7eb-b620-41dc-922e-6a730441b5fa.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self}, {A person is free if they can develop and express their authentic self}, {Self-realization must occur in a non-coercive environment}

124b88b2-72c7-457a-96f5-316959187112.content: {Freedom is the ability to pursue personal goals}, {A person is free if they can determine their own life path}, {Personal goals should not be constrained by societal expectations}

e0d80e04-8156-49ee-b9e7-c652b31d62ba.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self}, {A person is free if they can develop and express their authentic self}, {There are diverse pathways to self-realization that respect individual choice}

59585bfb-b3ba-4454-86d2-ef82eb90784e.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self}, {A person is free if they can develop and express their authentic self}, {Authenticity involves the freedom to choose among various self-realization paths}

53815d78-c98e-4553-a04d-0d53a817886f.content: {Freedom is the ability to determine one's own life course}, {A person is free if they can make self-determined choices}, {Self-determination requires freedom from societal coercion}

83e56677-b014-4d0b-a815-14cc6d4b6e54.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self}, {A person is free if they can develop and express their authentic self}, {Self-realization should be flexible and adaptable to individual preferences}

fe2f96cd-07bb-4444-9d36-56966b3d7fb3.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self}, {A person is free if they can develop and express their authentic self}, {Self-realization should not be directed by external societal norms}

362d0fcf-1427-4094-b119-8cb9af428ec0.summary: Distinguishing between authentic and imposed self-realization
362d0fcf-1427-4094-b119-8cb9af428ec0.content: {There is a distinction between authentic self-realization and imposed self-realization}, {Self-realization liberty is concerned with authentic self-realization, not imposed self-realization}, {Societal norms dictating a path for self-realization represent imposed self-realization, not authentic self-realization}, {A person coerced into following societal norms is not realizing their true self in the relevant sense of authentic self-realization}

d39ec9ac-c304-479f-967b-2ef4a6379cc1.summary: Rejecting the intuition that societal norms inherently oppress self-realization
d39ec9ac-c304-479f-967b-2ef4a6379cc1.content: {It is false that societal norms inherently oppress self-realization}, {Societal norms can provide a framework within which individuals can discover and express their authentic selves}, {The presence of societal norms does not necessarily preclude the ability to choose one's own path}, {The intuition that societal norms dictate self-realization can be mistaken if it overlooks the potential for individual agency within those norms}

877a584d-ee4a-4a08-9666-3a9f7a9c9f4b.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of individual autonomy
877a584d-ee4a-4a08-9666-3a9f7a9c9f4b.content: {Individual autonomy is a supplementary assumption that enhances self-realization liberty}, {Autonomy allows individuals to critically engage with societal norms and choose their own path}, {With the assumption of autonomy, societal norms do not dictate self-realization but serve as one of many influences}, {The objection loses its force when individual autonomy is considered as part of self-realization liberty}

cc75e413-7e86-435a-b1e5-8b5abf5e7532.content: {Freedom is the capacity to make autonomous choices}, {A person is free if they can act according to their own values and reasons}, {Autonomy does not require external validation}

5c1d9aa4-4805-40e4-ad6d-1878a4eb95df.content: {Freedom is the alignment of one's actions with one's internal values}, {A person is free if their actions are consistent with their internal beliefs and desires}, {Internal coherence does not depend on external recognition}

3a5a64e8-4406-486f-9630-f733697a29c3.content: {Freedom is the ability to determine one's own path}, {A person is free if they can set and pursue their own goals}, {Self-determination is independent of external approval}

2b957c70-6c26-47cf-ad68-e47932e17c53.content: {Freedom is the intrinsic value of self-expression}, {A person is free if they can express themselves without external constraints}, {Intrinsic value does not require external validation}

e221e555-abc3-4026-8eb1-3a9c7408236a.content: {There is a distinction between economic freedom and personal freedom}, {Economic liberty is specifically about the ability to engage in market activities without undue restriction}, {The objection confuses economic freedom with a broader notion of personal freedom}, {A person can be economically free even if they lack other forms of freedom}

45240b62-3e03-454c-92b6-ac630ab4235b.summary: Rejecting the intuition that economic freedom must encompass all freedoms
45240b62-3e03-454c-92b6-ac630ab4235b.content: {It is mistaken to assume that economic freedom must include all other forms of freedom}, {Economic liberty is a specific domain of freedom focused on market participation}, {The intuition that freedom must be all-encompassing is not necessary for the concept of economic liberty}

100eb1b2-8b0d-4420-990a-ef94c19b3a88.summary: Supplementing with a pluralistic view of freedom
100eb1b2-8b0d-4420-990a-ef94c19b3a88.content: {Freedom can be understood as a pluralistic concept with different domains}, {Economic liberty is one domain among others such as personal and political freedom}, {The objection loses its force when recognizing that economic freedom does not claim to cover all aspects of freedom}
